story:
HOTPLATE SOUTHERN KITCHEN

Owners T.R. and Mya Burns have been in the restaurant industry for over several years and each restaurant has drawn people from all over the country. The head chef TR Burns began cooking for family and friends which then turned into the strangers turned family. Hot Plate Southern means so much to the owners because hands down if you have had our fried chicken you would say the same thing. We are originators in all we do from fried chicken to vegan dishes.

Being a contributor to this campaign will add so much value to the Lehigh Valley and surrounding areas. Throughout the years we have had some challenges with chosen locations, irreconcilable landlords, and staffing failures. Honestly, some of this created a financial hardship as a business and tough decisions had to be made. Today, we have re-evaluated our past mistakes, researched our market, considered our cost-effectiveness and consulted with a financial strategist to ensure success.  Our food was never an issue therefore we are pressing on and moving forward. And we have begun the final steps in securing a property that will not only help us create Great food met the high demand of out food and expand our Vegan soul Company which feature our vegan soul food dishes.

As a contributor, you will help us expand within a new location and properly staff to the best of our ability and become a part of the community. We are an entrepreneurial driven people that love to see others succeed in the marketplace, we also understand it takes a village build and that's where you come in. At Hotplate Southern Kitchen you are bound to come in and feel like welcomed family. Our motto is Eat, Dream, Laugh & Believe.

What We Need & What You Get

We have some perks for you just to thank you for your contribution. We understand you have to believe in what you buy so we want to give you something for your belief and trust in us going forward and not disappointing.  Your contribution will go to the new location, décor, funding for equipment and of course all original events, themes, and entertainment. 

Check out our perks page as you make your contribution...

The Impact

Hot Plate provided an outlet for entrepreneurs to come and share their businesses.  We introduced toys for kids during Christmas and allowed events to be held at our Bethlehem, PA location in the past. We held book clubs, weekly meetups, bible studies, and other community outreach events at Hot Plate Southern Kitchen. We were bigger than a restaurant, we opened our doors to locals that needed a hot meal on us when needed. We fed, prayed and loved on many that came through our doors in PA and NJ over the years. 

Hot Plate Southern kitchen is needed in the Lehigh Valley because they bring diversity, unique dishes, and innovative initiatives to help others build their businesses and personal faith.  Operating in Bethlehem, PA  for 2 years was a great success and our clientele grew daily through word of mouth, social media and other outlets.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Our plan to sustain is move through the same challenges we have incurred in the past. Our focus now is to hire the right people and have a system that proves to be long-standing. Since we have had to overcome some financial obstacles in the past we understand what it will take to run a restaurant the right way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially you can help in other ways. Please share this campaign on your social media for family and friends to contribute. You can create a video testimonial to express how much you loved our restaurant no matter which location you experienced. We thank you for taking time to share, read and talk good things about Hot Plate Southern Kitchen.

Hey beer lovers! Want to take part in some choice membership-only perks with Outrun Brewing Co.? For the new low price of $1000, up to 50 rad individuals will be able to get a beer lovers layaway membership with Outrun. 
Become an Outrunner with the Beer Lovers Layaway. Membership Includes:


•Limited Edition Outrun Brewing Co. Stein


•Limited Edition Outrun Brewing Co. Layaway T-Shirt


•Early Access to seasonal and limited beer releases as well as Outrun Brewing Co. events and festivals

story:
Our Story

Hi there! Thanks for stopping by our Indiegogo campaign. 

We're Karyn and Scott Adamson; the husband and wife team behind Gaslight. Scott is the creative sign maker who has been working for the past 5 years producing handcrafted, historically inspired signage with Gaslight Sign Co. Karyn is the bubbly barista with a background in Business and Professional Photography. Gaslight was originally started with nothing more than a rusty toolbox, old tools and a lot of ambition. 5 years later we have a dedicated workshop, a strong social media following and dozens of commercial projects under our belt. We're pretty good at turning nothing into something.

 

Coming Soon...

Together, we're combining our individual skills to open a truly unique and one of a kind space: Gaslight Cafe & Neon Sign Gallery in our friendly little town of Almonte, Ontario. The idea of a gallery & cafe has been a dream of ours for a long time. We've been diligently saving all the while waiting for the stars to align on the perfect space. Recently, the opportunity to lease a historic retail space in the heart of Almonte came up, so we jumped at the chance. The space is in need of a lot of work, but we're no strangers to rolling up our sleeves and applying some elbow grease.

The space will serve as a gallery for Gaslight's original pieces of vintage inspired neon signs and artwork. It will also be a spot where people can come in and enjoy a drink and good food. Vibrant neon art, jukebox tunes, a hot coffee, a cold beer, comfort food, the warm afternoon sun, good friends and good humour. A place for visitors and locals alike. A gallery without pretension and a cafe that feels like home. We want to create the kind of place we'd want to visit everyday, and we're hoping you want to join us too.

 

Get Involved!

We'd love for you, our friends and supporters to get involved and be apart of this exciting adventure in exchange for some pretty neat perks. With your contribution you will be apart of a first of it's kind local business. You will be helping support us to do what we love to do. Plus, if your locals you will get to come in and hang out with us in the cafe, that's pretty cool too, right?

 

Other Ways To Support

We understand not everyone is in a position to donate financially, but there are other ways to lend a helping hand:

Spread the word! Share our campaign with your friends and family and your friend's family and your... you get the idea. You can easily share the campaign directly on Facebook and other outlets by clicking the share buttons at the top of the page.

Follow our progress on social media. We'll be posting updates here:

https://www.facebook.com/gaslightelectric/

https://www.instagram.com/gaslightelectric/

We hope that you follow us along on this exciting adventure and hope see you at the cafe soon!

Thank you for all your support! 

Karyn & Scott

story:
ENGLISH VERSION BELOW!

"Unique, personnalisé, gourmand"

"La Miam Factory" est une jeune start-up belge fondée en 2016, composée de 7 membres. Nous proposons des produits personnalisables à la demande, grâce à des nouvelles technologies de précision encore inégalées : l'impression 3D ainsi que le marquage au laser. Nous utilisons du chocolat de couverture, d'origine belge, sans utilisation d'un quelconque additif.

Aujourd'hui, nous lançons ce crowdfunding afin que vous nous aidiez dans le développement de notre entreprise. Il a pour objectif  de vous proposer des chocolats conçus par vous et pour vous. Ceux-ci serviront de cadeaux gourmands et uniques pour les fêtes de fin d'année, mais qui peuvent aussi très bien servir pour d'autres événements plus spécifiques, tels que les anniversaires, mariages, et bien d'autres. 

Nous croyons au mélange d'un des meilleurs chocolats, concocté par le chocolatier belge Darcis, associé à la personnalité et l'unicité que vous allez donner à votre chocolat. Voulez-vous y croire avec nous? 

       Marquage au laser                                                Impression  3D                     

Ce que vous recevez

Votre soutien ne sera pas vain! A chacune de vos contributions, vous recevrez évidemment des chocolats de la plus haute qualité, personnalisés par La Miam Factory. Plusieurs produits sont disponibles:

  1. "Tasty Memory": Un grand chocolat de 14x10cm personnalisé pour vous avec le design que vous désirez. Notre objectif est de vous apporter, comme son nom l'indique, un "souvenir gourmand" à partager . C'est pourquoi nous allons développer la photo réelle et l'insérer dans votre emballage avec le chocolat! Juste pour vous, 100 pièces sont offertes au prix Early Birds!

   Exemple de "Tasty Memory": Photo en chocolat + vraie photo développée en-dessous

     2. "Mixed designs": Vous choisissez un modèle de design que vous préférez et vous pouvez personnaliser le message! Trois modèles sont proposés: Flocon de neige (Snow Flake), Père Noël qui tombe dans une cheminée (Santa Klaus), et la Couronne de Noël (Christmas' wreath). Tous ces produits sont créés à partir de nos deux technologies, l’impression 3D et le marquage au laser. Nous les combinons pour que vous puissiez profiter de deux types de motifs et de deux sortes de chocolat (lait+ noir) dans un seul aliment! Délicieux! 

Exemple du flocon de neige avec un message personnalisé

      3. "The Big Tree": Cet élément vous montre la grande possibilité de conception avec la technologie d'impression 3D, toujours complémentée du marquage au laser. De plus, nous vous proposons un autre chocolat, type mignonnette, qui peut être agrémenté du message que vous voulez et de votre signature, ou autre, sur son socle!

Exemple de personnalisation de "The Big Tree": message personnalisé  + signature

     4. "All-in-One": Ce pack est composé de TOUS les produits, et notamment des 3 types de "Mixed Designs" avec un message personnalisé pour chacun des produits! C'est le moyen idéal pour des cadeaux multiples lors de ces fêtes de fin d'année.

En pratique

Après votre commande, c'est là que le jeu commence! Vous recevrez automatiquement un courrier électronique vous expliquant les étapes à suivre afin de nous envoyer votre photo, votre message, etc. à personnaliser. N'oubliez donc pas de consulter votre boîte aux lettres (même vos courriers indésirables) pour vous assurer de recevoir ces informations essentielles!

La livraison aura lieu dans un point-relais qu'il vous sera communiqué entre le 16 et le 22 décembre, juste avant Noël !

Ce que nous ferons de vos contributions

Depuis 2016, de nombreuses améliorations ont été apportées à nos technologies. Aujourd'hui, grâce à votre soutien financier, nous poursuivrons l'amélioration de l'ensemble du processus de production, sur 5 points précis:

  • Premièrement, ces fonds nous aideront à acheter du matériel supplémentaire et de nouvelles machines. Ainsi, nous pourrons remplacer nos prototypes (déjà fonctionnels) par des machines plus robustes, améliorant par conséquent notre productivité.
  • Deuxièmement, nous avons besoin d’espace pour nos activités. Une partie conséquente des fonds récoltés par ce crowdfunding sera utilisée pour acquérir de nouveaux locaux. Ils comprendront une zone de production, une zone de stockage et un bureau. De nature minimalistes, c’est tout ce dont nous avons besoin si nous voulons apporter le bonheur autour de nous avec nos produits.
  • Troisièmement, nous souhaitons mettre au point un système de transport/livraison sûr. Notre objectif est de vous fournir des produits dans un parfait état. En effet, ils sont très fragiles et les sociétés de transport traditionnelles ne nous conviennent pas encore.

  • De plus, nous travaillons sur la recherche et développement d'un emballage multifonction et plus adapté à nos différents produits.

  • Enfin, ces fonds serviront au développement d'un nouveau site Web. Cela inclut un nouveau design, une meilleure mise en valeur de nos produits, et la création d'un e-shop. Ces démarches vous permettront de commander plus aisément et rapidement vos chocolats personnalisés.

Risques et défis à surmonter

Chaque nouveau projet est exposé à des risques et à des défis. Nous ne pouvons garantir que tout ira bien. Les produits que nous proposons sont toujours fabriqués à l'aide de prototypes et la qualité du résultat n'est pas "standardisée". Il faut un certain temps pour obtenir un résultat parfait et ce dernier varie en fonction du type de personnalisation demandé. Cela représente le principal défi car, comme dit précédemment, chaque image possède ce caractère unique et nous nous démenons afin que vous soyez fiers d'offrir ces cadeaux.

L'intégrité du cadeau lors de la livraison est un autre point crucial. Nos produits sont fragiles et nécessitent une attention particulière, sinon leur intégrité n'est pas garantie. Nous devons encore optimiser le système de livraison et nous ferons de notre mieux pour conserver toute la qualité de vos chocolats! Nous utiliserons pour la campagne le système de points-relais, ce qui semble être une bonne alternative puisque consiste en des livraisons groupées et localisées.

D'autres manières de nous aider

Si notre projet vous intéresse, mais que vous ne pouvez pas contribuer, ne vous en voulez pas! Nous sommes vraiment déjà reconnaissants que vous aimiez ce que nous faisons.

Néanmoins, il existe de nombreux moyens pour nous aider, si vous avez le temps et la volonté de le faire:

- Vous pouvez nous suivre sur #Facebook, Instagram et LinkedIn, simplement en aimant notre page "La Miam Factory". Mieux encore, partager notre campagne sur les médias sociaux nous aiderait certainement!

- En outre, nous serions si heureux que vous partagiez le message avec vos amis, votre famille et même au travail. Cela nous fera vivre réellement parmi vous tous!

- N'oubliez pas de vérifier les mises à jour de la campagne afin de vous tenir au courant de notre avancement.

- Vous êtes uniques, ne doutez jamais de ça! Recherchez toujours des produits et des expériences conçus pour vous et non pour tout le monde.

Encore une fois, MERCI pour votre soutien!

Equipe de "La Miam Factory".

English Version

"Unique, tasty, natural"

"The Miam Factory" is a young Belgian start-up founded in 2016, composed of 7 members. We offer customizable products on demand, thanks to new and unmatched precision technologies: 3D printing and laser marking. Chocolate is the food from which we work, without adding or removing any material during our manufacturing processes.

Today, we are launching this crowdfunding with the aim of offering you chocolates designed by you and for you. These will serve as tasty and unique gifts for upcoming Christmas periods, but can serve very well for other more specific events, such as birthday parties, weddings, and many more. Your support will help us enormously in the development of our company.

We believe in mixing one of the best chocolates, produced by the Belgian chocolate maker Darcis, associated with the personality and the uniqueness that you will give to your chocolate. Do you want to believe it with us?

Laser engraving                                                                             3D printing 

 

What You Get

 

By helping us with your contributions, you will obviously receive finest quality chocolates personalized by La Miam Factory.  Several perks are available:

  1. "Tasty Memory" : One large chocolate of 14x10cm personalized for you with the design you desire. Our goal is to bring you a useful memory. That's why we're going to develop the real design with a photograph and put it in your packaging with the chocolate! Just for you, 100 pieces are offered with Early Birds price! 

​

Sample of "Tasty Memory" 

     2. "Mixed Designs": You choose the design template you prefer, and you can personalize the message on it! These items use both of our technologies, in 3D printing and engraving. We combine them for you so you can enjoy two types of designs and two types of chocolate, in a single item! Yummy!

Sample of "Mixed Designs"

     3. "The Big Tree": This item shows you the great possibility of design with the 3D printing technology. Plus, we offer you another chocolate that can be customized with every message that you want and your name on the basement!

Sample of customized "The Big Tree": message + signature

     4. "All-in-one": This last product is composed by ALL the products, and especially the 3 types of "Mixed Designs" with a personalized message for each of the products! This is the perfect way for multiple gifts.

After your order, that's where the game begins! You will receive an email which explains you the steps for sending us your picture, message, etc to customize. So don't forget to look at your mailbox (even your spam box) to make sure you receive these essential information!

The delivery will occur between the 16th and the 22th December, just before Christmas Eve.

 

What we do with your contributions

 

Since 2016, lots of improvements have been done on our technologies. Unfortunately, 5 main problems are to be solved as soon as possible : 

  • Firstly, any fund will help us to buy material and build machines. Currently, we still use "functional prototypes" but nothing is optimized. Without these machines, we can't think of any perspective of development.
  • Secondly, we need space and room for our activity. Lots of the funds you help us to raise will be used for getting our own place. It includes a production area, a storing area and an office. Basically, that's all we need if we want to bring happiness around us with our products. 
  • Thirdly, the development of a safe transport and delivery system. Indeed, our products are very fragile so traditional companies of transport are not suitable for us.

  • In addition, the development of a multifunction and more suited packaging is on the menu.

  • Also, the funds will serve to design our website. For a better use of the platform, as well as the creation of an e-shop which will facilitate and make your orders quicker.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Every new project is exposed to risks and challenges. It wouldn't be fair to tell you that everything's going alright. 

The products we offer are still produced by prototypes and the quality of the design is not "standardized". It takes some time to get the perfect design, and is variable following the customization type. That represents the main challenge because as we told you, every picture has its uniqueness.

The integrity of the gift through delivery is another risk. Most of our products are really fragile and need a special care, otherwise we cannot guarantee their integrity. We still need to work on the delivery system and we will try our best to keep their full quality! We will use for the capaign the relay-points system, which sounds like a good alternative. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested by our project, but can't contribute, don't blame yourself! We really are already thankful that you like what we do. Nonetheless, lots of ways exist to help us, if you have the time and the will to do it:

- You may follow us on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn, simply by liking our page "La Miam Factory". Even better, sharing our campaign on social medias would definitely help us!

- Also, we would be so happy that you spread the word across your friends, family and even at work. This will make us live truly among all of you!

- Don't forget to check on the updates of the campain.

- You are unique, never doubt about that! Always look for products and experiences that are made for you, and not for everyone.

Again, thank you for your support!

Team "La Miam Factory".
story_txt:
ENGLISH VERSION BELOW!
"Unique, personnalisé, gourmand"
"La Miam Factory" est une jeune start-up belge fondée en 2016, composée de 7 membres. Nous proposons des produits personnalisables à la demande, grâce à des nouvelles technologies de précision encore inégalées : l'impression 3D ainsi que le marquage au laser. Nous utilisons du chocolat de couverture, d'origine belge, sans utilisation d'un quelconque additif.
Aujourd'hui, nous lançons ce crowdfunding afin que vous nous aidiez dans le développement de notre entreprise. Il a pour objectif  de vous proposer des chocolats conçus par vous et pour vous. Ceux-ci serviront de cadeaux gourmands et uniques pour les fêtes de fin d'année, mais qui peuvent aussi très bien servir pour d'autres événements plus spécifiques, tels que les anniversaires, mariages, et bien d'autres. 
Nous croyons au mélange d'un des meilleurs chocolats, concocté par le chocolatier belge Darcis, associé à la personnalité et l'unicité que vous allez donner à votre chocolat. Voulez-vous y croire avec nous? 

       Marquage au laser                                                Impression  3D                     
Ce que vous recevez
Votre soutien ne sera pas vain! A chacune de vos contributions, vous recevrez évidemment des chocolats de la plus haute qualité, personnalisés par La Miam Factory. Plusieurs produits sont disponibles:
"Tasty Memory": Un grand chocolat de 14x10cm personnalisé pour vous avec le design que vous désirez. Notre objectif est de vous apporter, comme son nom l'indique, un "souvenir gourmand" à partager . C'est pourquoi nous allons développer la photo réelle et l'insérer dans votre emballage avec le chocolat! Juste pour vous, 100 pièces sont offertes au prix Early Birds!

   Exemple de "Tasty Memory": Photo en chocolat + vraie photo développée en-dessous
     2. "Mixed designs": Vous choisissez un modèle de design que vous préférez et vous pouvez personnaliser le message! Trois modèles sont proposés: Flocon de neige (Snow Flake), Père Noël qui tombe dans une cheminée (Santa Klaus), et la Couronne de Noël (Christmas' wreath). Tous ces produits sont créés à partir de nos deux technologies, l’impression 3D et le marquage au laser. Nous les combinons pour que vous puissiez profiter de deux types de motifs et de deux sortes de chocolat (lait+ noir) dans un seul aliment! Délicieux! 
Exemple du flocon de neige avec un message personnalisé
      3. "The Big Tree": Cet élément vous montre la grande possibilité de conception avec la technologie d'impression 3D, toujours complémentée du marquage au laser. De plus, nous vous proposons un autre chocolat, type mignonnette, qui peut être agrémenté du message que vous voulez et de votre signature, ou autre, sur son socle!

Exemple de personnalisation de "The Big Tree": message personnalisé  + signature
     4. "All-in-One": Ce pack est composé de TOUS les produits, et notamment des 3 types de "Mixed Designs" avec un message personnalisé pour chacun des produits! C'est le moyen idéal pour des cadeaux multiples lors de ces fêtes de fin d'année.
En pratique
Après votre commande, c'est là que le jeu commence! Vous recevrez automatiquement un courrier électronique vous expliquant les étapes à suivre afin de nous envoyer votre photo, votre message, etc. à personnaliser. N'oubliez donc pas de consulter votre boîte aux lettres (même vos courriers indésirables) pour vous assurer de recevoir ces informations essentielles!
La livraison aura lieu dans un point-relais qu'il vous sera communiqué entre le 16 et le 22 décembre, juste avant Noël !
Ce que nous ferons de vos contributions
Depuis 2016, de nombreuses améliorations ont été apportées à nos technologies. Aujourd'hui, grâce à votre soutien financier, nous poursuivrons l'amélioration de l'ensemble du processus de production, sur 5 points précis:


Premièrement, ces fonds nous aideront à acheter du matériel supplémentaire et de nouvelles machines. Ainsi, nous pourrons remplacer nos prototypes (déjà fonctionnels) par des machines plus robustes, améliorant par conséquent notre productivité.
Deuxièmement, nous avons besoin d’espace pour nos activités. Une partie conséquente des fonds récoltés par ce crowdfunding sera utilisée pour acquérir de nouveaux locaux. Ils comprendront une zone de production, une zone de stockage et un bureau. De nature minimalistes, c’est tout ce dont nous avons besoin si nous voulons apporter le bonheur autour de nous avec nos produits.

Troisièmement, nous souhaitons mettre au point un système de transport/livraison sûr. Notre objectif est de vous fournir des produits dans un parfait état. En effet, ils sont très fragiles et les sociétés de transport traditionnelles ne nous conviennent pas encore.
De plus, nous travaillons sur la recherche et développement d'un emballage multifonction et plus adapté à nos différents produits.
Enfin, ces fonds serviront au développement d'un nouveau site Web. Cela inclut un nouveau design, une meilleure mise en valeur de nos produits, et la création d'un e-shop. Ces démarches vous permettront de commander plus aisément et rapidement vos chocolats personnalisés.

Risques et défis à surmonter
Chaque nouveau projet est exposé à des risques et à des défis. Nous ne pouvons garantir que tout ira bien. Les produits que nous proposons sont toujours fabriqués à l'aide de prototypes et la qualité du résultat n'est pas "standardisée". Il faut un certain temps pour obtenir un résultat parfait et ce dernier varie en fonction du type de personnalisation demandé. Cela représente le principal défi car, comme dit précédemment, chaque image possède ce caractère unique et nous nous démenons afin que vous soyez fiers d'offrir ces cadeaux.
L'intégrité du cadeau lors de la livraison est un autre point crucial. Nos produits sont fragiles et nécessitent une attention particulière, sinon leur intégrité n'est pas garantie. Nous devons encore optimiser le système de livraison et nous ferons de notre mieux pour conserver toute la qualité de vos chocolats! Nous utiliserons pour la campagne le système de points-relais, ce qui semble être une bonne alternative puisque consiste en des livraisons groupées et localisées.
D'autres manières de nous aider
Si notre projet vous intéresse, mais que vous ne pouvez pas contribuer, ne vous en voulez pas! Nous sommes vraiment déjà reconnaissants que vous aimiez ce que nous faisons.
Néanmoins, il existe de nombreux moyens pour nous aider, si vous avez le temps et la volonté de le faire:
- Vous pouvez nous suivre sur #Facebook, Instagram et LinkedIn, simplement en aimant notre page "La Miam Factory". Mieux encore, partager notre campagne sur les médias sociaux nous aiderait certainement!
- En outre, nous serions si heureux que vous partagiez le message avec vos amis, votre famille et même au travail. Cela nous fera vivre réellement parmi vous tous!
- N'oubliez pas de vérifier les mises à jour de la campagne afin de vous tenir au courant de notre avancement.
- Vous êtes uniques, ne doutez jamais de ça! Recherchez toujours des produits et des expériences conçus pour vous et non pour tout le monde.
Encore une fois, MERCI pour votre soutien!
Equipe de "La Miam Factory".
English Version
"Unique, tasty, natural"
"The Miam Factory" is a young Belgian start-up founded in 2016, composed of 7 members. We offer customizable products on demand, thanks to new and unmatched precision technologies: 3D printing and laser marking. Chocolate is the food from which we work, without adding or removing any material during our manufacturing processes.
Today, we are launching this crowdfunding with the aim of offering you chocolates designed by you and for you. These will serve as tasty and unique gifts for upcoming Christmas periods, but can serve very well for other more specific events, such as birthday parties, weddings, and many more. Your support will help us enormously in the development of our company.
We believe in mixing one of the best chocolates, produced by the Belgian chocolate maker Darcis, associated with the personality and the uniqueness that you will give to your chocolate. Do you want to believe it with us?

Laser engraving                                                                             3D printing 
 

What You Get
 
By helping us with your contributions, you will obviously receive finest quality chocolates personalized by La Miam Factory.  Several perks are available:
"Tasty Memory" : One large chocolate of 14x10cm personalized for you with the design you desire. Our goal is to bring you a useful memory. That's why we're going to develop the real design with a photograph and put it in your packaging with the chocolate! Just for you, 100 pieces are offered with Early Birds price! 
​
Sample of "Tasty Memory" 
     2. "Mixed Designs": You choose the design template you prefer, and you can personalize the message on it! These items use both of our technologies, in 3D printing and engraving. We combine them for you so you can enjoy two types of designs and two types of chocolate, in a single item! Yummy!

Sample of "Mixed Designs"
     3. "The Big Tree": This item shows you the great possibility of design with the 3D printing technology. Plus, we offer you another chocolate that can be customized with every message that you want and your name on the basement!

Sample of customized "The Big Tree": message + signature
     4. "All-in-one": This last product is composed by ALL the products, and especially the 3 types of "Mixed Designs" with a personalized message for each of the products! This is the perfect way for multiple gifts.
After your order, that's where the game begins! You will receive an email which explains you the steps for sending us your picture, message, etc to customize. So don't forget to look at your mailbox (even your spam box) to make sure you receive these essential information!
The delivery will occur between the 16th and the 22th December, just before Christmas Eve.
 
What we do with your contributions
 
Since 2016, lots of improvements have been done on our technologies. Unfortunately, 5 main problems are to be solved as soon as possible : 


Firstly, any fund will help us to buy material and build machines. Currently, we still use "functional prototypes" but nothing is optimized. Without these machines, we can't think of any perspective of development.
Secondly, we need space and room for our activity. Lots of the funds you help us to raise will be used for getting our own place. It includes a production area, a storing area and an office. Basically, that's all we need if we want to bring happiness around us with our products. 
Thirdly, the development of a safe transport and delivery system. Indeed, our products are very fragile so traditional companies of transport are not suitable for us.
In addition, the development of a multifunction and more suited packaging is on the menu.
Also, the funds will serve to design our website. For a better use of the platform, as well as the creation of an e-shop which will facilitate and make your orders quicker.


 
Risks & Challenges
 
Every new project is exposed to risks and challenges. It wouldn't be fair to tell you that everything's going alright. 
The products we offer are still produced by prototypes and the quality of the design is not "standardized". It takes some time to get the perfect design, and is variable following the customization type. That represents the main challenge because as we told you, every picture has its uniqueness.
The integrity of the gift through delivery is another risk. Most of our products are really fragile and need a special care, otherwise we cannot guarantee their integrity. We still need to work on the delivery system and we will try our best to keep their full quality! We will use for the capaign the relay-points system, which sounds like a good alternative. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're interested by our project, but can't contribute, don't blame yourself! We really are already thankful that you like what we do. Nonetheless, lots of ways exist to help us, if you have the time and the will to do it:
- You may follow us on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn, simply by liking our page "La Miam Factory". Even better, sharing our campaign on social medias would definitely help us!
- Also, we would be so happy that you spread the word across your friends, family and even at work. This will make us live truly among all of you!
- Don't forget to check on the updates of the campain.
- You are unique, never doubt about that! Always look for products and experiences that are made for you, and not for everyone.
Again, thank you for your support!
Team "La Miam Factory".

story:
Short Summary

First off, I want to start by saying thank you for visiting our page and taking an interest in our campaign. I am extremely excited to start this journey, especially being as how this has been my dream ever since I was a kid. To own my own restaurant has been my dream since I was about ten years old. I remember going to the Greeley Stampede, a local 4th of July rodeo, and thinking how sad it was every time the celebrations were over the carnival, music, and food would all leave and we wouldn’t see it again for another year. So, I wanted to create a restaurant that would offer most if not all these things year-round.

That is why I decided to get more experience in the restaurant industry and got my first job at McDonalds when I was only 16, but my love for the restaurant industry doesn’t start there. I have always been in the restaurants ever since I was a boy. Staying in the back office of Village Inn while my mom was serving. Just the sound of pots and pans banging together, the sizzle of a hot grill and the sound of a busy restaurant sooth me.  This passion for the restaurant industry is what drove me to become a crew trainer after only 3 months at my first job and a manager in training after only a year. I then went on to get my culinary arts certificate and Associates in Business Management. Then I moved into working at various casual dining restaurants, constantly moving my way up everywhere I went.  Even intro a General Management position where I did everything including inventory, scheduling, hiring, firing, truck orders, PR, etc. So, I am very immersed into not only the food end but the business end of the restaurant industry.

What We Sell

 Average Joes Grill and Chill will sell carnival and state fair type food. Like giant juicy burgers, giant turkey legs, homemade deep fried corn dogs, fresh made lemonade, fried Twinkies, fried Snickers and of course funnel cakes. The funnel cakes will even come in different flavors like strawberry, blueberry, and chocolate. We also will have even seasonal ones like hot chocolate and pumpkin.

What We Need & What You Get

 Average Joes is seeking $25,000 to be able to get the funding needed to get a food trailer, the equipment needed inside, and the funds for supplies. $25,000 may seem like a lot but trust me if we work together it will come faster than you know. Every little bit helps and I’ll explain how you can help us not only reach our goal with a contribution as little as $10, but to also receive amazing perks that nobody else will receive.

So, what are these great perks you can receive? Well you can earn many different perks, our easiest one being 2 free funnel cakes of your choice and Facebook recognition for only $10. You can also earn things like free meals, private tours, insight into our menu, see how the food is made, catering at an event of your choosing, t-shirts, and even a menu item named after you! Your contributions truly mean a lot to us and will really help us to reach our goal of getting this trailer up and running.

    The Impact

    Here’s how your contribution will be put to work to help us get up and running. We will us your contributions to get the trailer needed through companies that have experience in the food truck industry. We will also us these funds to purchase needed equipment like grills, fryers, fridges, freezers, etc. Finally, we will need the food necessary to sell once we are rolling so that is the final piece that this funding will be used for. Soon as the health inspector gives us the green light we will be up and rolling to your closest location!

    Now in the unfortunate situation that we are unable to earn 100% of our goal you are probably wondering what happens to your contribution. Well have no fear because Average Joes plans on still being operational. The funds will still be used to purchase needed equipment, and while we would love to receive a brand-new trailer and equipment we are not deterred from getting used equipment and a used trailer to get operational. We are also in the process of speaking with other financial institutions that will see your contributions as interest in the company as a positive. So, know that your much-needed contribution will still be put to use in order to get us up and running.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    What are some other ways you can help? I of all people am aware of the struggles we all go through on a day to day basis, and for that reason I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute on a monetary basis. Thankfully that does not mean that you cannot contribute! We highly encourage you to like our page on Facebook, facebook.com/averagejoesgrillandchill, and be sure to follow so you can receive all the latest news, updates, and locations once we are operational. Also use the share buttons on Indigogo to help share and promote this awesome opportunity for your friends and family to see! Also be sure to like and share all our posts so your friends can also be in the know and they will see that you support a local business which is always a great thing. Even doing these little things can have a tremendous effect and help a lot!

    I hope to see and hear from you all soon and lets make this happen! Take care and have a great day from Average Joes!

Also use the share buttons on Indigogo to help share and promote this awesome opportunity for your friends and family to see! Also be sure to like and share all our posts so your friends can also be in the know and they will see that you support a local business which is always a great thing. story:
THE LOWDOWN 

After years of home brewing, hosting excellent beer tastings and hearing about the demand of a Waldorf brewery - we knew opening Patuxent Brewing Company was the right thing to do! We have been working day and night to make this dream come true.  Brewing delicious craft beers, creating a tight business plan, spending time with local agriculturists, raising money, and selling merchandise has helped us get a little closer to our dreams --now we need your help!

We are aiming for a late 2018. This campaign will help us with additional equipment and offsetting some of the costs of the location, while awaiting the opening. 

With your help we will have different beers for you to try at the brewery and will also throw an amazing special release event with local, state, federal officials, and most importantly, you! If you have been to one of our tastings you know what you are in for!
 

OUR BEER - OUR GOAL

We are putting our everything into the brewery and ensuring through stakeholders that we give Waldorf what it needs. Some beers to expect are: The King's Wife IPA, Sweet Potato Bourbon, Orange Ginger, and our standard 301 Pale Ale. 

Our goal is to raise $25,000.

Please, give what you can, as anything you can do would be super appreciated. Help us reach or goal and even surpass it. The more we raise, the more we can do, the more we can aid our community! It doesn’t get any better than that! 

 

WHAT WE NEED 

Patuxent Brewing did not expect that the want for a brewery (by the local government), famers, and the community would be such a high demand.  We suspect that our current operations will not stand up to the amount of customers we now expect to receive upon opening. Your support will go to the following items in the brewery.   

  • Additional Equipment

 

YOUR IMPACT 

Many breweries have considered Waldorf for their brewery location - but did not want to take the time to go through zoning measures, and the stringent inspections we have now covered. However, Waldorf is our home and we want to share all of its wonder and eclecticness with the world of beer lovers. Some of our team have grown up in this area when it was just a forest with a few schools. Now, Waldorf is a booming mecca for young professionals, married couples, and farming communities.  With your giving and help, Charles County will soon have it's FIRST EVER CRAFT BREWERY!


WHETHER YOU CAN GIVE OR NOT 

  • Please spread the word
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Like us on Facebook (www.facebook.com/paxbrewingcompany)
  • Follow us on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/patuxentbrewingco/)
  • Get the word out about our campaign

Together we will do awesome things by bringing a brewery to Waldorf!

story:
Short Summary

Over the past two years, we have loved serving our doughnuts and coffee to our city. We are looking for help from you, our amazing customers, to take the next step.

  • We are Coy and Sara Trammel the owners of Bristol doughnut Company. We have been married for 14 year and have 4 kids (Emma, Ella, Ruby, and Roscoe).
  • With your support we will have the ability to fry more doughnuts through out the day, which means fresher doughnuts much faster. 
  • This mean not selling out early and having fresh doughnuts throughout the day.

 

What We Need

  • There are 3 main pieces of equipment that will allow us to bring you classy and handcrafted doughnuts.
    • A Dough Sheeter | This allows us to roll out the dough quickly and evenly.
    • Proof Box | This allows us to proof the dough in a controlled environment. Producing a more consistent product. 
    • One amazing Glorious Doughnut Fryer! |  The fryer allows us to fry about 40 doughnuts at a time, as opposed to our current fryer which is 6-9 at a time.  

 

The Impact

  • Currently we make all our doughnuts in a shared rented kitchen which has a ton a great equipment, but not all of it is great for the task of making doughnuts.
  • As we move into our own kitchen we would love to resource our space with the doughnut equipment we need to deliver the best possible product. 
  • Having this equipment will have a HUGE impact. One that we will feel every day, as we make, proof, and fry the doughnuts. Also, this is an impact you feel because we will freed up to make dough more consistently and in much larger batches so you won't have to come in only to find out we have sold out early. We know this hurts us as much as it hurts you. :)
  • Moving out of a rented kitchen also allows us to create a cafe space for you. Our new storefront will include a full espresso bar and plenty of seating for you to enjoy coffee and doughnuts with the people you love, creating meaningful moments, in a beautiful space.

 

Risks & Challenges

We know that is owning and operating our own space will come with new challenges and we have a lot to learn, but we have never shied away from a challenge.

  • Over the past 2 years of business we have made it our goal to get doughnuts out fresh everyday of the week. From the day Sara was in labor and frying doughnuts, to the day Coy was car-jacked coming back to the kitchen, and even when Lindsey was all by herself with no electricity frying doughnuts by the light of her phone. We were open and ready with freshly fried doughnuts. 
  • With a little hard work, determination, and a bunch of crazy we built this company from nothing and we are just crazy enough to take the next step. 
  • Your support has been the key to success thus far and we know it's key moving forward.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know what it means to live on a tight budget and not everyone can contribute monetarily. It would still mean so much to us if you would consider sharing our campaign with your friends. 
  • Just use the Indiegogo share tools above!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Over the past two years, we have loved serving our doughnuts and coffee to our city. We are looking for help from you, our amazing customers, to take the next step.

We are Coy and Sara Trammel the owners of Bristol doughnut Company. We have been married for 14 year and have 4 kids (Emma, Ella, Ruby, and Roscoe).
With your support we will have the ability to fry more doughnuts through out the day, which means fresher doughnuts much faster. 
This mean not selling out early and having fresh doughnuts throughout the day.

 

What We Need
There are 3 main pieces of equipment that will allow us to bring you classy and handcrafted doughnuts.
A Dough Sheeter | This allows us to roll out the dough quickly and evenly.
Proof Box | This allows us to proof the dough in a controlled environment. Producing a more consistent product. 
One amazing Glorious Doughnut Fryer! |  The fryer allows us to fry about 40 doughnuts at a time, as opposed to our current fryer which is 6-9 at a time.  



 
The Impact

Currently we make all our doughnuts in a shared rented kitchen which has a ton a great equipment, but not all of it is great for the task of making doughnuts.
As we move into our own kitchen we would love to resource our space with the doughnut equipment we need to deliver the best possible product. 
Having this equipment will have a HUGE impact. One that we will feel every day, as we make, proof, and fry the doughnuts. Also, this is an impact you feel because we will freed up to make dough more consistently and in much larger batches so you won't have to come in only to find out we have sold out early. We know this hurts us as much as it hurts you. :)
Moving out of a rented kitchen also allows us to create a cafe space for you. Our new storefront will include a full espresso bar and plenty of seating for you to enjoy coffee and doughnuts with the people you love, creating meaningful moments, in a beautiful space.


 
Risks & Challenges
We know that is owning and operating our own space will come with new challenges and we have a lot to learn, but we have never shied away from a challenge.

Over the past 2 years of business we have made it our goal to get doughnuts out fresh everyday of the week. From the day Sara was in labor and frying doughnuts, to the day Coy was car-jacked coming back to the kitchen, and even when Lindsey was all by herself with no electricity frying doughnuts by the light of her phone. We were open and ready with freshly fried doughnuts. 
With a little hard work, determination, and a bunch of crazy we built this company from nothing and we are just crazy enough to take the next step. 
Your support has been the key to success thus far and we know it's key moving forward.


 
Other Ways You Can Help

We know what it means to live on a tight budget and not everyone can contribute monetarily. It would still mean so much to us if you would consider sharing our campaign with your friends. 
Just use the Indiegogo share tools above!

story:
Street Beet 100% Vegan Comfort Food

Street Beet was started by two friends with a common interest- to make the most delicious vegan food we could dream up! Both being vegan and living in Detroit, we had very limited dining options available to us. We shared nostalgic cravings for the foods we grew up eating like mac and cheese, fried chicken, and Taco Bell! We asked ourselves, how can we make these familiar foods that everyone loves out of plants? So, we quit our day jobs and dove straight into what would become the most important endeavor of our lives, Street Beet!

Today, our events draw diverse crowds of hundreds of people who wait in long lines that wrap around the block. While most of our guests are from Metro Detroit, our social media following of over 15,000 has attracted travelers from New York, Chicago, Pennsylvania, and Canada. This year we were named “Best Pop Up Dining Experience” by Hour Detroit Magazine, we participated in the Forbes 30 under 30 Food Festival, and we have received national and local recognition from P.E.T.A,  VegNews, Metro Times, The Detroit News, WDET and so many more. 

Our food does not have barriers. We provide a menu and an experience that is safe and inclusive for people of all cultural backgrounds, all religions, all races, and all ages. We believe in making sure nobody is ever left out and everyone feels welcome. Our food is not just for vegans. Our menu caters to folks with all different needs. Whether you are limited due to health reasons or religious beliefs, you have a food allergy, or you just want to eat more plant-based, our food is for you! When we open to the public at our Brick & Mortar, we will be providing consistent access to affordable, sustainable, allergen-friendly vegan comfort food! 

Without a space to call home, Street Beet is at a stand-still. Pop-ups are incredibly taxing mentally and physically, and unpredictable (in pretty much every way). We want to serve food out of a space of our own so we can rely on the efficiency and function of our own equipment, and no longer be limited with storage space available to us. We desperately want to stop breaking the news (to people who have traveled and waited) that we have sold out of food. A restaurant of our own will allow us to shorten wait times and feed more people. Rather than hosting a few events per month, we could be open all of the time!

We love what we do, and we want to do this forever. We need this money to begin the buildout for our very FIRST restaurant here in Detroit. Thank you for your consideration in helping us get there!

If you cannot contribute monetarily, we sincerely appreciate you sharing this link.

story:
For us, the most rewarding part of being restaurateurs is being able to share life experiences with our restaurant's guests.  Over the course of a few years and after several family gatherings for holidays or birthday celebrations or children’s christenings, we forge lasting bonds with our guests and get to share in their experiences; essentially adding branches to our own family tree.

When not operating our restaurant, our favorite past time is traveling to different areas and learning about their cultural differences and, of course, having the ability to sample their cuisine. 

Many of our travels have centered on the Caribbean visiting such places as San Juan, Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Mexico, Belize, Cuba, Jamaica and many other Caribbean nations.  Certain restaurants such as Marmalade in San Juan or Hidden Treasure Restaurant in Belize have exceeded our expectations and served to peek our interests in Caribbean cuisine.  We now want to share our experiences and our passion for this cuisine with our community. 
 

NOLA CAYE will seek to combine

New Orleans’ charm, culture and its genuine sense of hospitality with the bold, fresh flavors of the Caribbean.

The word "CAYE" eludes to a small island giving the restaurant's name a literal translation of "New Orleans Island" or "Isle of New Orleans."  The port of New Orleans close proximity to the Caribbean nations and the historical influences from these nations that served to create the identity of New Orleans itself provide a most fitting setting to showcase authentic representations of these nation's most popular dishes.

It is our desire to create a thriving neighborhood eatery that will benefit our shareholders, our employees, our investors and ultimately our community.

Laissez les bons temps rouler!!!

 

About the Owners

 

Bryan and Brooke Zar are restauranteurs with a combined 44 years of professional experience in the hospitality industry.  Most notable experience (Bryan 5 years, Brooke 3 years) was obtained through Hillstone Restaurant Group, aka Houston’s.  Here is a brief note on Houston’s:

 

“Welcome to Houston’s, an American institution since 1977, where our versions of the classics allow the exceptional quality of the ingredients to take center stage. Everything at Houston’s is prepared daily from scratch and each plate is composed with a thoughtful attention to detail. Known for atmospheric spaces influenced over the years by architects such as Frank Lloyd Wright, Houston’s has a modern feel with a sense of history. Our service strives to be timely and graceful thereby allowing you to focus on the important things: enjoying good company over a fine meal.”   -www.houstons.com

 

Over the past 41 years, Hillstone Restaurant Group has developed an evolved set of criteria which, when applied correctly, will result in a restaurant’s continued growth and success.  Here are the basic fundamentals:

 

  • Provide made from scratch menu items composed of fresh, quality ingredients;
  • Thoughtfully plate each dish with a precise attention to detail
  • Served by a friendly and accommodating staff
  • In a setting designed to provide maximum comfort with a modern sense of sophistication    

 

Bryan and Brooke Zar have applied their experiences with Houston’s into their successful 9+year operation of Restaurant des Familles.  Having purchased Restaurant des Familles in July of 2009 at a time when the restaurant was suffering from decreased sales and near the point of closure, the implementation of these fundamentals produced tremendous sales growth and regained guest loyalties. 

 

Their first six years of ownership provided many obstacles to overcome, most notably Hurricane Isaac (out of business for 10 days) and the BP oil spill.  Despite a few ups and downs, Bryan and Brooke Zar have realized a tremendous transformation between the restaurant they purchased in 2009 and the current restaurant.

 

Since July 2009, over $450,000 worth of improvements have been invested in Restaurant des Familles.  Bryan and Brooke Zar have renovated the entire space including the front patio which now includes a paved courtyard with a stone fireplace, the bar, the dining room, the restrooms, and the kitchen and have purchased new equipment throughout. 

 

Their investment has not gone without notice.  The year prior to the purchase produced an annual sales revenue of $550,000.  In 2018, Restaurant des Familles’ annual sales revenue exceeded $1,600,000. 

 

Other factors leading to the restaurant’s growth have been improved marketing, improved daily management, more consistent recipe guidelines and a new “made-from-scratch” kitchen philosophy whereas Restaurant des Familles produces all of its own sauces, salad dressings, soups, desserts, etc.

 

Now that Restaurant des Familles has an established nine years of continued sales growth, a well-trained management and employee staff, and a loyal stock of regular guests, the time has come to expand. 

 

NOLA CAYE is currently an idea and vision shared by Bryan and Brooke Zar.  The concept has a menu with tested recipes and a design palate with tasteful use of modern elements. 

 

All other factors needed to open NOLA CAYE including, but not limited to, leased location, design / architectural plans, corporate creation, website, permits, etc. are at the ready.  Upon obtaining the necessary capital to buildout out the restaurant space, purchase equipment and purchase beginning inventories, Bryan and Brooke Zar are ready to capitalize on their expertise and make NOLA CAYE an instance success. 

 

The most efficient method to learn about Bryan and Brooke Zar and their desire to succeed is to dine in their restaurant.  The experience received is difficult to summarize in words, but it will be an experience not soon forgotten. 


 

NOLA CAYE will be a neighborhood restaurant and bar specializing in Caribbean cuisine.  The menu will feature authentic made-from-scratch recipes with modern presentations.  The restaurant’s décor will reflect a contemporary, modern atmosphere presented in a tasteful, sophisticated manner.

 

NOLA CAYE will be a full service, fast-casual concept with the ability to provide its patrons with quality cuisine made with fresh ingredients in a very short amount of time.  This ideal will be one of the most important competitive advantages allowing NOLA CAYE to stand out amongst the numerous eateries in the area. 

 

NOLA CAYE will offer its diners authentic, made-from-scratch Caribbean cuisine in a setting designed to provide maximum comfort through thoughtful use of modern design elements such as wood, metal and concrete.

 

NOLA CAYE will source its food ingredients from reputable, local purveyors who shares its passion to deliver the absolute best possible product to NOLA CAYE’s guests.

 

NOLA CAYE will employ genuinely friendly and accommodating individuals who will thrive in the fast-paced environment offered by the restaurant business.  These individuals will be properly trained to provide NOLA CAYE’s diners with efficient, friendly and accommodating service.

 

NOLA CAYE’s commitment to outstanding professional service, high-quality food, and an attractive environment with an upscale, high-energy ambiance will distinguish it from other industry competitors. 

 

NOLA CAYE will strive to exceed the expectations of its guests throughout every facet of the dining experience.

 

NOLA CAYE’s success will be measured in employee and guest retention, shareholder profits and continued returns for our investors.

 

 

Mission Statement

We are not just selling food, beer & wine; we are selling comfort by:

  • providing made from scratch menu items composed of fresh, quality ingredients;
  • thoughtfully plating each dish with a precise attention to detail
  • served by a friendly and accommodating staff
  • in an inspired setting designed with a modern sense of sophistication.    
  •  

www.nolacaye.com

www.facebook.com/nolacaye

story:
Overview

Baking is an enjoyable activity. Especially when your creation turns out exactly like the recipe! Have you ever wanted to expand your knowledge of general baking techniques? Or try your hand in French patisserie?  

Great! You landed on the right page! Access a new online baking masterclass to start you on your baking journey. From anywhere in the world!

 

 

Experience Luxury French Patisserie at your fingertips

 

The Learn How To Bake Masterclass is ideal for any one. Regardless of your culinary or baking experience. The course content has three skill levels (Basic, Intermediate, & Advanced). 

 

 

 

 Why the Masterclass?

 

Attending baking (or culinary) schools cost tens of thousands. Which are a significant investment of your time. This Masterclass will show you techniques present in most professional baking schools worldwide. 

Cost should never be a barrier for anyone pursuing a career in baking. High quality baking content should be fun, affordable, and easy to learn!

 

 

 

 

Impress anyone with your new culinary skills!

 

 

The courses & eBook content will be available in the following languages:

 

 

 

 Our Timeline

 

 

 

 Xeniya's story

 

 

 

 Testimonials

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Investment 

 

Your contribution will help us create a platform to launch the Learn How To Bake Masterclass.

The content will be accessible via web and mobile. Filming of the Masterclass will begin in November 2019 followed by post-production. The content will release in December 2019.

 

 

 Risks & Challenges

 

There is an element of risk with any new project. We are confident that this platform will be a success and have a great team to mitigate any potential risks. 

 

Connect With Us!

Thanks for visiting! Be sure to leave a comment in the tab above for any additional questions. Alternatively, feel free to visit us on Facebook, Instagram, and Linkedin.

Stay tune for more updates throughout the campaign!

story:
Hello.  My name is Jafar Thorne. I'm a foodie and life-long lover of spice. In 2007, I started making this hot sauce for my annual holiday gifting. It's become such a prized commodity amongst my friends and family over the years that a few of them got together on their own and devised a plan to bring it to market. Basically, one day they informed me I was the founder of a hot sauce company ... and why not? As our Chief Instigating Officer Dave McCary said, "You've already done the hardest part—making something that people will tell their friends about."

Thanks to Dave's efforts, and the generosity of our dear friend, Pan Alberts, to date we've tested and refined the recipe with a commercial food-packer, obtained nutritional analysis and approval from the FDA, trademarked our brand, and now stand on the precipice of brewing up our first commercial batch—which brings us to this Indiegogo Campaign ...

The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds for the production of the first 500 bottles, professionally design the labels, create marketing materials, and bring Third Eye Polish to the world. If successful, we'll raise enough from those 500 bottles to make the next batch, and get this spicy snowball rolling. 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET
Our goal of $10,000 will be used for production of the first batch of 500 bottles, professional graphic design of the labels, the design and production of various TEP gift items to be used as perks in the Indiegogo campaign, and shipping for promotional bottles.

For the perks, we have hot sauce for you (and your friends), laser-etched pint glasses, O.G. Sponsor t-shirts, and hoodies. What we really wish is to send a bottle of Polish from our fridge to yours.

THE IMPACT
We believe in better living through capsaicin. We want to embolden your Bloody Marys, turn up your tacos, and pizazzify your pizza. While we love the heat, we believe a hot sauce cannot be judged by spice alone and should have a distinct flavor that compliments whatever you add it to. That's why we developed TEP to have a strong garlic-forward flavor profile, balanced by the tartness of lime, the sweetness of tequila, and the robust smokiness of roasted chiles. 

The artwork on the bottle is inspired by the work of artist Stephen “The Pizz” Pizzuro, an icon of the low-brow art tradition who took part in an exhibition of blotter art and created the inspiration for the Third Eye Polish mascot. 

Lunazul tequila, a 100% blue agave tequila, is used in every bottle, providing a unique balance to the garlic and peppers. We chose Lunazul not only for the flavor, but also for their philanthropic work protecting the native wolves of Mexico. 

It is a pleasure to be able to work with artisans who share our love of art, culture, and preservation of the natural world. 

Your contribution is what will make the dream a reality—a bottle of Polish for every fridge.

CHALLENGES
Our biggest challenge will be to get the word out. We're not planning on spending much on advertising at first, instead depending on word of mouth. Once people have tasted Third Eye Polish, they're almost universally hooked, so it's our hope that we'll be able to enlist the help of our friends and fans to share the sauce far and wide. We've already seen this work with our Facebook page and the sauce isn't even available yet!  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can let other spiceheads know about us by purchasing a bottle and bringing it to a party, or letting us know about your favorite ways to use Third Eye Polish.

That's why we developed TEP to have a strong garlic-forward flavor profile, balanced by the tartness of lime, the sweetness of tequila, and the robust smokiness of roasted chiles. 
The artwork on the bottle is inspired by the work of artist Stephen “The Pizz” Pizzuro, an icon of the low-brow art tradition who took part in an exhibition of blotter art and created the inspiration for the Third Eye Polish mascot. 
Lunazul tequila, a 100% blue agave tequila, is used in every bottle, providing a unique balance to the garlic and peppers. We chose Lunazul not only for the flavor, but also for their philanthropic work protecting the native wolves of Mexico. 
It is a pleasure to be able to work with artisans who share our love of art, culture, and preservation of the natural world. 
Your contribution is what will make the dream a reality—a bottle of Polish for every fridge.
CHALLENGESOur biggest challenge will be to get the word out. We're not planning on spending much on advertising at first, instead depending on word of mouth. Once people have tasted Third Eye Polish, they're almost universally hooked, so it's our hope that we'll be able to enlist the help of our friends and fans to share the sauce far and wide. We've already seen this work with our Facebook page and the sauce isn't even available yet!  
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPEven if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can let other spiceheads know about us by purchasing a bottle and bringing it to a party, or letting us know about your favorite ways to use Third Eye Polish.

story:
We're hard at work planning our path to bringing fruited, superfruited and non-fruited spontaneous and controlled wild fermentation sours and funk to the New Jersey Highlands.

We've signed a lease on our future 5,600sf home, with a space that includes a 500sf loft that will house a stainless steel coolship to capture the rich Sussex County microflora, basically where we’ll Mine The Wild. Below the coolship will be a large barrel room as well as a 5bbl brewhouse.

We're currently crowdfunding with three options for The Muckraker Guild, our bottle society. The first is a one-year membership that includes 6 bottles of your choosing and a magnum of your choosing, as well as guaranteed allotments for each release. The second includes 12 bottles and 2 magnums, as well as guaranteed double allotments. The third, the cheapest, just guarantees you the right to buy and set aside the allotments for pickup.

Each membership begins on the day of our first release, and is renewable yearly, and is transferrable. Check us out on Untappd to get an idea of how people feel about our beer.

In the first year, you can expect to see beers like:

*Brett b with tropical fruit fermented in a cognac barrel
*Brett c with pineapple in a rum barrel
*A bug blend fermented in neutral oak with raspberries
*Brett l with cherries in madeira and sherry barrels
*Brett naard with strawberries in a rose barrel
*Brett nanus with lingonberry in a zinfindel barrel
*Brett a with lemon, pineapple and orange in a gin barrel
*Oak-barrel fermented kettle soured berliners with tropical fruit, with sour cherries, with blueberries, with raspberries, with peaches, with nectarines, with plums.
*A line of high ABV berry beers, like a 14% tart blueberry ale
*And much more

The current plan is to start releasing 100% spontaneous fermentation beers in year two.

We also plan to use the brewery as a vehicle for charitable causes, mainly to benefit animals, the environment and children in need. It’s important to us that the brewery give back however we can.

We're looking forward to being part of the Franklin community and cannot wait to see you next summer!

story:
In A Nutshell

An amazing cup of coffee shouldn’t be a rare experience – it should happen every day.  But… it doesn’t.  It just doesn’t.  The stuff on the grocery store shelves and at most local coffee shops are old (sometimes really old!), they are selling coffee beans that are weeks or months past their prime. You see, coffee beans are in their pinnacle of perfection 5-21 days after they’re roasted.  After that, flavor notes and aromas start to degrade. It doesn’t have to be this way!

Imagine starting your day with the perfect cup of coffee, made from high quality beans, expertly roasted and arriving at your door at their pinnacle of flavor.  Everyone deserves that!  With this thought in mind, I opened the first coffee roastery in Washington County, Maryland and word spread like wildfire!  Just months later, we have a loyal customer base we couldn’t have imagined possible!  Our growth has been incredible – and we’re so grateful!  Unfortunately, it means that we’ve outgrown our small roaster.  Little Carson just can’t keep up, and we need your help to buy a larger roaster and take River Bottom Roasters to the next level.

So… Why Should You Help Us?       

Several reasons!  Besides our commitment to kindness and paying every kindness forward, we’re also really serious about getting things right.  That means we respect the farmers who grow our coffee beans by always paying them a fair and livable wage for their work, and we respect our customers by roasting each batch to order and getting the fresh beans to your door within days.   

 

  • “Better Beans, Better World!”  That’s our tagline, and we mean it!  We think running a business is about more than turning a profit, and we believe everyone deserves a chance to thrive.  From our commitment to source only single origin, direct or fair trade beans to our partnerships with local charities like Boys & Girls Club, these ideas govern everything we do.  Call us radicals, but we think doing good is simply good business! 
  • At River Bottom Roasters, we source only single origin beans – and never from a trading floor.  That means, we not only know the name of the region our coffee comes from, we know the name of the farm.   
  •  Gonna be honest, here – we know the names of our customers, too.  We’re a family here at River Bottom, and we count our customers as members.  No matter how big we get, we never want to lose the heart that beats at our center.  People matter to us.  They always will.

What Will We Do With The Money You Entrust To Us?

We want to start by thanking you for reading this far.  We know you can choose how you spend your money, and the fact you are considering helping our company grow is huge.  Huger than huge.  In fact, it’s humongous.  From the depths of us – thank you. With your contribution, we will:

  • Purchase a Mill City Roaster – which has an international reputation as one of the best small batch roasters in the world.  It’s capable of roasting nearly 40 lbs. of green coffee per hour – which would not only allow us to keep up with current demand, but would be large enough to accommodate our ever growing loyal customer base. 
  • Construct a larger roasting facility.  While we ship our specialty coffee all over the world, our goal has always been to also have a small storefront.  Not only would this provide our local customers a place to stop in to pick up their favorite beans (or just say hi), it would allow River Bottom Roasters to create new jobs in the community – jobs earmarked for disadvantaged youth.  Working closely with the Boys & Girls Club, we have seen, time and again, the difference opportunity can make.  Everyone deserves a chance to thrive.    
  • Purchase coffee packaging equipment and kitchen supplies.  Every bag we sell supports an organization that will give others a hand up, or a hand out, if they need it.

All of the money we raise will go toward these efforts.  Of course, these goals will cost more than the $50,000 we’ve set for this campaign.  We’re putting our skin in the game, too!  We believe in what we’re doing.  We believe that treating people fairly, helping those who need it, and providing a ridiculously good product is a winning combination!  Will you join us?

What You Get

I mean, have you seen the perks?! You should definitely be a mob boss, have a coffee named after you, or maybe just get an awesome piece of River Bottom swag! We are simply pre-selling coffee which you are guaranteed to get - no matter if we raise the funds or not! My integrity means too much to me not fulfill that promise. 

** If we make our goal, the highest donor even gets to name our new roaster!  That’s right!  We’ll engrave the name you choose (within reason, lol!) on a plaque and attach it to our new machine!  You’ll be an indelible part of our history!

Risks and Challenges

I think about risks and challenges all the time, and that drives me to make sure everything I do is with intent and purpose. If I see a problem, I fix it – immediately.  When I’m committed to something, I want it to be good - damn good – shake in your boots good – and believe me, I’m committed to River Bottom Roasters.  I will earn the trust you place in me, and I will make this company thrive! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself reading this and want to contribute, but just can’t at this time, please consider supporting us on social media: like our Facebook page, forward our website (www.riverbottomroasters.com)to your friends, and talk about River Bottom Roasters! 

Please also share our Indiegogo campaign with your family, friends, and any other coffee-loving, philanthropic-minded person you know.  Word of mouth is a powerful thing!  We’re out to change the world, and we’re grateful for your help!  Thank you!

story:
Who we are & what we believe: 

Dave, Hans and Katie, along with their talented staff of employees and apprentices, work hard to promote local, organic agriculture.  The farm is home to: 

  • organic grains like wheat, oats, corn, soybeans, and hay 
  • pastured cows, pigs and chickens 
  • 25 acres of organic vegetables, herbs, flowers and fruit  
  • Restored native habitats, like our prairie and wooded preserves

We believe in the potential of local food and small, family farms. Our hope is that this project will help us to help other farmers and the local food movement as a whole.

What We Need & What You Get

We believe one of the answers to growing the local food movement is to help smaller farmers get their product to larger marketplaces. This will create opportunity, awareness, and financial security. We are already making deliveries to Chicago, Springfield, Bloomington and Champaign but our trucks aren't full when we deliver. 

But what if we could act as an aggregate for smaller, organic farms? They could drop off their product at our farm, in our new storage facility - large enough to accommodate them, and we could deliver it on their behalf. 

And what if we had more space to safely, wash, pack and store our own crops? It would allow us to grow more, employ more, and ultimately feed more.  Imagine being able to find local, organic food 365 days a year. 

All we need is some help to fund the building. 

Here's the breakdown: 

The total cost of the building. concrete and coolers: $220,000

We received grants for $37,500 and $14,000 in 2018 to partially fund this project.

We are hoping to raise $43,500 from our community through this crowdfunding initiative.  (there are approx $5000 in fees/costs associated) 

That leaves us with a loan for $119,980. We have saved 20% for the downpayment which leaves financing $95,984.00 through a loan we've been approved for through our local bank. 

Contribution breakdown: 

We will be responsible for 58% of the financing (not including the interest on the loan). 

Private grants will make up 24% 

Your contributions will make up the remaining: 18% 

The Impact

We are hoping to work with two farms that can participate in this collaboration in 2018 and work with at least 6 farms by 2020.  Our projections, based on previous sales data and sales discussions with a distributor we work with in Chicago, is that those individual farms can expect to see $6000 in produce sales on monthly basis. That's an incredible boost in sales for our region.  

We will also be able to scale up and produce more food and become more efficient and profitable. This means higher wages, safer working conditions, employees that want to stick around and continue to contribute to our movement. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially. We totally get it. That doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. (and do it frequently!) 
  • Share on social media, emails, tell your friends. 
  • Volunteer to help us distribute the perks. 
  • Donate local food items to go towards the baskets! 
  • Keep supporting your local and organic farmers!
