story:
Summary

Jamboree Jams is a small batch jam and marmalade company based in New Orleans. All of our fruit is sourced locally from farmers in Louisiana and Mississippi and we use copper pots, the least amount of sugar we can get by with, and no commercial pectin to create fruit-focused jars of jam.

We've been working out of a commissary kitchen for the past 5 years but have been struggling to keep up with wholesale and retail orders for some time as we outgrow the space.

After a year and a half of searching, we've finally found the perfect production kitchen, jam studio, and retail space in the Marigny to call our own! 

This is a very exciting moment of growth and we are so happy to share it with y'all as we Crowdfund this jam dream into a reality!

 

Who We Are

Jamboree is comprised of Sara Levasseur, who began the business in 2016 after a lifelong interest in jam and preserving learned in her grandmother's raspberry garden; jam-maker from day 1 Nadia Ogbor, skilled jam master and chef; and Sara's partner Carl Hugmeyer, handyman and longtime sole prep-worker.  As we expand our production, we also look forward to expanding our team.

 

We Need Your Help!

We are very lucky to have found a space that has already been built out as a restaurant by its previous tenants and beloved neighborhood butcher, Shank Charcuterie. As a result, we have been able to set our opening budget at a much more manageable level than most. 

We're asking for contributions from our friends, families, and community to raise $15,000 in order to make our initial equipment purchases and build out the retail shop space without going into considerable debt. We will be purchasing a new gas range, a jar filler, a full-size fridge, freezer, and an oven. 

Our goal has been carefully considered to account for these costly pieces of equipment as well as the paint, tile, and wood required to polish the shop off. Our goal also includes the costs involved in producing the perks, the fees taken by Indiegogo, and estimated taxes . Any shipping required will be invoiced separately. 

We've come up with a few exclusive offers as perks to help raise funds and have also been lucky to receive donations from local artists and creatives to help us raise funds. You're also able to contribute any amount unrelated to the perks on offer. All contributions are extremely appreciated and all contributors will receive a personal thank you.

 

The Impact

With your help, we'll be able to take on a lot more fruit, which means a lot more jam and marmalade both in New Orleans and beyond. We're hoping to have at least one stockist in each major city across the Southern States by the end of 2021 and in all major cities across the US by the end of 2022. We'll also be able to expand to offer shipping to Canada! And to stock in stores in Toronto, Montreal, and Vancouver/Victoria.

We'll be able to explore new flavors, work with fruit we've never had the capacity to in the past, and pursue additional methods of preservation. We're most excited to begin offering Tomato Jam, Muscadine Jelly, and Gherkins.

We'll be able to bring back jelly donuts and soft serve and have regular shop hours.

We'll be able to work with more local farmers and small business owners.

For reference, ALL of our fruit for our jam and marmalade is sourced locally. If we meet our Crowdfunding Goal, we will be able to up our jam production 300% in the first year alone! That means 3x the fruit orders from us for farmers across Louisiana (citrus, figs, strawberries, blackberries, mayhaws) and in Mississippi (blueberries, pears, peaches, plums). That amounts to upwards of $10,000 re-invested back into our farming community each year in fruit purchases alone!

 

We'll also be able to offer affordable preservation classes, serve as a resource for other jam and pickle makers in the neighborhood, and contribute to the community fridges on a regular basis with an eye toward challenging systemic food waste and food insecurity in America.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by sharing our campaign, letting everyone know how much you love our jam, or ordering from our online shop. If you're New Orleans-based and have extra tile, wood, or paint that you're not using let us know and we may be able to incorporate it into the renovation to save money!

story:
Mabuhay! We are  a husband and wife team who originally are from the Philippines. I was born and raised in Pangasinan and now married to Denver, a Batangueno.  Fortunately, we both share the same passion for food and we would like more people to join us in gastronomical adventure of Filipino dishes!

My relationship with food and love of doing work in the kitchen started as early as when I was 6 years old. My "lolo" (grandpa) and "lola" (grandma) took me under their wings and as a form of gratitude I would cook rice for dinner so when they come home, it would be ready for them. Needless to say, I was the epitome of an ideal "apo" or grand child. They were both very hardworking and I figured it is the least I can do to help. From them, I have learned the basics in as I would observe their ways in the kitchen and was most of the time an active participant specially when she taught me how to cook "diningding," a staple in any Ilocano household.

In 2003, we relocated to Chicago and transferred to Arizona in 2014. Missing all the food places there, we began exploring what Arizona has to offer. Back then, there were only a few choices in the area so we started just cooking for our own, specially the Filipino dishes.

Our humble beginnings in the business started way back in 2014 when I took a chance to post on Facebook to sell two of the most famous Filipino dishes, lumpia and pancit. The response was overwhelming and from then on, we never stopped serving one Filipino favorite dish to another.  As years go by, we have accommodated the request of our loyal customers who want a variety of other Filipino food like adobo, caldereta, sinigang, pinakbet, sisig, dinuguan. Early this year, we ventured in to grilled platters (both meat and seafood), and assorted dessert platers (puto, kutsinta, cassava, sapin-sapin, pichi-pichi, bibingka and maja blanca). Along with these, by popular demand, we also do baked breads (Spanish bread and pan de sal) and cakes.

"PINAS-sarap na Babalik-balikan" simply means showcasing Filipino dishes that are worth coming back to over and over again. "PINAS" is short for Pilipinas and "Sarap" means delicious. Embedded in our Filipino culture is our love for food. Surprisingly, our customers come from different cultures and that is one of the best things that this venture has given us much satisfaction about. Being able to let others taste, experience and celebrate life with good food for all occasions or even if there is none and you just simply want good food, Tambayan at Joann's is the place to have in mind.

With this, we  would like to invite you to join us in building Tambayan at Joann's. "Tambayan"  is a Filipino term for a place to hang out or chill, We envision Tambayan at Joann's as your go to place if you  are craving for all time favorite Filipino food. 

Your participation in our Rewards Crowdfunding Campaign to assist us with our start- up fund is a necessary step towards the realization of our dream. Raised funds will mostly go to buying the equipment and capital we need to initially start and run for a few months. For Arizonians, our restaurant will serve our West Valley friends. Rest assured that we will deliver our best to cater all of you. We are ready to serve our great food. We work hard everyday perfecting our menu and recipes for  you.

Moreover, a portion of our earnings will be earmarked for foundations we support such as Abaka Foundation, a non profit organization which aims to spread interest, understanding and appreciation of the Filipino language, culture, music specially for Filipino-American kids based in Arizona. It is an organization close to my heart as I also want my children to know their roots. Aside from this, I will be supporting another organization geared towards giving scholarship to deserving students. Not only are you helping us realize our dreams but you will be a part of giving back to our community. This means so much to us and we appreciate and thank you in advance for all your help. 

Our target is to raise $120,000 which will cover equipment  & help us with start up expenses.  By contributing to Tambayan at Joann's, for every dollar you contribute, we will give you back your original amount plus 50% in the form  of a gift card that you can use to purchase our food when we open. For example, a $100 donation is equivalent to $150 gift card. Moreover, this is a flexible campaign funding which means even after the allotted time to donate has expired, you can still do so in support of Tambayan at Joann's. For those who are not able to donate, spreading the word about Tambayan at Joann's by word of mouth or social media will be most welcome. You can ask your friends to like us on Facebook at Tambayan at Joann's,  @tambayanatjoanns at Instagram.

Maraming Salamat po!
story_txt:
Mabuhay! We are  a husband and wife team who originally are from the Philippines. I was born and raised in Pangasinan and now married to Denver, a Batangueno.  Fortunately, we both share the same passion for food and we would like more people to join us in gastronomical adventure of Filipino dishes!
My relationship with food and love of doing work in the kitchen started as early as when I was 6 years old. My "lolo" (grandpa) and "lola" (grandma) took me under their wings and as a form of gratitude I would cook rice for dinner so when they come home, it would be ready for them. Needless to say, I was the epitome of an ideal "apo" or grand child. They were both very hardworking and I figured it is the least I can do to help. From them, I have learned the basics in as I would observe their ways in the kitchen and was most of the time an active participant specially when she taught me how to cook "diningding," a staple in any Ilocano household.

story:
There are a significant amount of new brands that hit the market every day that you may never discover. Hudson Daniel was developed by a team of culinary enthusiasts, all on a journey to connect amazing companies, many of them small-batch makers, with hungry and thirsty customers like you! The HD marketplace will feature: wine, spirits, beer, meat, pasta, cheese, chocolate, coffee, tea, confections, honey, oils, spreads, condiments, sauces, vinegars, salts, spices, seasonings, baking ingredients, snacks, cookware, cutlery, dinnerware, appliances, cookbooks and much more.  Our mission is to deliver unique and exciting food and beverage experiences to every home, business, and palette!

JOIN OUR COMMUNITY

Create an account and share your experiences through our dynamic and vibrant community!

HELP MAKERS THRIVE

We provide artisan vendors tools to grow with us, so they can focus on making remarkable goods and telling their story. You can interact with our partners, purchase their incredible products and be educated on the craft that goes into everything they do with recipes, tips and guides.  

FEED THE WORLD

We strive to deliver experiences that celebrate life and inspire exploration, all while giving back to those who are less fortunate. Upon Hudson Daniel's official launch, we will donate a percentage of all sales to support efforts that end hunger around the world through various charitable foundations. Together we can make a difference.

OUR CORE VALUES

WE ARE A PURPOSE DRIVEN COMPANY

What does this mean? At Hudson Daniel, we are a purpose driven organization whose goal it is to connect the world, one culinary experience at a time - while supporting our greater objective to end global hunger. We partner with makers who do more than just create amazing food, beverage and accessories. They need to tell a story and support our greater goals.

WE BELIEVE IN SOURCING RESPONSIBLY

We all love food, but we don't always know where it comes from. Have you ever wondered what is in your food, where it came from, or how many miles it travels to get to you? We strive to do business with partners who believe in responsible sourcing, transparency and strive to locally source ingredients for the highest quality and control.   

WE BELIEVE IN WIN-WIN RELATIONSHIPS

We believe in promoting healthy win-win relationships with our vendors and suppliers. We believe in demonstrating integrity in business dealings and believe in respect, fairness and integrity at all times and expect the same in return from our vendors and partners. 

WE BELIEVE IN GIVING BACK

Together we can make a difference. We strive to deliver experiences that celebrate life and inspire exploration, all while giving back to those who are less fortunate. We are committed to donating a percentage of all sales on Hudson Daniel to assist those in need, by helping to end hunger around the world through various chartiable foundations.

WE BELIEVE IN SUPPORTING LOCAL BUSINESSES

At Hudson Daniel, we believe in supporting local communities in which we live & work, and believe that by partnering with makers who also support these core beliefs, we are supporting local communities worldwide.

WE BELIEVE IN THE HEALTH AND WELL BEING OF OUR EMPLOYEES

Empowering team members to be passionate and committed to delivering incredible experiences is the cornerstone to our culture. We believe in the spirit of hospitality, service and ensuring each and every team member is empowered to deliver memorable experiences. We empower each and every employee to make a difference at the local level and continually think outside the box to discover what Hudson Daniel can do to better the communities in which we operate.

We believe in promoting from within and exposing our team members to a wide variety of vantage points whenever possible and not limiting their growth and potential. We do this by providing programs that promote and encourage personal and professional growth to allow our team members to achieve their desired level of success.

ABOUT OUR FOUNDER

Dan Cassara - A first generation American, Dan's parents immigrated to the United States from Italy where food, family and the marriage of the two are a way of life. Constantly surrounded by new and adventurous food choices, Dan grew up admiring the art and beauty of food preparation, while spending countless hours watching his mother, aunts, and grandmothers prepare incredible meals. 

At the age of 14, his first part time job was as a bakers assistant and counter clerk at a fine French bakery and eatery in the San Francisco Bay Area where his love for European food and the café experience began to inspire him. Throughout Dan's career, and through the many travels he has made worldwide, his mission to define and someday deliver the ultimate customer experience has been interlaced in every role he has played, regardless of the industry. 

A serial entrepreneur and self-starter, Dan is the former President and CEO of a $2.7B multi-national franchise services operation. When not focusing on his present role, he spends most of his time continually researching and developing ways to deliver innovative experiences that he is certain will make Hudson Daniel a tremendous success, and help those in need around the world.


YOUR SUPPORT

Your generous contribution and support will help us add critical resources, hire additional employees and help offset the costs of developing and implementing technology.

Our team has lined up packaging and logistic partners, and is curating the finest in artisan food, beverage and homeware accessories by actively seeking relationships with vendors who we believe are worthy of the Hudson Daniel seal of approval.

We believe our tremendous staff and partners are up for the challenge. With your help, we can make it happen! Thank you in advance for your support!

For more information about our company, please visit www.hudsondaniel.com.

campaign_city: San Francisco Bay Area, United States

story:
My name is Chris Edwards  and I currently run a company called Salts of the Earth Ltd which is a Bar & cocktail consultancy & counselling business with my business partner Dave Tregenza. We also recently opened an award winning cocktail bar in Brixton, London called the Shrub and Shutter.

we have a combined 25  years experience in the hospitality industry. We have previously worked at Adam Street private members club, The Baltic, Northbank Restaurant, Drake & Morgan amongst other companies. more detail on request.

Salts of the Earth Ltd is a successful bar and cocktail consultancy business based in London. We work mostly in London but have also consulted in Moscow, Cannes and around the British isles. we have worked with big companies such as Red Bull, Spotify, Drake & Morgan, The FM Group, Fire Global Media & many Drinks Brands.

The Shrub and Shutter was opened with acclaim in early September 2014 and already has a huge following. see our website www.theshrubandshutter.com for reviews and press cuttings (at the  bottom of the site)

We are looking to open a new concept in south London called the First aid box which will be an all day cafe, cocktail bar, snack bar & restaurant. the concept will also be community based and we will be supporting local charities, colleges and suppliers with events, training, jobs and  driving business.

The concept itself revolves around freshness, healthy eating & beneficial drinks. our ethos will be centred around innovation and evolving everyday. Food and drink inspiration will be taken from all corners of the globe.

With support for contributors we would be able to launch a brand and roll out the concept. our dream is roll out 10 in London in the next 5 years.

Ideally We need £30k to get the project fully operational. money will be spent on up front rent, refurbishment & equipment, marketing & stock.

We hope to follow on from the success of  the shrub and shutter  with another killer bar & snack bar that will push further culinary & drink boundries.

Please check out www.theshrubandshutter.co.uk for an insight of what we do at our first bar.

After the success of our first bar we see no reason why the first aid box would be anything other than a complete success.

if you have nay further questions please do not hesitate to ask.

story:
WHY TREENUT CHEESE?

Approximately 65 percent of the human population has a reduced ability to digest lactose after infancy. Besides humans (and companion animals who are fed by humans), no species drinks milk beyond infancy or drinks the milk of another species. Cow’s milk is suited to the nutritional needs of calves, who have four stomachs, gain hundreds of pounds in a matter of months, and sometimes weigh more than 1,000 pounds before they are 2 years old.

Moreover, cow’s milk is a cruel and unhealthy product: cows are treated as milk-producing machines and are genetically manipulated, pumped full of antibiotics and hormones, artificially inseminated shortly after their first birthdays and again and again, so they can give milk throughout their life.

While cows suffer on factory farms, humans who drink their milk increase their chances of developing heart disease, diabetes, cancer, and many other ailments. Making matters worse, large dairy farms have an enormously detrimental effect on the environment. The dairy industry is the primary source of smog-forming pollutants, and a single cow emits more of these harmful gasses than a car does.

WHAT CAN WE DO?  

We are passionate about delicious gourmet food that provides a wholesome, cruelty-free, eco-sustainable alternative for those who wish to live a conscious, intentional life.

“Let food be thy medicine, and medicine be thy food.” – Hippocrates

Imagine a tasty gourmet cheese plate full of probiotics. Cheese that gives you great taste that tickles your palate, but provides your body with a variety of friendly bacteria essential for your health. A food full of aliveness that becomes even better with time, making you feel more vital and beautiful.

Cheese whose production brings no harm to nature as it is 100% raw, relying solely on the fermentation process and its qualities.

Rich in vitamin B, enzymes, proteins, and fibers, the nut cheese that we will produce at Cheese the Queen is conducive to strengthening your microbiome and helping to boost your energy, beauty, and vitality. Our cheese is intended for food lovers and health enthusiasts alike. A tasty, fair-trade, and eco-sustainable relative to dairy products, our nut cheese combines the power of modern technology with all the wisdom of the Bulgarian fermentation tradition.

A CAUSE FOR CONSCIOUS FOOD PRODUCTION

Mass production has caused a lot of damage, leading us every day further towards an eco-catastrophe. By losing our contact with nature and our bodies, we forget our real needs and encounter different illnesses. There are virtually no nutrients in animal-based foods that are not better provided by plants.

For years we have lived with calcium in dairy products, but modern medical studies indicate that milk may actually increase women’s risk of getting osteoporosis instead providing a necessary source of calcium. Humans can get all the calcium and protein they need from nuts, seeds, yeast, grains, beans, and other legumes. It’s difficult not to get enough calories from protein when you eat a healthy diet.

The product you are supporting is compassionate to animals and beneficial for humans. But our process is also ethical and eco-sustainable, and our production is harmless to nature.

By supporting Cheese The Queen, you are supporting a healthier life, wholesome food, a conscious approach to a cleaner environment and local artisanal production.

We believe that all living beings deserve nutritional food and nature to support their well-being.


FACTS:

  • Our production is eco-sustainable in comparison to dairy products. We don’t use animals for ethical, environmental and health reasons. Except the lactose and casein intolerance, cows are the biggest producers of methane.
  • The products we use are fair-trade. We believe that food should be made with love, but in an ethical and respectful way.
  • 70-80% of our health depends on our microbiome. Good health requires prebiotics and probiotics, which are in fermented & cultured foods in which Bulgaria has a rich tradition. We have something important we can give to the world – with your help.
  • We keep it fun! Our production is delicious, pairs perfectly with wine and goes over amazingly well at parties! It’s simply awesome!

WHY IN BULGARIA?

Bulgaria is a land where fermented foods reign supreme. This tradition dates all the way back to the 5th century, when the Thracians were already using recipes that had been passed down through the centuries. In 1905, a Bulgarian doctor discovered Lactobacillus bulgaricus, which became the world’s first recognized probiotic; it ushered in a new era of delicious, medicinal food. Because as much as 80% of our health relies on our microbiome, probiotics found in fermented foods are a key component of a healthy lifestyle. With Cheese the Queen, we aim to establish a small factory for artisanal, plant-based cheese produced in Bulgaria.

We are creating a bridge between traditional techniques and modern life. We believe that a plant-based approach can help save the planet in a delicious & healthy way. Our product combines the ancient techniques used by our ancestors with a modern approach to give the world an amazing food we all need. Our cheeses come from fair-trade cashews and almond milk. We culture them with acidophilus, which converts them into a great probiotic food for you. Some cheeses age for weeks to develop deeper, tangy flavors, while others are fresh and light soft spreads.

HOW IT WILL REACH YOU?     

Bulgaria is a small country, but we have the knowledge and traditions to create a beneficial and delightful product.

The strategic position of our country will help us to export to all of Europe to begin with, and meanwhile take steps to research how to spread the news around the world – and go bigger.

We believe that people deserve good food for more energy and the health they need to fully enjoy life. In the world’s minds, there has been a longstanding clash between the gourmet experience and raw and vegan cuisine. Lovers of traditional foods date back centuries, like cheeses, but many refuse to believe that satisfactory taste can be achieved by using a healthier, plant-based approach. We believe in the opposite. We have tested our cheeses on our families, friends, focus groups, people we have never met before, vegans and omnivores. It has been rated as a delicacy, a great wine companion and table-wanted. We’re not only focused on its health benefits, but paying precise attention to its taste qualities.

WHAT DO WE NEED YOUR HELP FOR?

We are turning to you to help us raise start-up capital of $12 000 that will cover the costs of getting Cheese the Queen off the ground. With your help, we will rent a place where we can establish a small factory. We will buy the equipment we need to start producing and launch a marketing campaign to expand awareness of conscious food production. We appreciate any and all contributions that will support our mission to create gourmet tree-nut cheeses for people who want to live a more conscious, healthy & delightful lifestyle.

OUR BUDGET:

All our tree nut cheeses are made by hand and contain all the love that food needs to be alive and delicious.
To create our start-up production volume, we need:

  • to rent and renovate our boutique “factory” so it covers all the regulatory requirements and we can go through all the procedures regarding legalization - $2 500
  • microbiologic analysis of the products - $ 600
  • 2 dehydrators - $ 1 000
  • 1 professional blender system - $ 1 700
  • 2 fridges - $ 1 300
  • professional working tables, shelves and utensils - $ 1 300
  • packaging (eco-sustainable) - $ 900
  • fair-trade nuts and herbs - $ 1 300
  • outreach campaign and materials to raise the awareness of the benefits of tree-nut cheese and sustainable dairy-free food production - $ 1 400

OUR BRAND STORY:
We believe good food is like a good fairy tale. It has a long story before it reaches your belly, where it reaches its happy end. Good food is the Queen, and the Queen loves healthy delights! With your help, Cheese the Queen will live happily ever after. We will all be one small step closer to a more sustainable and healthy gourmet culture –thanks to the delicious food we have in store for you!

OUR PRODUCTS:
We have planned for a long and exciting future.
Our pilot products are three aged hard cheeses and a sampler box for the curious ones.
They are all awesome and truly delicious, we assure you of that! They are firm, tangy, and some are creamy at the inside. Try them on a cheese plate, with or without wine, with crackers, chutneys, jams, grapes or anything that comes to mind.

  • Classic Aged Tree-nut Cheese – the great favourite, fermented, rich and full of taste
  • Sharp Yellow Tree-nut Cheese – extra tangy and sharp in taste, we simply love it. For the ones who love bold taste.
  • Chives & Green Pepper Tree-nut Cheese – firm but creamy on the inside, blended with chives and dusted with fresh green pepper. Fresh yet tangy.
  • Degustation box with a sample from all three

OUR NEXT STEP:

  • Pickled Cucumbers & Dill Spread – trust us, it is simply divine
  • Cheesecake Love – our cheese for a vegan cheesecake, yogurt, smoothie bowls or whatever else inspiration you might have. Light, creamy, and cultured dairy alternative for desserts especially.



OUR PRODUCTIONS IS:
100% plant-based
100% raw
Free of anything that you might need to avoid: gluten, soy, dairy, cruelty
We use only wholesome nuts, nut milk, acidophilus cultures, kimchi starter, and a selection of spices.

With your help, we can bring more life to your table.

Don’t forget: “The biggest and strongest animals on the planet — elephants, gorillas, rhinos — are herbivores,” says Arizona Cardinal David Carter.

We appreciate your help <3

Thank you for supporting Cheese The Queen!
story_txt:
WHY TREENUT CHEESE?
Approximately 65 percent of the human population has a reduced ability to digest lactose after infancy. Besides humans (and companion animals who are fed by humans), no species drinks milk beyond infancy or drinks the milk of another species. Cow’s milk is suited to the nutritional needs of calves, who have four stomachs, gain hundreds of pounds in a matter of months, and sometimes weigh more than 1,000 pounds before they are 2 years old.
Moreover, cow’s milk is a cruel and unhealthy product: cows are treated as milk-producing machines and are genetically manipulated, pumped full of antibiotics and hormones, artificially inseminated shortly after their first birthdays and again and again, so they can give milk throughout their life.
While cows suffer on factory farms, humans who drink their milk increase their chances of developing heart disease, diabetes, cancer, and many other ailments. Making matters worse, large dairy farms have an enormously detrimental effect on the environment. The dairy industry is the primary source of smog-forming pollutants, and a single cow emits more of these harmful gasses than a car does.

WHAT CAN WE DO?  
We are passionate about delicious gourmet food that provides a wholesome, cruelty-free, eco-sustainable alternative for those who wish to live a conscious, intentional life.
“Let food be thy medicine, and medicine be thy food.” – Hippocrates
Imagine a tasty gourmet cheese plate full of probiotics. Cheese that gives you great taste that tickles your palate, but provides your body with a variety of friendly bacteria essential for your health. A food full of aliveness that becomes even better with time, making you feel more vital and beautiful.
Cheese whose production brings no harm to nature as it is 100% raw, relying solely on the fermentation process and its qualities.
Rich in vitamin B, enzymes, proteins, and fibers, the nut cheese that we will produce at Cheese the Queen is conducive to strengthening your microbiome and helping to boost your energy, beauty, and vitality. Our cheese is intended for food lovers and health enthusiasts alike. A tasty, fair-trade, and eco-sustainable relative to dairy products, our nut cheese combines the power of modern technology with all the wisdom of the Bulgarian fermentation tradition.

A CAUSE FOR CONSCIOUS FOOD PRODUCTION
Mass production has caused a lot of damage, leading us every day further towards an eco-catastrophe. By losing our contact with nature and our bodies, we forget our real needs and encounter different illnesses. There are virtually no nutrients in animal-based foods that are not better provided by plants.
For years we have lived with calcium in dairy products, but modern medical studies indicate that milk may actually increase women’s risk of getting osteoporosis instead providing a necessary source of calcium. Humans can get all the calcium and protein they need from nuts, seeds, yeast, grains, beans, and other legumes. It’s difficult not to get enough calories from protein when you eat a healthy diet.
The product you are supporting is compassionate to animals and beneficial for humans. But our process is also ethical and eco-sustainable, and our production is harmless to nature.
By supporting Cheese The Queen, you are supporting a healthier life, wholesome food, a conscious approach to a cleaner environment and local artisanal production.
We believe that all living beings deserve nutritional food and nature to support their well-being.
FACTS:

Our production is eco-sustainable in comparison to dairy products. We don’t use animals for ethical, environmental and health reasons. Except the lactose and casein intolerance, cows are the biggest producers of methane.
The products we use are fair-trade. We believe that food should be made with love, but in an ethical and respectful way.
70-80% of our health depends on our microbiome. Good health requires prebiotics and probiotics, which are in fermented & cultured foods in which Bulgaria has a rich tradition. We have something important we can give to the world – with your help.
We keep it fun! Our production is delicious, pairs perfectly with wine and goes over amazingly well at parties! It’s simply awesome!


WHY IN BULGARIA?
Bulgaria is a land where fermented foods reign supreme. This tradition dates all the way back to the 5th century, when the Thracians were already using recipes that had been passed down through the centuries. In 1905, a Bulgarian doctor discovered Lactobacillus bulgaricus, which became the world’s first recognized probiotic; it ushered in a new era of delicious, medicinal food. Because as much as 80% of our health relies on our microbiome, probiotics found in fermented foods are a key component of a healthy lifestyle. With Cheese the Queen, we aim to establish a small factory for artisanal, plant-based cheese produced in Bulgaria.
We are creating a bridge between traditional techniques and modern life. We believe that a plant-based approach can help save the planet in a delicious & healthy way. Our product combines the ancient techniques used by our ancestors with a modern approach to give the world an amazing food we all need. Our cheeses come from fair-trade cashews and almond milk. We culture them with acidophilus, which converts them into a great probiotic food for you. Some cheeses age for weeks to develop deeper, tangy flavors, while others are fresh and light soft spreads.

HOW IT WILL REACH YOU?     
Bulgaria is a small country, but we have the knowledge and traditions to create a beneficial and delightful product.
The strategic position of our country will help us to export to all of Europe to begin with, and meanwhile take steps to research how to spread the news around the world – and go bigger.
We believe that people deserve good food for more energy and the health they need to fully enjoy life. In the world’s minds, there has been a longstanding clash between the gourmet experience and raw and vegan cuisine. Lovers of traditional foods date back centuries, like cheeses, but many refuse to believe that satisfactory taste can be achieved by using a healthier, plant-based approach. We believe in the opposite. We have tested our cheeses on our families, friends, focus groups, people we have never met before, vegans and omnivores. It has been rated as a delicacy, a great wine companion and table-wanted. We’re not only focused on its health benefits, but paying precise attention to its taste qualities.

WHAT DO WE NEED YOUR HELP FOR?
We are turning to you to help us raise start-up capital of $12 000 that will cover the costs of getting Cheese the Queen off the ground. With your help, we will rent a place where we can establish a small factory. We will buy the equipment we need to start producing and launch a marketing campaign to expand awareness of conscious food production. We appreciate any and all contributions that will support our mission to create gourmet tree-nut cheeses for people who want to live a more conscious, healthy & delightful lifestyle.
OUR BUDGET:
All our tree nut cheeses are made by hand and contain all the love that food needs to be alive and delicious.To create our start-up production volume, we need:

to rent and renovate our boutique “factory” so it covers all the regulatory requirements and we can go through all the procedures regarding legalization - $2 500
microbiologic analysis of the products - $ 600
2 dehydrators - $ 1 000
1 professional blender system - $ 1 700
2 fridges - $ 1 300
professional working tables, shelves and utensils - $ 1 300
packaging (eco-sustainable) - $ 900
fair-trade nuts and herbs - $ 1 300
outreach campaign and materials to raise the awareness of the benefits of tree-nut cheese and sustainable dairy-free food production - $ 1 400


OUR BRAND STORY:We believe good food is like a good fairy tale. It has a long story before it reaches your belly, where it reaches its happy end. Good food is the Queen, and the Queen loves healthy delights! With your help, Cheese the Queen will live happily ever after. We will all be one small step closer to a more sustainable and healthy gourmet culture –thanks to the delicious food we have in store for you!
OUR PRODUCTS:We have planned for a long and exciting future.Our pilot products are three aged hard cheeses and a sampler box for the curious ones.They are all awesome and truly delicious, we assure you of that! They are firm, tangy, and some are creamy at the inside. Try them on a cheese plate, with or without wine, with crackers, chutneys, jams, grapes or anything that comes to mind.


Classic Aged Tree-nut Cheese – the great favourite, fermented, rich and full of taste

Sharp Yellow Tree-nut Cheese – extra tangy and sharp in taste, we simply love it. For the ones who love bold taste.

Chives & Green Pepper Tree-nut Cheese – firm but creamy on the inside, blended with chives and dusted with fresh green pepper. Fresh yet tangy.

Degustation box with a sample from all three

OUR NEXT STEP:

Pickled Cucumbers & Dill Spread – trust us, it is simply divine
Cheesecake Love – our cheese for a vegan cheesecake, yogurt, smoothie bowls or whatever else inspiration you might have. Light, creamy, and cultured dairy alternative for desserts especially.



OUR PRODUCTIONS IS:100% plant-based100% rawFree of anything that you might need to avoid: gluten, soy, dairy, crueltyWe use only wholesome nuts, nut milk, acidophilus cultures, kimchi starter, and a selection of spices.
With your help, we can bring more life to your table.
Don’t forget: “The biggest and strongest animals on the planet — elephants, gorillas, rhinos — are herbivores,” says Arizona Cardinal David Carter.
We appreciate your help <3
Thank you for supporting Cheese The Queen!

story:
Why Drink Wingman?

Like many people all across the world, I, Ryan Schaub CEO, have always had a lack of confidence and struggled with a great deal of social and personal situations. I never had a girlfriend in high school, never was the talkative "cool" kid, and always felt a sense of lacking and regret. I never felt happy because I could never do what I wanted and always held myself back. That has all changed.

Human beings are social creatures, but over the last couple decades, technology, although a great asset, has hampered our skills of communication, confidence, and self worth. Wingman is here to change that. Using our immense passion of supplements, we have created the first life enhancement drink that will improve confidence, raise serotonin levels, decrease anxiety, and increase focus and energy, for an elite combination that will unlock your full potential. 

Suffering in life due to a lack of confidence, anxiety, or no focus is not only hard to deal with, but also is a waste of your life. You ARE amazing. Each and everyone of us are. Wingman wants to see everyone succeed in life. We will be at your side to help.

With your contribution, you are helping to fund the production of the first ever Wingman Life Enhancement Drink in a 8.4 oz slim aluminum can. Ready to drink so you can be ready to take on life.

 

What is Wingman?

We have spent countless hours and many months testing and tasting to come up with the best combination for you. Our blend is sourced from only the highest quality ingredients possible and we do not "skimp" on ingredients. We give you the proper amount and do not have fillers.

 

 

What is Wingman Used For?

So you may be thinking, is this drink just for talking to women or for use in social situations? Of course not! The applications of Wingman are endless. Wingman's effects will work at any time of the day for any need you might have, for example a job interview, business meetings, large amounts of work or homework, or even public speaking. Basically, any situation you have trouble expressing your best self, or just because you enjoy the taste of Wingman and the positive impact it brings in your life.

We figure if Wingman can be at your side and make a tough situation such as talking to a beautiful women easy, then Wingman will make all other situations a breeze.

 

What is Being Funded?

 

Perks

We believe in firmly thanking our contributors and want to give something of real value and not a meaningless "gift." We have listed a few great perks including discounted prices, help in development of future flavors, and even unlimited Wingman. We cannot do this without you and want to reward you for that. Check out the side perks for more details. 

Also if our goal is met, we have a few stretch goals up our sleeves...

All perks are intended to be delivered before the end of April.

 

Risks & Challenges

We are very prepared and organized and have all of our assets figured out, but like any business, problems do arise. We are ready to tackle any obstacles in our way, quickly and efficiently so you, the consumer, are not impacted. 

One of your risks as a contributor to our Indiegogo campaign is if we do not raise over half of our goal. If that mark is not achieved, purchasing the materials needed for cans will be difficult. That said, any contributors that have pledged and are receiving a perk, we have two solutions. We will either send you our Wingman formula in a ready to mix powder packet (our original means of packaging), or you may contact us and we will refund your investment. Please note that the ready to mix powder packets are still the same high quality Wingman and are not an inferior product but, rather, are not as convenient.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, that is understandable, but if you believe in the mission of helping people become their best selves, please share this campaign on any or all social media platforms! Your help will make dreams all across the world come true.

 

More Information

For more information, feel free to contact us through email, or go to our website for more contact information and to sign up for our weekly newsletter containing updates, deals, and tips for breaking barriers in life.

 

Disclaimers

All statements claimed above have not been evaluated by the FDA. 

Although Wingman is considered to be safe, if currently taking an anti-depressant, or have any serious health conditions, check with your doctor to see if Wingman is safe for you. 

We have a 100% money back guarantee policy. If unhappy with Wingman we will reimburse you for your purchase.

story:
What is M.A.G.O Cafe?

M.A.G.O Cafe stands for Maids. Anime. Gaming. Otaku.

Previously known as Otaku Cafe; M.A.G.O Cafe is UK based travelling/popup maid cosplay cafe. We provide delicious authentic Japanese drinks and treats (Cakes included) provided by our friendly themed maids. The atmosphere is warm, friendly and fun plus all of our customers are treated with the care and undivided attention they all deserve. You can play games, take photos and partake in fun competitions with our maids. It is an experience like no other and we welcome everyone of all ages to join us!

 

Background 

After travelling to Japan a few times (Since 2011), a friend and I experienced the maid cafe franchise in many different ways, this ranged from quirky to weird. We had so much fun and enjoyed the interaction with every cafe we visited, so it only seemed right to want to share those experiences. Because of these experiences it was felt that the UK deserved to feel how we felt when being surrounded in this atmosphere. From that moment on the Cafe was created so that I could bring the same experiences to those that cannot travel to Japan themselves.

 

After running a couple of pop-ups in 2016, it was felt that there were mistakes made in terms of location and even timing. Since then I had re-worked and re-configured ways to bring an even bigger and better experience for a much wider demographic. This includes building a new website, re-branding and re-designing our look and name. Joining forces with an Otaku Cafe supporter, we went through planning, better research and came up with a way to get more people involved in the franchise. Because of this M.A.G.O Cafe was created.

 

Our Goals, Risks and Challenges

The contributions received will allow us to complete the final step to launching M.A.G.O. Cafe in May 2017. This will allow us to partake in May's MCM Expo 2017. If successful, we are hoping to bring our Cafe to different locations within London and eventually more of the UK. We have already started the company, hired our maids, purchased the uniforms and accessories, finalised our menu and now need to acquire new merchandise, obtain new stock and prizes for our old and new customers. In addition, the more money we raise gives us a better chance of us taking part other conventions and pop-up spaces across the country!

 

Our backers will receive wonderful rewards during the MCM event or one of our pop-ups; these rewards range from free cakes/drinks to paid entrance to May's MCM Comicon.

 

What are our risks?

  • Our campaign is unsuccessful, meaning that we can only run for one event
  • We are unable to provide the more exciting experiences to our customers due to low funding
  • Our strategic approach to obtain customers becomes less effective

What are our challenges?

  • Increase our existing fan base
  • Obtain a wider demographic
  • Becoming successful against competitive cafes

We are more than prepared to face any and all challenges and risks that come our way as we believe in our Cafe's success :) Even if we are unable to meet our target here, we will still launch in May 2017 and do our best to bring an everlasting experience to our customers.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're unable to pledge to our campaign, there are other ways to contribute:

  • Please share our campaign with your friends and families using the Indiegogo tools!
  • Please follow our social media channels.
  • If successful, please visit us and enjoy the experience!

We would like to thank you all for reading this campaign and appreciate any and all support you show us!

みんなありがとう (Thank you everyone)

story:
A LITTLE BACKGROUND 

Paradox Farm began it’s journey in 2008 when Hunter and I bought a few goats and a llama.
Why? Well a few reasons; We became interested in producing our own food for health and food security reasons. The local food movement was hitting the area and… yes.. we had too much wine one night and decided to buy livestock.

Both of us.. OK more me.. have the tendency to plow ahead into something and lift my head up later. Well, it was head down until we found ourselves eating dinner at Ashten’s in Southern Pines one evening in 2011 with our signature Cheese Louise! on the menu. Since 2011 the farm has grown every year, adding more milking does, equipment and new goat milk products.

In 2014 the unexpected and heartbreaking loss of Hunter put me in a quandary of how to proceed. Knowing that Hunter always had my back I put my head down again, and with the help of wonderful old friends and the addition of amazing new friends, pushed forward...again.

In 2016 we were able to return to producing our raw milk aged goat cheese collection called Southern Comforts with great success!  Now we need more space to keep up with the demand.

THE CHEESE CAVE

I bought a barn.. with no buyers remorse. Seriously. It is an old tobacco barn from a local estate sale. You know you are a farmer when you can send friends a photo and say.."hey can you help me with this? I want to take it back to the farm for a cheese cave"  And they say "Sure!" Board by board it came down and board by board it went up even better than before. 

Now I need help finishing the inside to USDA specifications.

Insulated walls and ceiling, and a sealed floor are required along with washable surfaces and electricity. Temperature in a cheese cave needs a constant 55-60 degrees and 85-90% humidity. We have about $4,500 into the project to date.  It will take us another $7,500 to finish the inside and have the cave ready for cheese. 

The Community

Paradox Farm is the only dairy farm in our area. We love our community; opening the farm for tours, tastings and events regularly to bring our efforts at healthy eating and food security to our neighbors. In order to be sustainable as a business we know we need to continually grow by producing cheese that we can offer year round. Aged cheese expands our selling season. Goats may produce milk for only 9-10 months a year but they eat for 12 months! And so do I.

Risks & Challenges

We are in our 6th year selling cheese. Our projections have all the indications of success. But honestly.. we need this year to make it work.  I am very excited about this project and have already seen expanded interest in our aged cheeses.

story:
Who we are…

Falls Church Distillers is first, and foremost, a family business. I grew up in the Northeast in a small town with a large Italian immigrant population, including my own family, whose customs not only include great food and art, but also the making of wine and liquors. 

With degrees from Penn State and the University of San Francisco and after a tour in the Air Force where I was educated in computer communications skills, I applied my experiences and skills to a 35 year successful career first as an engineer and then in sales and management. I raised my sons to value hard work, community, and of course, good spirits! I’m proud that my son A1C Christian Paluzzi continues our family tradition of military service and my other son Lorenzo shares my passion for distilling, focusing his education on chemistry.

In this Falls Church venture we combine my management experience with Lorenzo’s chemistry knowledge to produce locally distilled spirits. We chose Falls Church because of its fierce sense of community and support of local businesses. We have called Virginia home for 25 years and six years ago, we discovered Falls Church and found a community with similar values to the community I grew up in.

When we decided to open a distillery, we found Falls Church to be the most supportive city & community. While discussing our options with other local governments we ran into a myriad of bureaucracy and red tape that made it seem impossible, but a friend suggested I speak with the City of Falls Church. Within hours the city had set up a meeting and given tentative approval, working hard to make my dream a reality. I knew I had found the right place, a community of open minded people willing to embrace new ventures.

We have grown tremendously over the past year with this community’s support!

What we’re asking...

With our successes comes new challenges. When we began, we opened our distillery and a single ABC store. Now we have transformed the distillery into a full bar and restaurant and sell our spirits in numerous stores across the state of Virginia.

While our restaurant business is going strong, we need your help to grow our VA ABC Store  and multi-State presence.

We have recently signed contracts with the ABC in West Virginia and a distributor in Illinois and are in discussion with Pennsylvania and California, among others. The demand for Falls Church Distillers spirits is high and growing! In order to more easily satisfy that demand, we could use help from our friends, family and community.

The approximate cost for fulfilling demand is $20,000 for each state we enter. Providing our spirits to these markets takes a much larger inventory than we have the capability to secure on our own. Your support will allow us to significantly increase our production (to working in the distillery nearly every day!), purchase the bottles, corks and labels needed just to have the liquor available, and cover the extensive costs of shipping so much inventory across the nation. We’ll also need to fund our brand ambassadors and tasting events to secure these markets.

Benefits of contributing...

We are counting once again on the generosity of the Falls Church community and asking you to join our family here at the distillery. As a member of our family we want to show you our appreciation!

We’ll be creating a page on our website to thank ALL of our donors publicly, no matter the size of the gift!

Each $50+ donor will receive their choice of a Falls Church Distillers hat or t-shirt.

Donate $100 and receive a private tour and tasting for two with our distillers themselves! Ask them all the questions you’ve ever had about distilling and the spirits they create.

For those donors that contribute $250 or more, we’ll be hosting a private celebratory event just for you.

If you’ve ever wanted to learn to make our specialty cocktails and a range of the classics at home, donate $500 or more to join our chemist and bartenders for a fun mixology workshop.

For a $1,000 contribution we’ll send you a gift basket with one bottle of each of our four flagship spirits that began this venture — Bourbon, Whiskey, Vodka, and Gin

Contribute $2,500 and get your own distillery takeover! You and 25 of your closest friends can enjoy the entire distillery to yourselves for an evening with heavy appetizers provided and a discounted cash bar (Restricted to Monday - Thursday evenings from 7 pm - 10 pm).

If you give $5,000 or more we will forever commemorate your contribution with an engraved plaque predominately displayed in our Distillery Spirits Plant.

And for those donors who give $10,000 or more, you’ll receive your very own barrel of Church Bourbon at cask strength (typically 121-124 proof!). The bourbon will be bottled in your own personalized bottle with your name right on the label and you can keep the barrel to display at your home, or wherever you’d like.

How else you can help…

If you aren’t able to contribute financially to our efforts, we can still use your help! Help us get the word out about our project. Please share this campaign with your friends and family or anyone you know who may be able to contribute.

You can also just stop by the distillery for dinner or drinks and bring friends. If you have a favorite Virginia or West Virginia ABC store that doesn’t currently carry our spirits, place an order and they’ll be added to our list of ever expanding carriers.

All support helps us take the Falls Church Distillers name across this great nation!
story_txt:
Who we are…
Falls Church Distillers is first, and foremost, a family business. I grew up in the Northeast in a small town with a large Italian immigrant population, including my own family, whose customs not only include great food and art, but also the making of wine and liquors. 
With degrees from Penn State and the University of San Francisco and after a tour in the Air Force where I was educated in computer communications skills, I applied my experiences and skills to a 35 year successful career first as an engineer and then in sales and management. I raised my sons to value hard work, community, and of course, good spirits! I’m proud that my son A1C Christian Paluzzi continues our family tradition of military service and my other son Lorenzo shares my passion for distilling, focusing his education on chemistry.
In this Falls Church venture we combine my management experience with Lorenzo’s chemistry knowledge to produce locally distilled spirits. We chose Falls Church because of its fierce sense of community and support of local businesses. We have called Virginia home for 25 years and six years ago, we discovered Falls Church and found a community with similar values to the community I grew up in.
When we decided to open a distillery, we found Falls Church to be the most supportive city & community. While discussing our options with other local governments we ran into a myriad of bureaucracy and red tape that made it seem impossible, but a friend suggested I speak with the City of Falls Church. Within hours the city had set up a meeting and given tentative approval, working hard to make my dream a reality. I knew I had found the right place, a community of open minded people willing to embrace new ventures.
We have grown tremendously over the past year with this community’s support!
What we’re asking...
With our successes comes new challenges. When we began, we opened our distillery and a single ABC store. Now we have transformed the distillery into a full bar and restaurant and sell our spirits in numerous stores across the state of Virginia.
While our restaurant business is going strong, we need your help to grow our VA ABC Store  and multi-State presence.
We have recently signed contracts with the ABC in West Virginia and a distributor in Illinois and are in discussion with Pennsylvania and California, among others. The demand for Falls Church Distillers spirits is high and growing! In order to more easily satisfy that demand, we could use help from our friends, family and community.
The approximate cost for fulfilling demand is $20,000 for each state we enter. Providing our spirits to these markets takes a much larger inventory than we have the capability to secure on our own. Your support will allow us to significantly increase our production (to working in the distillery nearly every day!), purchase the bottles, corks and labels needed just to have the liquor available, and cover the extensive costs of shipping so much inventory across the nation. We’ll also need to fund our brand ambassadors and tasting events to secure these markets.
Benefits of contributing...
We are counting once again on the generosity of the Falls Church community and asking you to join our family here at the distillery. As a member of our family we want to show you our appreciation!

For those donors that contribute $250 or more, we’ll be hosting a private celebratory event just for you.
If you’ve ever wanted to learn to make our specialty cocktails and a range of the classics at home, donate $500 or more to join our chemist and bartenders for a fun mixology workshop.
For a $1,000 contribution we’ll send you a gift basket with one bottle of each of our four flagship spirits that began this venture — Bourbon, Whiskey, Vodka, and Gin
Contribute $2,500 and get your own distillery takeover! You and 25 of your closest friends can enjoy the entire distillery to yourselves for an evening with heavy appetizers provided and a discounted cash bar (Restricted to Monday - Thursday evenings from 7 pm - 10 pm).
If you give $5,000 or more we will forever commemorate your contribution with an engraved plaque predominately displayed in our Distillery Spirits Plant.
And for those donors who give $10,000 or more, you’ll receive your very own barrel of Church Bourbon at cask strength (typically 121-124 proof!). The bourbon will be bottled in your own personalized bottle with your name right on the label and you can keep the barrel to display at your home, or wherever you’d like.
How else you can help…
If you aren’t able to contribute financially to our efforts, we can still use your help! Help us get the word out about our project. Please share this campaign with your friends and family or anyone you know who may be able to contribute.
You can also just stop by the distillery for dinner or drinks and bring friends. If you have a favorite Virginia or West Virginia ABC store that doesn’t currently carry our spirits, place an order and they’ll be added to our list of ever expanding carriers.
All support helps us take the Falls Church Distillers name across this great nation!

story:
Who we are...

My partner Andy and myself started The Highlanders Bakehouse  three years ago to provide fresh,  real  bread . 

Originally a chef, I had the wonderful opportunity to study at the Le Cordon Bleu cookery school in London where my eyes were opened to the wonderful world of fresh, home-made, artisan bread.

Returning to Aberdeenshire I shared my passion with the local community and businesses until I decided the time was right to leave my chef job and be a full-time baker …. my dream was slowly becoming reality! 

Over the last two years we have worked hard to grow and be part of the community - delivering our products to local businesses and selling straight to the public at farmers markets , all the bread  freshly made  using traditional techniques and ingredients.

But now it's time to grow! 

We are currently building a new facility in Crathie – a shop/café which we hope will be a Community Hub! A place to relax and eat good home-made food, but with shelves full of package free local produce, like our own, sourced within a 20 mile radius, allowing people to shop locally and do their part to overcome the growing problem of pollution. 

Education will also be a big part of what we do creating a job for someone to learn the baking trade and organising workshops to carry on the traditional techniques which are slowly disappearing.

in the beautiful surroundings of Royal Deeside, located on the door step of Balmoral Castle and Crathie Kirk, with Ballater and Braemar only a short drive away this will be the perfect stop for locals and tourists. 

We are looking to you to hep our project become a real.. Of course, we don't expect something for nothing so are offering some fantastic rewards for your contribution. We would really appreciate it if you are able to be part of our enterprise.

 

thank you very much 

Looking for more information or have a question? See the FAQ

story:
A Little About Us ... 

Annie Lepillez - CEO|Head Crêpetier

Born and raised in Valence, France, Annie's roots emanate that of a true French woman; passionate not only about food, but also about the structure of her recipes and the science that goes into creating them.  

Where did her inspiration come from you ask? While waiting for her original career plan of becoming an Air Traffic Controller to take flight [no pun intended], Annie decided to join the United States Air Force Reserves to continue relishing in her love of the skies while inducing acts of humanitarianism. However, after a few years of service she soon realized that flying wasn't her only passion. After spending nearly five months deployed in the Middle East, she started reminiscing  about her childhood in France, and how her parents always cooked homemade crêpes every Sunday evening for her family. Her profound passion for food then embellished so much she wanted to find a way to share it in a larger capacity.  ​

Upon returning home to the states Annie began to set her newfound passion  into motion. After many entrepreneurial workshops and countless hours business planning, the venture toward opening Colorado Crêpe Company would officially come to pass. 

 

Leah Shockley - CMO | Sous Chef ​

With over eight years of experience in the food and hospitality industry coupled with four years in marketing/PR, Leah is a diverse entrepreneur and one who is suited to thrive in the foodie world of gourmet food trucks. She has a strong passion not only for great food, but the nutrients that wholesome eats provide at the core.  

After her 2009 diagnoses of Multiple Sclerosis and three year battle attempting to find the right modern day therapies to combat the disease, her passion for healthy living grew exponentially. After many years of research she learned there was no greater medicine than the food we ingest to nourish our bodies. From that moment on she knew she wanted to develop a company that held her same values and saw them through in a big way.​

After meeting Annie, she quickly realized their passions complimented each other and knew they were on the verge of something exceptional. 

 

While we've managed to spread the love and our crêpes through catered events, we've barely scratched the surface of our community. We really want the opportunity to share on an expansive level. 

Soon we will be featured inside of a new culinary concept called "Food Truck Alley", a cute house on a decent plot of land in the heart of Old Colorado City. Here, food trucks located in the Springs can come and park for designated amounts of time during any given day while customers filter in and out. It is an inviting lot with streaming lights, music, and various food truck options to choose from. Because we don't own a food truck at this time, we are being featured on the inside of this space at the "crêpe bar" we built. This has been monumental for us and allows the public to experience our foodie culture as well as the wholesomeness we can bring to the table. Though this is an amazing opportunity, we are striving for more mobile capabilities in an effort to spread the Colorado Crêpe Company culture further than just our front door. 

One of our main business pillars is market sharing. We'd like to eliminate the harsh competitive structure that has been America’s capitalistic society and bring business back to its grassroots. We want to partner with as many community based businesses as possible, as well as gain insights from our customers for new ideas and crêpe recipes. We firmly believe this business belongs to the community as much as it belongs to us.

With the assistance from our donors and patrons we will be able to embellish upon our community driven mission, integrating our love and passion of healthful food inside an unparalleled mobile crêperie. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've done some serious research as to what type of truck we'd like to develop, the size, structure, components, equipment, and aesthetics. Here is the transparent list we came up with:

  • A truck 

We've found a fully renovated truck for about $48,000 and a skeleton of a truck for about $12,000 that will require a complete overhaul. We believe the later option will be more expensive and more work overall, but it provides us the opportunity to customize it and make it functional and fun for ourselves and our customers. 

  • Aesthetics

Once we have the truck, we need to make it pretty and appealing. This includes engraving our logo on the old barn wood backdrop, lining the rest of the exterior in sheet metal, and creating a fun plexi-glass window so you can see us in action when we are building your made-to-order crêpe.

  • Industrial propane crêpe griddles

While we currently have two commercial griddles, they aren't the proper grade or structure we need for continued service and demand on a food truck. 

  • Food storage bins/half size industrial refrigerator/mop sink

A no brainer here ... 

  • Generator and propane tanks 

In order to go mobile and stay mobile we need electricity and gas to function.

  • Startup capital for food inventory

This will be rather costly due to our strict  local, organic, and authentic food sourcing. We are estimating about $2,000 initial inventory cost. This includes seasonings, spices, beverage syrups, coffee, creamers, and all our staples such as flour, milk, eggs, meat, veggies, etc. 

  • Cooking supplies and service utensils 

Can't cook without spatulas, pots, and pans! And you'll need something to eat with, right? 

  • Website development cost and maintenance 

A business can't exist without a website these days. And building one costs a couple thousand at least, let alone the cost to maintain it! 

  • A modest marketing budget

We aren't talking billboards here. More like enough funding to run mini campaigns on social media, like Facebook and Instagram - $500 would be ideal to get us through the end of the year.

  • Permits and licenses 

It cost us about $1,500 just to get a catering license, which was minimal. Opening a mobile kitchen is a totally different ball game. PLUS, we will have to maintain both licenses in order to continue doing private caterings and servicing the public on our truck.

  • Added equipment expenses needed in order to continue functioning inside of 'Food Truck Alley'. 

Though we are striving for a food truck, we would love the opportunity to continue serving our crêpes inside of 'Food Truck Alley' at a designated indoor location on those not so sunny days or when winter comes, enabling us to generate income and service the public in a cozy spot.

 

THE PERKS:

To show our gratitude and appreciation for your support we have a great lineup of incentives and patron swag everyone can get down with.

  • Limited Edition T-Shirts

  • CCC punch cards. Depending on the donation amount you can get anywhere between a three to ten crêpe punch card. 
  • Dinner and a show! And by dinner we mean custom crêpes at our house, and by show we mean you can watch us make it ... 
  • Create your own crêpe recipe that we will feature on our menu
  • Your name engraved on our truck + a personal catering for up to six of your closest friends
  • We come to you and cater for up to 15 people
  • And for those big spenders, an entire catering event on us: wedding, business conference, babyshower, birthday - you name it! We'll travel up to 60 miles and cater up to 150 people. 

IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL:

If we don't reach our campaign funding goal we still intend on opening the food truck, it just might take more time to figure out additional funding options to see the project through. What we will do with the funds we do raise is open a separate business savings account until we reach the amount we need to fully invest in the truck and all our startup needs. 

While we are in the process of defining funding, we hope to sustain ourselves and continue spreading the word about CCC while being hosted inside of 'Food Truck Alley'. 

The Impact

As some may, or may not know, Colorado Springs is about five years behind national trends - if not more. However, it is sitting on a pile of potential not just with the promise it holds inside of its young entrepreneurs, but with the demand its market will hold [and does hold] for innovation and progress. Many people now understand the boom inside Colorado's real estate market, especially as it relates to Denver; but county lines can only hold so many. With the new RTD rail system beginning its build alongside I-25, it will only be a matter of time before demand for more diversity, inclusiveness, and culture spill over into Colorado's second largest city. We are well on our way, but it's inspiring to know that patrons like you can say "I helped paved the way" in creating an aspect of all these ideals inside a venture like this one. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

While monetary contribution helps, it's not the only way to help get us started. 

  • Word of mouth is HUGE. Simply telling others about our project and what we are looking to do helps us tremendously.  You never know who might have an extra buck or two to throw our way or who might be in our neck of the woods and would like to support us once we do get the truck on the road. 
  • SHARING IS CARING! Post this project on your instragram, facebook, twitter, snap story - whatever! The more buzz we can generate, the more awareness we generate -  not just for the purpose of raising  money, but for businesses like us that have a market sharing mentality. One of our main goals is to bring business back to its grassroots, emphasizing the importance of community as opposed to competition.
