story:
Kitsap Bartending Services & The Bus

Our mobile business has reached a demand where we need to grow - and we want to do that in a creative and fun way, that will help continue building our brand that is Kitsap Bartending Services. We have proven success in the mobile bartending business and event industry, but with the high-demand, we need to grow our inventory - and in order to expand, we need help from the community.

One way that we'd like to grow is by creating something fun, creative, and totally different than any other service in the area. We are building a mobile bar for events, but taking it in a literal sense. We are currently working to transform our 1975 VW Bus into a "pull-up and go" mobile bar. Once parked at the event, the roof will raise, the lights will turn on, and the side will fold down into a full-service bar - where guests can order an ice cold beer from our on-board kegerator, a glass of wine from our wine rack, or have a signature cocktail made from our talented Bartenders, fully stocked with all of the necessary tools to build a delicious beverage.

Part of our success, as Kitsap Bartending Services, is in part due to taking pride in all of our services and creativity. We strive to bring clients the best event possible, each and every time. Whether it is hosting the bar at a private event/wedding, teaching a class, or venturing out on our monthly Kitsap Brewery Tours - we always try to exceed expectations. 

With the time and money that we've already invested in ourselves, and continue to do, your help will be extremely beneficial in helping fund our project - along with building awareness through marketing materials, staffing requirements, relationships with fellow local businesses, and other projects to help bring something original to Kitsap County and the Puget Sound region. We have already generated a lot of buzz and excitement over our current events, and brand itself, and we know it will only continue to gain momentum from here.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to expand and build our mobile bar, we will need help, financially. We are working with Those Guys Rod & Customs on the Kitsap Peninsula on the remodel and design - and as you know, custom body work and especially commercial-grade projects, are not cheap. We have already invested thousands of our own money into building our brand, buying the VW Bus, all the supplies needed for bar services, and even some of the body work. Along with money, we have dedicated countless hours/years planning, designing, studying, and working to make Kitsap Bartending Services a success, and continue to work to be better each day.

We need a total of $18,000 to help with all of the body work, paint, interior (cooling systems, lights, etc.). Also that money will go to expanding other business needs - bar tables, glassware, marketing material, insurance, vehicle maintenance, and uniforms. Most of the money will be used to work with other local business owners and stay within our region. If we do not meet our goal - our first priority is take what we do raise and put that into the bus, then other bar set-up materials and glassware.

As a "thank you" we have provided some really exciting gifts - which some will only be available through this campaign - including a custom-designed "I Backed the Bus" T-shirt by Ploy. Design Studio of Bremerton. Also available, a signature glass printed locally, a private event with the VW Bus, a Educational Cocktail Party, and an opportunity for business sponsorship with your name on our website and on the bus itself!

The Impact

Kitsap is growing and with that growth we need creativity, we need innovation, and we need something fun! We believe that we are the ones to help create that - or at least contribute to its growth. Whether you are getting married, hosting an event, or looking to take a fun class, helping us reach our goal will benefit all in both a fun way and as a community. Even if you have no plans to use our services - we have a motto of "keeping it local" where we invest and work with local businesses in every aspect that we can, in order to build-up the community and people around us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word - help continue the buzz! Share this event to social media. Help spread the word about our ideas and our creativity. 

Thank you for considering an investment to us and to small business!

Cheers,
Kitsap Bartending Services
story_txt:
Kitsap Bartending Services & The Bus
Our mobile business has reached a demand where we need to grow - and we want to do that in a creative and fun way, that will help continue building our brand that is Kitsap Bartending Services. We have proven success in the mobile bartending business and event industry, but with the high-demand, we need to grow our inventory - and in order to expand, we need help from the community.One way that we'd like to grow is by creating something fun, creative, and totally different than any other service in the area. We are building a mobile bar for events, but taking it in a literal sense. We are currently working to transform our 1975 VW Bus into a "pull-up and go" mobile bar. Once parked at the event, the roof will raise, the lights will turn on, and the side will fold down into a full-service bar - where guests can order an ice cold beer from our on-board kegerator, a glass of wine from our wine rack, or have a signature cocktail made from our talented Bartenders, fully stocked with all of the necessary tools to build a delicious beverage.
Part of our success, as Kitsap Bartending Services, is in part due to taking pride in all of our services and creativity. We strive to bring clients the best event possible, each and every time. Whether it is hosting the bar at a private event/wedding, teaching a class, or venturing out on our monthly Kitsap Brewery Tours - we always try to exceed expectations. 
With the time and money that we've already invested in ourselves, and continue to do, your help will be extremely beneficial in helping fund our project - along with building awareness through marketing materials, staffing requirements, relationships with fellow local businesses, and other projects to help bring something original to Kitsap County and the Puget Sound region. We have already generated a lot of buzz and excitement over our current events, and brand itself, and we know it will only continue to gain momentum from here.

What We Need & What You Get
In order to expand and build our mobile bar, we will need help, financially. We are working with Those Guys Rod & Customs on the Kitsap Peninsula on the remodel and design - and as you know, custom body work and especially commercial-grade projects, are not cheap. We have already invested thousands of our own money into building our brand, buying the VW Bus, all the supplies needed for bar services, and even some of the body work. Along with money, we have dedicated countless hours/years planning, designing, studying, and working to make Kitsap Bartending Services a success, and continue to work to be better each day.
We need a total of $18,000 to help with all of the body work, paint, interior (cooling systems, lights, etc.). Also that money will go to expanding other business needs - bar tables, glassware, marketing material, insurance, vehicle maintenance, and uniforms. Most of the money will be used to work with other local business owners and stay within our region. If we do not meet our goal - our first priority is take what we do raise and put that into the bus, then other bar set-up materials and glassware.As a "thank you" we have provided some really exciting gifts - which some will only be available through this campaign - including a custom-designed "I Backed the Bus" T-shirt by Ploy. Design Studio of Bremerton. Also available, a signature glass printed locally, a private event with the VW Bus, a Educational Cocktail Party, and an opportunity for business sponsorship with your name on our website and on the bus itself!

The Impact
Kitsap is growing and with that growth we need creativity, we need innovation, and we need something fun! We believe that we are the ones to help create that - or at least contribute to its growth. Whether you are getting married, hosting an event, or looking to take a fun class, helping us reach our goal will benefit all in both a fun way and as a community. Even if you have no plans to use our services - we have a motto of "keeping it local" where we invest and work with local businesses in every aspect that we can, in order to build-up the community and people around us.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Help spread the word - help continue the buzz! Share this event to social media. Help spread the word about our ideas and our creativity. Thank you for considering an investment to us and to small business!Cheers,Kitsap Bartending Services

story:
Dosanko restaurant started as the dream of Nathan and Akiyo Lowey.

It has been in development for over ten years. Nathan was attending culinary school and he met Akiyo. We had a vision to open a restaurant but wanted to learn as as much as we could before putting it all on the line. We've Worked in some of the finest restaurants in Canada honing our skills to prepare for our own business. Nathan received red seal certification in cooking over a decade ago. He has been a chef at four top restaurants and has specialized in making dishes using unrefined ingredients including, breads, noodles, pastries, cured meats, preserved vegetables and sauces. Akiyo learned to cook from her Mother and Grandmother, she also attended a collage in Hokkaido focusing on cooking, nutrition and Japanese tea ceremony. Akiyo then moved to Canada to advance her study in english. While she attended collage in Canada she worked in restaurants, starting in the kitchen were she eventually became the Chef. After working her way through two kitchens she started to focus on the front of house. She quickly became a strong member of the service staff, attained supervisor positions and eventually assistant manager. Our location is Japantown, downtown Vancouver. We heard about this space and were very excited to get a chance to open a Japanese restaurant in Japantown. We get to help reinforce the Japanese culture in this historic area.

Our location at 566 Powell St. with a mockup of our future signage. 

Akiyo and Nathan have two children Liam and Maya. The Kids have been very excited about this project and have both helped with dishes, sweeping up and wiping tables.  We feel working in a restaurant is a invaluable job for teaching life lessons and think everyone should work in a restaurant at some point in their lives to learn about service to be humble. 

Inside Dosanko Restaurant - Ready to be filled up with Food and People.

We have saved a long time and put everything we have into this project. This Campaign will raise the remaining capital required to smoothly transition from a dream to a reality. We are calling on like minded individuals to get behind us and bring something new and delicious to Vancouver. With the $7000 raised during this campaign we will be able to purchases high end Japanese whiskeys, natural wines, beautiful sake and give us a healthy cash flow to start our business.You can help take Dosanko  to the next level and help us bring a fine dining quality to a homestyle restaurant accessible to everyone.

We have some unique rewards in the perk section. From a piece of art work from our children to koji and miso making classes, there is something for everyone at every level of donation. Please donate whatever you can. 

Our concept has been to bring fine dinning quality cuisine to a more diverse demographic. We want to make high quality food for hard working people and families who deserve it. Not just the rich or fortunate. Every one deserves to fuel their body with healthy, seasonal, local, probiotic and nutrient rich food. We feel strongly about healthy diet and enjoying food with friends and family. We are serving  food we make for our own children and family.

The restaurant industry is volatile to say the least. We know the statistics on restaurant closure. We have no corporate backers or even assets for traditional loans. We have had to save and get creative to raise the capital so far. Knowing the difficulties pushed us to research and learn as much as possible before moving forward with the purchase. The business plan alone required much research and helped us learn about the intricacies of the business. Our experience in varied restaurants gives us confidence in our decision To open. We have created relationships with farmers, suppliers, industry veterans, trades people, and learned skills in hospitality and people management. These are invaluable skills and only obtainable by hands on hard work. We have a highly qualified team in place who's skills cover all bases. From marketing to accounting  we have highly trained people in place to ensure we are running smoothly.

Even if you can't donate money to our cause you can still be involved and make a difference! You can help by following us on Facebook and Instagram, help by sharing our campaign with your followers. You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this site! We need to spread the word about Dosanko and get all the people who want to make a difference in what we put in our bodies and where our food  comes from. it is important to know just how deep the phrase you are what you eat is. Once people start eating more healthy, local, delicious, nutritious, food, we will see a changes in peoples health and outlooks our community. Food brings people together.  

Thank you all so very much!!   

Perks

$100 - T-shirt or Gift Card -  Besides getting lots of love sent your way when you make a $100 Donation, you'll get to choose between a Dosanko $25 Gift Card or this sexy Dosanko T-shirt!

story:
Hey everyone, I’m Walter- a father, husband, artist, social entrepreneur, & owner of Color Grind, a monthly subscription box that makes it easy to discover and support black businesses. My wife Jeanine is a fantastic wife and mother who also is an artist who quilts, paints, and designs clothing. In addition, we are avid tea and coffee drinkers who have an addiction to fun and interesting coffee mugs.

 

We created Black As A Mug® because we grew tired of the mugs with the witty or inspirational quotes that often times will disappear after a few good washings. We became passionate about creating our own mugs; not only mugs but functional pieces of artwork that celebrate our culture, our beauty, our brilliance, our creativity, our determination, our resilience, and maybe most importantly, a celebration of us for being so damn dope! 

​

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for your support to make Black As A Mug® a huge success! Let us tell you how you can help. The following will detail exactly where your donations will go:

Our primary expense will be to have Black As A Mug® mugs produced. Our manufacturer’s minimum is 1000 units per mug design. Our goal is to produce 1000 mugs this first go around.

Other expenses include shipping costs, a thorough inspection of each mug by a 3rd party company to assure that each mug is top quality, warehouse fees, web development, & the server bill. These expenses are itemized here:

Cost of Mugs: $20,000

The breakdown of what's involved. 

Shipping costs, Inspection, Warehouse fees, Web development, Server bill, Licensing cost:

If we don’t reach our goal, we will use the Flexfunds to continue with the produce and distribution of Black As A Mug®.  

So what are the perks? As a supporter, you get the unique opportunity to be the first to receive a Black As A Mug®. As a bonus, this first batch of 1000 mugs will be numbered making these mugs collector’s items.

The Impact

The collective potential impact of this campaign is what we are most excited about! 5% of all proceeds from Black As A Mug® sales will be contributed to creating sustainable and much-needed opportunities within black communities. We see Black As A Mug® as a vehicle to create innovative youth scholarships to support the work that is being done in their community. We also plan to assist scholars in using local data and community needs inquiry build projects that will make the biggest and most positive impact. We believe Black As A Mug® will provide a unique experience that will empower young leaders to be great and our communities to become even greater. We will set up a sister site so you can follow the amazing work and progress that you helped make happen. 

Risks & Challenges

There are several hands that Black As A Mug® must pass through in order to be produced. One of the major challenges we foresee in creating Black As A Mug® is that we have no experience with the ins and outs of manufacturing. Although we are learning a lot daily, we are risking a great deal financially to make Black As A Mug® a reality. This venture has taken a great deal of research and money. We have spent the last 6 months identifying talented designers, testing sample proofs, and obsessing over every detail to portray an accurate and respectable image of our legends (who would have thought skin color would a challenge!!).

Please be sure to share this with everyone you know to ensure this project is a big success.

Thank you for your support and we look forward to making a change one mug at a time.

Sincerely,

Walter & Jeanine Logan

story:
Short Summary

Growing up my Dad would always tell me and my sisters "there is no better business than being in business for yourself" and things like "the only way to success in through dedication, passion, and hard work". My father's teachings grew on me, and over time this would make me into the strong business women, mother and wife I am today. I was born and bread into entrepreneurship, as a little girl, I would spend my summers creating and building lemonade stands and selling my old and used books with creating neighborhood bookstore.

Being a business owner is very important to me, it is my way of life. As I continue to grow every day the one thing that I am sure of is my devotion to leadership. As well as my strong desire to create opportunities and jobs.

If you decide to contribute to this campaign, you will be apart of paving the way to create more jobs in our nations. One of Bomba's Slush ultimate dreams is to be able to give back to the community threw affiliating its self with nonprofit organizations that enrich and empower the youth, as well as nonprofits that feed the less fortunate.       

 

Bomba's Slush is seeking to raise $8,000.00. The money that is raised for this campaign will go to relocating existing equipment, as well as the purchase of new equipment to fulfill the requested demand. New permits will also need to be purchased to qualify for certain locations. The final portion of the money will go to the help of purchasing a company car, one that will be able to haul our transportation trailer, so that we are not having to rent Uhaul cars every week. As well as cutting out the costs of movers which can become very costly. 

Supporting Bomba's Slush will not only be your contribution to creating jobs in our country, but it will also keep you apart of the Bomba's Slush Family Forever. At the end of the second fiscal year, we will be keeping in close touch with our supporters sending surprise merchandise and discount offers to your address. 

In the event that all the money is not raised, we will cut down cost as best we can and delicate money where it is most needed. However, are hoping to raise the full amount as we have had to cut down cost already. 

 

We do understand that some of our supporters just may not be able to contribute to helping us grow our business and that okay. There other ways to help without a donation, we are asking our supporters to please share our story with anyone you may know, that would be interested in our story and supporting the growth of our business. 

Come on Guys, help us get the word out there and let's make some noise.

story:
Introducing Magic Flask: Upgrade Inexpensive Liquor into a Smooth Drink

The Magic Flask is a must have for every liquor lover. Infused with positive energy waves thanks to a patent-protected bioresonance process, the flask produces a top shelf experience.  Designed to make inexpensive alcohol taste better, the infused stainless steel flask makes the liquor taste smoother in under an hour. Simply pour inexpensive liquor into the flask, wait 30 minutes, and enjoy!

Say goodbye to uncomfortable burning sensations when drinking bottom shelf liquor! Better yet, say goodbye to filtering bottom shelf liquor with the Brita filter!

 

How It Works

Reviews

Help us grow the Magic Flask community by sharing this with a someone you know who needs a Magic Flask!

 

          

 

Perks

Super Early Bird 7oz Magic Flask $25

Comes in Metallic Black & Rose Gold

 

Early Bird 7oz Magic Flask $27

Comes in Metallic Black & Rose Gold

 

Indiegogo Special 7oz $29

Comes in Metallic Black & Rose Gold

Early Delivery 18oz Hangout Flask $33

Stainless Steel (non-painted) with Leather Case

Will deliver by May 12

Super Early Bird 18oz Hangout Flask $33

Comes in Metallic Black with Leather Case

 

Early Bird 18oz Hangout Flask $36

Comes in Metallic Black with Leather Case

 

Indiegogo Special 18oz Hangout Flask $39

Comes in Metallic Black with Leather Case


To our VIP Backers who spend over $200 - You will receive a FREE Magic Flask with custom engraving and a funnel for easy pouring as a GIFT!

*Limit to 20 letters for custom engraving.

 

Timeline

Who We Are

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges we have dealt with and will continue to deal with is skepticism since the technology to make the Magic Flask is new. We have had over 400 people test out this product and we guarantee that it will work with inexpensive liquor containing high alcohol content!

 

FAQ

What is Magic Flask?

Magic Flask is a patent protected product that is designed to quickly upgrade inexpensive liquor into something smooth and respectable. Simply pour the entry level liquor (gin, whiskey, tequila, vodka, etc.) into the flask – wait at least thirty minutes or longer and enjoy!

How does Magic Flask enhance the taste of liquor?

The Magic Flask uses bioresonance-related technology, using electromagnetic waves that allows the stainless steel container have qualitative changes to the liquid and alcoholic content. According to bioresonance technology, the changes that occur is not limited to liquor, but all liquid drink like coffee or smoothie.

What kind of liquor works best? What is recommended?

Magic Flask works best for inexpensive liquor of high alcohol content especially whiskey, bourbon, tequila, vodka, cognac, rum, etc. Hot liquor is also very effective in the Flask, although if used with premium level hot liquor, the changes would not be as noticeable.

Will the liquor taste the same after it has been poured out of the Magic Flask?

Yes, once the Magic Flask upgrades the liquor, the liquor will stay the same.

I have noticed the liquor from the Magic Flask turned darker. Why is that?

This browning process is caused by the nature of stainless steel and will go away after a few uses. We suggest that the Flask be rinsed a couple times before use.

How long is the warranty for the Magic Flask?

Your Magic Flask comes with a 12 months warranty. Please contact us at info@magicflask.us for any questions you may have!

We suggest that the Flask be rinsed a couple times before use.How long is the warranty for the Magic Flask?Your Magic Flask comes with a 12 months warranty. Please contact us at info@magicflask.us for any questions you may have!

story:
Why do we want to do this?

Basically for the fun of it.

We love our pub and our customers and we think this will be a really cool way to improve one and give joy to the other.

 

So Who Are We?

I'm Matt Otley and with my wife Gabby we run The Otley, on Forest Road, Trefforest. For the last 3 years we've been in the blessed position to run one of the most rewarding community pubs in the area and are always looking for new ways to bring more joy to the community.

What do we need?

We need £10,000 to fund the upgrade of the electric supply and to purchase a brew kit.

£2,800 for the electric

£7000 for the brew kit and ancillaries 

Why are we using crowd funding?

We are using crowd funding to help us get this project off the ground as soon as possible. Without it we'll still buy a brew kit but it will take longer and it will involve dealing with banks (and who wants to do that?)

We've always been a community pub and we feel this is going a step further to getting the local community involved in all things beer. It can be a great process creating your own brew and we're really excited to be in a position where we can let people from the local community and further afield brew their very own beer.

 

What would be the impact?

To be honest Not that much!

We're not doing this to become millionaires. The brew kit we're buying is quite small and humble. We're doing it because we're passionate about beer!

So what do you get out of it?

First and foremost, your local will become a Brew Pub, with some of the freshest beer in south Wales! But we will also be giving you some perks 

  • Big launch party with food
  • Brew days
  • Membership scheme
  • Cool Merchandise
  • Great beers
  • Bigger events
  • Build and plan your wedding!

 

What are the risks?

There aren't many really! whether we hit our target or not we'll be launching our micro brewery either way. It's just without your support it will likely take longer. 

 

Are there other ways you can help?

Share the hell out of it! Help us spread the word as far as we can so we can get brewing!

story:
We want to share our beer with you!

Beer is where Michael’s passion for the art of fermentation began back in 1995. From there he discovered mead which led to the creation of Moonlight Meadery.

With the help of our friends, family, and many loyal fans, Moonlight Meadery has become one of the top meaderies in the country. Now it is time we expand our offerings to include the world of malt.

Hidden Moon Brewing is here to bring you delicious, limited release, one-off beers… but we won’t be making any old beer - we will be making the oldest kind: braggots (beers brewed with honey in additional to malt and hops).

By taking up to 50% of the base malt out of the recipe and substituting it with the same amount of sugar from honey, we can make some truly amazing brews with dynamic flavors you cannot get otherwise. We are going to make big bold Russian Imperial Stouts, IPAs, and Berliner Weisses among others.

We have our Federal and State licenses, we have a distribution network, and have a proven track record of doing what we have been told can’t be done.  We just need your help, as to do this right it’s going to take some money.

Who are we? Beer geeks.

Our family has been making alcohol since the days of prohibition (shhhh, don't tell Uncle Sam), we still have the stoneware crock that Michael's great grandmother used to supply her "tea room" with beer.

Michael began homebrewing in May of 1995 and soon after joined the American Homebrewers Association (where he is now a lifetime member) and Brew Free or Die (NH's oldest homebrew club). In the years that followed he became OBSESSED with all things beer and brewing. He is a Nationally Ranked BJCP Judge and has been continuing to support the hombrew community from the industry side, he was the keynote speaker at the 2017 Blue Bonnet Brew Off and has been attending the AHA Homebrew Conferences for many, many years to share his knowledge and passion for fermentation.

You may have heard Michael on The Brewing Network or Beer Smith podcasts among others, he is always ready and willing to share his art of fermentation with you. We believe information is valuable, and by sharing our knowledge of brewing, meadmaking, and cidermaking, it is better for everyone!

 

Our Collaborations

We are proud to have done collaborations all around the world with some of the best brewer's in the industry. Below are some examples of what we have done:

Evil Bee - Honey IPA collaboration with Heretic Brewing, Fairfield, CA

Hidden Stone - Milk Stout brewed with Avocado Honey, collaboration with Stone Brewing Liberty Station, San Diego, CA

Buzz Worthy - BBA Imperial Honey Stout brewed with over 500 pounds of rare Meadowfoam honey, collaboration with Smog City Brewing, Torrence, CA

Miss Beehavior - Sour Braggot brewed with locally sourced lychee honey and Georgia nectarines, collaboration with J Wakefield Brewing, Miami, FL

RIS Braggot - Russian Imperial Stout with Orange Blossom Honey, brewed with Urban Chestnut, St. Louis, MO

Braggot - 100% of base malts were swapped for Mornington Peninsula Honey, fermented and aged 12 months, collaboration with Cavalier Brewing, Derrimut, VIC Australia

Luna Eye - Honey, cider, and malt make up the grain bill for this 1/2 braggot, 1/2 cyser, 1/2 Kolsch paradox, collaboration with Ciclops Cyderi and Brewery, Spartanburg, SC

Killer Bee - Imperial Stout Braggot brewed for GABS 2016 (Great Austrian Beer Spectacular), and it took the GOLD! Collaboration with Red Hill Brewery, Red Hill South, VIC Australia

Dark Side of the Moonlight - Imperial Honey Porter, collaboration with Nickel Beer Company, Julian, CA

What We Need & What You Get

We already have Federal and State Licenses and a Distribution Network covering 28 states... now we just need the beer!

With the way that federal and state liquor licenses are set up, we are unable to brew with malt in the same facility we use for our meadery. That leaves us with two options:

  1. Build a Brewery: we can either build out a separate facility for brewing beer, or we can acquire a larger facility that would have space for us to make divided partitions for the brewery and meadery so that we can have both licenses under one roof. (This would also allow us to build a bar and bistro where we could host all your beautiful faces and serve full pours of beer, mead, and cider.) This would be $$$.
     
  2. Contract Brewing: use our recipes to brew beer at another brewery's facility. This requires us to prepay for the entire batch. In other words, we have to buy the entire batch of beer before any brewing takes place. Not only is this is very capital intensive and requires a massive cash flow, but the laws limit how and where we can sell contract brewed beer too. We simply don't have the excess cash flow to do this right now.

That's why we are here asking for your help! If we can reach our goal of $50k we will be able to contract brew our Russian Imperial Stout Braggot and sell it in both cans and on draft!

The perks you see are either for vouchers of RIS Braggot that we will be making, for memberships that will guarantee you allotments of our limited release, one-off creations, or for classes that offer expert knowledge on brewing with honey and beer judging based on the BJCP Style Guidelines.

IMPORTANT: Currently there are only 7 states – NE, NH*, ND, OH, OR, VT and VA (and DC) – that allow direct shipment from a brewery to a consumer. If you are in one of those states, you can select the shipping option. Otherwise the beer is only available for IN STORE PICKUP at our Londonderry, NH Location. 

*We are unable to ship to NH addresses at this time, please select in-store pickup.

The Impact

We plan to offer totally unique beers that will push the limits of creativity and taste. We are not only going to think outside the box... we are going to make an entirely new one!

Your contribution will directly fund our dream to make and share the most delicious beers. With your help, we will be able to push the beer industry into new frontiers and take Hidden Moon Brewing to the next level.

We are grateful for the loyal support of our fans, friends, and family - you have helped us build Moonlight Meadery to what it is today. Please dream with us and help us bring our passion for brewing to the public.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean we can't use your help!

Please SHARE our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram... let the whole world know about us!

It is going to take a lot of hands to make this dream a reality, please lend us yours :)

story:
BIOLINEBOX a garden inside home

Grow what you need. Simply and healthy.

Biolinebox is a fully automatic aeroponic system for growing vegetables, aromatic herbs and plants wherever and whenever you want. 
Aeroponic means that water is sprayed on the roots by a regulated vaporizer.
The system ensures an optimal growth according to the selected recipe simply in your home.
The system advises you when the plants are ready to harvesting, but you can also harvest sooner or later, as Biolinebox keeps them in excellent condition for a good period of time.

Save energy, money and time.

Fast and safe germination, 90% water saving and 85% nutrients saving compared to traditional agri-culture.
With Biolinebox you harvest the plants just before consumption. This means no intermediary be-tween you and the crops.
Zero-kilometer products are good for you and for the environment.
With Biolinebox a better way of life is possible.

Flavor. Freshness. Health.

Thanks to Biolinebox, you have high quality fresh vegetables, herbs and spices with the right con-tent of minerals and vitamins. No pesticides and no GMOs.
The system controls water, air, light, vital parameters and nutrients for an optimal growth of the plants and this ensures flavor and freshness.

Natural supports.

The supports contain selected seeds ready to grow.
The support are natural and biocompatible: biodegradable pods, recycled natural fiber cloths, bio-compatible substrates, depending on the type of plant and the desired size. 
Biolinebox recreates the different natural conditions for an optimal growth of the plants.

A garden inside home.

Biolinebox makes an ideal climate wherever you are. 
The software takes care of the plants for you, whether you are on vacation or on business trip.
The led lights reproduce the daily cycle of natural light. 
Every layer is individually controlled so you can grow different crops at the same time.
Biolinebox can fit every environment and need: you choose size and color. 
The inside can be completely visible or discreet.

My story and why BIOLINEBOX is so important

I am Filippo Cabua and I am an agronomist graduated at the University of Milan in agricultural studies with economic and technical orientation and specialized in protection of the territory.  

I am a freelancer and thanks to my experiences and technical skills in 2016 I started the aeroponic greenhouse project. Three main and fundamental reasons pushed me to make it: 
-  water conservation 
-  soil conservation
-  non-use of pesticides and herbicides and the drastic reduction of chemical fertilizers
I built the first prototype to make sure the project worked. 

After many tests in 2017 I decided to build the second one, smaller (40x40x100 cm. / 15x15x55 inches) but much more complete, to adjust it for growing more than 20 different plants. The prototype has been working without stops for 15 months without problems, producing salads, basil, medical plants and more.

 So after spending almost 2 years building, modifying, testing and perfecting this project I am able to complete it, but I realized that alone I could not do it. 
Asking for help and financial support does not scare me either diminish me. I think that asking for help in the moment of need for something very important is a sign of sanity and humility. So here I am. 
I hope and I trust that people see like me the validity and relevance of the project and will want to support me to achieve it because they believe like me that the world can change and improve. Or simply because they like the project. 
And I trust that you will want to support me somehow.

I strongly wanted this crowdfunding campaign to be able to refine and improve Biolinebox, because I would like to put it into production and make it a product for everyone.

Biolinebox would allow people to grow their own plants wherever and whenever they want without any effort and without any specific knowledge, with water and energy savings and above all NO pesticides and herbicides and NO GMOs.

With Biolinebox you know where your vegetables and plants come from. This can be a great difference compared to modern crops full of chemical and synthetic agents, especially for people with allergies and intolerances.

Moreover you can experience the wonder of seeing plants growing under your eyes.

Finally, all this would help reduce the environment pollution and would encourage a lower consumption of water and land: -90% water consumption and -85% chemicals consumption (compared to traditional agriculture) would reduce eutrophication of fluvial and marine waters. Eutrophication is a real problem almost out of control that is causing the proliferation of harmful algae and the loss of biodiversity in lakes and rivers and then in seas and oceans.  It is time to worry and take care of our planet.

Be an active part in something bigger

With your contribution to Biolinebox project, you would be an active part in solving the problem of water consumption in relation to the growing population, due to the urbanization and the climate and environmental changes that have been affecting our planet for years.

Supporting Biolinebox project you make the difference in supporting on a bigger issue: optimizing the cultivation space and at the same time making the vegetables production efficient, to sustain the food needs of the ever-increasing population.

On a large scale with Biolinebox new cultivable spaces can be created in disused urban areas or where the cultivation is difficult or not possible because of bad climate conditions or bad soil characteristics.

Thousands of people would share and apply the zero-kilometer concept without affecting the natural resources of the planet.

WITH BIOLINEBOX A BETTER WAY OF LIFE IS POSSIBLE FOR YOU AND THE PLANET!  SO HELP ME TO GROW THE FUTURE WITH BIOLINEBOX!

The impact of the project on people and environment

Today water is also called ‘Blue Gold’ or Oil of the 21st century’ that means water is very precious. This focus pushed me to design and develop Biolinebox.

While working for the municipality of Monza (a 120,000-habitant city near Milan) in 2007 I presented a water conservation project for the city parks. After 2 years, I achieved the desired goal: approximately 34,000 cubic meters (1,200,000 cubic feet) of drinking water saved. 
This amount corresponded to 72% of the water used to irrigate gardens and parks and run fountains. Thanks to the commitment of a group of people who supported me, thanks to the alternative use of water, which otherwise would have been wasted, today Monza is a water-smart city.

When possible, we should always consider the use of alternative water resources.
By using Biolinebox, we could take part in restoring the natural water cycle by reducing the use of chemicals and soils exploitation.
Just think that the 75% of the water used in traditional agriculture is wasted by evaporation and polluted by persistent fertilizers and pesticides.

Using Biolinebox could give a real contribution to the reconversion of agricultural production and to the return of water and soil to the land. This would give a great opportunity not only to our lives but also to our planet. 

We have to change direction and grow the future.
WITH BIOLINEBOX GROWING THE FUTURE IS POSSIBLE!

Why I ask for € 200,000.00 and where I am going to go

This fund will be used to start and structure the company and to improve, refine and engineer the 2 starting prototypes for indoor growing:

  • Small            40x40x140 cm / 15x15x55 inches
  • Medium        60x60x200 cm / 24x24x79 inches

with the contribution of professionals and specialized companies.

Engineering the prototypes means moving from artisan stage (3-5 pcs. a month) to industrial production (5-10 pcs. a day).

The real dream would be to produce them by my own, without turning to the large groups that would produce it for me. But only by collecting a very higher amount than I ask I could start with my own production.

So if the crowdfunding campaign would go so well, I could produce Biolinebox by my own strength, otherwise I will make Biolinebox produced by a selected company. Some companies asked me to produce it, but before yielding to the proposal of large industrial groups, I want to try to do it myself, with your help, to apply ideas and to use materials that are compatible with the environment and its inhabitants.

The road map

Step-by-step strategy

Step 0 - Reached up
Designing of prototype with aeroponic technology
Production of working prototype 40x40x140 cm. (15x15x55 inches)
Designing of prototype 60x60x200 cm. (24x24x79 inches)
Functional tests and growth tests (15 types of plants)
Supports and seeds tests
Budget spent to date: € 90.000,00

Step 1 - Crowdfunding
Biolinebox company born
Engineering for series production model 40x40x140 cm (15x15x55 inches)
Construction, engineering for series production model 60x60x200 cm (24x24x79 inches)
Improvement of plc, software and application for wireless connection
Budget: € 200.000,00

Step 2 – Manufacturing
2 ways possibility:
1- Transfer of manufacturing to a specialized company
2- Evaluation of crowdfunding, transfer of sales equity, other kind of financing
Series manufacturing starts:
Small model 40x40x140 cm (15x15x55 inches): 1000 pcs/year
Medium model 60x60x200 cm (24x24x79 inches): 1000 pcs/year
Large Model prototype 200x100x200 cm (79x39x79 inches), development and engineering for series manufacturing: 100 pcs/year
Research of biocompatible materials
Study and development of recipes to meet different needs
Selection of no-GMO seeds to provide excellent seeds
Study of nutritional formulas to be eco-friendly
Budget: € 2.500.000,00-3.000.000,00

Risks and challenges and how I exceed

I am aware of the risks and challenges that await me after this fund request campaign. Thanks to my different skills in mechanics, electronics and agrarian, I will be able to face and solve the challenges and the problems of the project implementation.
Until now, I already had to exceed many different issues and I did it, so I know what hard work means and I know that determination and perseverance can make the difference in having success. Now the issues to overcome is the economic one and then the environmental ethics.
I hope to overcome the economic issue thanks to this campaign.

The environmental ethics means to consider the responsibilities humans have with respect to the care of the planet. This has been my vision from the beginning.
The Biolinebox project includes in itself the opportunity to preserve the environment be-cause it is an eco-friendly product as its component are biocompatible, so for its whole du-ration and after, it does not affect the planet.
Moreover, it also includes the opportunity to make us help the environment because it can be an alternative and environmentally friendly solution at a time when the rapidly growing world population with the growing use of pesticides, technology, and industry is impacting and damaging the environmental balances all over the world.
A change can start from everyone, if each of us should make also a little part, we could make a big difference and make the change. 
CHANGE THE FUTURE IS POSSIBLE!
SO HELP ME TO GROW THE FUTURE WITH BIOLINEBOX!

Technical specifics

                            

A continuous voltage of 24 volts powers Biolinebox, so you just have to connect to electrics, or to photovoltaic panel, wind farms or other energy sources.
The energy consumption is measured on hour of work.
As the vital cycle of plants can change from 18 to 12 hour of light, in the growth days Biolinebox does not consume energy for about 6 hours, in the maintenance days it does not consume for about 12 hours.
Moreover, every layer is independent and can be individually managed, so it is possible to have a mixed energy consumption (growth layers and maintenance layers) having a medium consumption for about 14 hours.
The software and the electronic system have been developed and adjusted to manage all the vital parameters of the plants.
Therefore, in the future I am further going to develop this system to manage larger spaces such as large greenhouses and other situation that need to adjust and control the parame-ters.
Biolinebox can be equipped with a water tank or can be connected to the water supply. 
The water tank can control the pH but does not filter, and it has the capacity to make the box works up to about three months. 
The water from pipes is filtered and stored in the water tank where the pH is adjusted for the best efficiency. 
Every layer has the micro fertilization setted for each crop. 
The cultivation of sprouts requires only water. 
The automatic system ensures the water oxygenation to avoid stagnation and other related problems.

Technical specifics of supports and seeds

In the small model you can raise the upper layer to increase the cultivation height up to 80-90 cm (31-35 inches) to grow plants such as tomatoes, hemp and ornamental plants. Support wires are included.
For higher plants (over 1 meter/3,3 feet) and climbing plants I am going to design a medium and a large model with one layer, support wires and growth capacity up to 2 meters/6,6 feet. These models will be produced only after the production of the prototypes already described.
Different supports for different plants allow growing plants from seed or from already ger-minated plants. The supports contain selected seeds ready to grow: biodegradable pods, recycled natural fiber cloths, biocompatible substrates depending on the type of plant and the desired size.
Every plant needs the right space and support to born, grow and live.                                  Different soils have different texture and features.
Biolinebox recreates the different natural conditions for an optimal growth of the plants.
The biological cloth allows cultivation without support, so it is recommended for tender and crisp sprouts and plants such as alfalfa, cat grass and little salads, to enjoy them in the first phase of growth (home use) or to germinate and transfer them in pot or garden (vivarium and farm use).
In the video you can see the supports for salads. 
The provided supports are vacuum and just have to be placed on the top of the cultivation box. Different models of top are provided with the box. 
When you harvest the crop, you just have to dispose the support as compostable waste and replace it with the next one. The basket supports can be reused.
You can grow different plants in the same cultivation box only if Biolinebox can match different recipes having the same growth plan.

TECHNICAL SPECIFICS OF SUPPORTS FOR SEEDS AND SUPPORTS FOR GERMINATED PLANTS:

TECHNICAL SPECIFICS OF THE CLOTHS: 

BIOCOMPATIBLE CLOTHS:

BASKET SUPPORTS:
2 different basket supports for plants with different growth

EXAMPLES OF SEEDING AND GROWING:

Where the fund goes if I don't reach the goal

If I do not reach the funding goal, every amount will help to realize a part of the project:
-    with € 5,000 the company starts
-    with €10,000 the prototype production starts
-    with € 20,000 the prototype construction and engineering go on

If I overcome the funding goal, so I reach more than € 200,000, here below some possibilities:
-    with € 10,000 more: development of 5-8 new plants study
-    with € 20,000 more: the large prototype (200x100x200 cm) production starts 
-    with € 30,000 more: the large prototype construction and engineering go on

With € 1,000,000 I can produce Biolinebox by my own.

Other ways you can help: make some noise and share the project on socials!

If you do not have the possibilities to fund the Biolinebox project, you can help me sharing the project on socials as much as possible.
Talking about BIOLINEBOX with as many people as possible can really make the difference for me! 
Among your contacts, there can be people who will really support my project.
Please share BIOLINEBOX funding campaign by every tool you have!
Thank you for your help and support!
story_txt:
BIOLINEBOX a garden inside homeGrow what you need. Simply and healthy.Biolinebox is a fully automatic aeroponic system for growing vegetables, aromatic herbs and plants wherever and whenever you want. Aeroponic means that water is sprayed on the roots by a regulated vaporizer.The system ensures an optimal growth according to the selected recipe simply in your home.The system advises you when the plants are ready to harvesting, but you can also harvest sooner or later, as Biolinebox keeps them in excellent condition for a good period of time.Save energy, money and time.Fast and safe germination, 90% water saving and 85% nutrients saving compared to traditional agri-culture.With Biolinebox you harvest the plants just before consumption. This means no intermediary be-tween you and the crops.Zero-kilometer products are good for you and for the environment.With Biolinebox a better way of life is possible.Flavor. Freshness. Health.Thanks to Biolinebox, you have high quality fresh vegetables, herbs and spices with the right con-tent of minerals and vitamins. No pesticides and no GMOs.The system controls water, air, light, vital parameters and nutrients for an optimal growth of the plants and this ensures flavor and freshness.Natural supports.The supports contain selected seeds ready to grow.The support are natural and biocompatible: biodegradable pods, recycled natural fiber cloths, bio-compatible substrates, depending on the type of plant and the desired size. Biolinebox recreates the different natural conditions for an optimal growth of the plants.A garden inside home.Biolinebox makes an ideal climate wherever you are. The software takes care of the plants for you, whether you are on vacation or on business trip.The led lights reproduce the daily cycle of natural light. Every layer is individually controlled so you can grow different crops at the same time.Biolinebox can fit every environment and need: you choose size and color. The inside can be completely visible or discreet.My story and why BIOLINEBOX is so important
I am Filippo Cabua and I am an agronomist graduated at the University of Milan in agricultural studies with economic and technical orientation and specialized in protection of the territory.  I am a freelancer and thanks to my experiences and technical skills in 2016 I started the aeroponic greenhouse project. Three main and fundamental reasons pushed me to make it: -  water conservation -  soil conservation-  non-use of pesticides and herbicides and the drastic reduction of chemical fertilizersI built the first prototype to make sure the project worked. After many tests in 2017 I decided to build the second one, smaller (40x40x100 cm. / 15x15x55 inches) but much more complete, to adjust it for growing more than 20 different plants. The prototype has been working without stops for 15 months without problems, producing salads, basil, medical plants and more. So after spending almost 2 years building, modifying, testing and perfecting this project I am able to complete it, but I realized that alone I could not do it. Asking for help and financial support does not scare me either diminish me. I think that asking for help in the moment of need for something very important is a sign of sanity and humility. So here I am. I hope and I trust that people see like me the validity and relevance of the project and will want to support me to achieve it because they believe like me that the world can change and improve. Or simply because they like the project. And I trust that you will want to support me somehow.I strongly wanted this crowdfunding campaign to be able to refine and improve Biolinebox, because I would like to put it into production and make it a product for everyone.Biolinebox would allow people to grow their own plants wherever and whenever they want without any effort and without any specific knowledge, with water and energy savings and above all NO pesticides and herbicides and NO GMOs.With Biolinebox you know where your vegetables and plants come from. This can be a great difference compared to modern crops full of chemical and synthetic agents, especially for people with allergies and intolerances.Moreover you can experience the wonder of seeing plants growing under your eyes.Finally, all this would help reduce the environment pollution and would encourage a lower consumption of water and land: -90% water consumption and -85% chemicals consumption (compared to traditional agriculture) would reduce eutrophication of fluvial and marine waters. Eutrophication is a real problem almost out of control that is causing the proliferation of harmful algae and the loss of biodiversity in lakes and rivers and then in seas and oceans.  It is time to worry and take care of our planet.Be an active part in something biggerWith your contribution to Biolinebox project, you would be an active part in solving the problem of water consumption in relation to the growing population, due to the urbanization and the climate and environmental changes that have been affecting our planet for years.Supporting Biolinebox project you make the difference in supporting on a bigger issue: optimizing the cultivation space and at the same time making the vegetables production efficient, to sustain the food needs of the ever-increasing population.On a large scale with Biolinebox new cultivable spaces can be created in disused urban areas or where the cultivation is difficult or not possible because of bad climate conditions or bad soil characteristics.Thousands of people would share and apply the zero-kilometer concept without affecting the natural resources of the planet.WITH BIOLINEBOX A BETTER WAY OF LIFE IS POSSIBLE FOR YOU AND THE PLANET!  SO HELP ME TO GROW THE FUTURE WITH BIOLINEBOX!The impact of the project on people and environmentToday water is also called ‘Blue Gold’ or Oil of the 21st century’ that means water is very precious. This focus pushed me to design and develop Biolinebox.While working for the municipality of Monza (a 120,000-habitant city near Milan) in 2007 I presented a water conservation project for the city parks. After 2 years, I achieved the desired goal: approximately 34,000 cubic meters (1,200,000 cubic feet) of drinking water saved. This amount corresponded to 72% of the water used to irrigate gardens and parks and run fountains. Thanks to the commitment of a group of people who supported me, thanks to the alternative use of water, which otherwise would have been wasted, today Monza is a water-smart city.When possible, we should always consider the use of alternative water resources.By using Biolinebox, we could take part in restoring the natural water cycle by reducing the use of chemicals and soils exploitation.Just think that the 75% of the water used in traditional agriculture is wasted by evaporation and polluted by persistent fertilizers and pesticides.Using Biolinebox could give a real contribution to the reconversion of agricultural production and to the return of water and soil to the land. This would give a great opportunity not only to our lives but also to our planet. We have to change direction and grow the future.WITH BIOLINEBOX GROWING THE FUTURE IS POSSIBLE!Why I ask for € 200,000.00 and where I am going to goThis fund will be used to start and structure the company and to improve, refine and engineer the 2 starting prototypes for indoor growing:
Small            40x40x140 cm / 15x15x55 inches
Medium        60x60x200 cm / 24x24x79 inches
with the contribution of professionals and specialized companies.Engineering the prototypes means moving from artisan stage (3-5 pcs. a month) to industrial production (5-10 pcs. a day).The real dream would be to produce them by my own, without turning to the large groups that would produce it for me. But only by collecting a very higher amount than I ask I could start with my own production.So if the crowdfunding campaign would go so well, I could produce Biolinebox by my own strength, otherwise I will make Biolinebox produced by a selected company. Some companies asked me to produce it, but before yielding to the proposal of large industrial groups, I want to try to do it myself, with your help, to apply ideas and to use materials that are compatible with the environment and its inhabitants.The road mapStep-by-step strategyStep 0 - Reached upDesigning of prototype with aeroponic technologyProduction of working prototype 40x40x140 cm. (15x15x55 inches)Designing of prototype 60x60x200 cm. (24x24x79 inches)Functional tests and growth tests (15 types of plants)Supports and seeds testsBudget spent to date: € 90.000,00Step 1 - CrowdfundingBiolinebox company bornEngineering for series production model 40x40x140 cm (15x15x55 inches)Construction, engineering for series production model 60x60x200 cm (24x24x79 inches)Improvement of plc, software and application for wireless connectionBudget: € 200.000,00Step 2 – Manufacturing2 ways possibility:1- Transfer of manufacturing to a specialized company2- Evaluation of crowdfunding, transfer of sales equity, other kind of financingSeries manufacturing starts:Small model 40x40x140 cm (15x15x55 inches): 1000 pcs/yearMedium model 60x60x200 cm (24x24x79 inches): 1000 pcs/yearLarge Model prototype 200x100x200 cm (79x39x79 inches), development and engineering for series manufacturing: 100 pcs/yearResearch of biocompatible materialsStudy and development of recipes to meet different needsSelection of no-GMO seeds to provide excellent seedsStudy of nutritional formulas to be eco-friendlyBudget: € 2.500.000,00-3.000.000,00Risks and challenges and how I exceedI am aware of the risks and challenges that await me after this fund request campaign. Thanks to my different skills in mechanics, electronics and agrarian, I will be able to face and solve the challenges and the problems of the project implementation.Until now, I already had to exceed many different issues and I did it, so I know what hard work means and I know that determination and perseverance can make the difference in having success. Now the issues to overcome is the economic one and then the environmental ethics.I hope to overcome the economic issue thanks to this campaign.The environmental ethics means to consider the responsibilities humans have with respect to the care of the planet. This has been my vision from the beginning.The Biolinebox project includes in itself the opportunity to preserve the environment be-cause it is an eco-friendly product as its component are biocompatible, so for its whole du-ration and after, it does not affect the planet.Moreover, it also includes the opportunity to make us help the environment because it can be an alternative and environmentally friendly solution at a time when the rapidly growing world population with the growing use of pesticides, technology, and industry is impacting and damaging the environmental balances all over the world.A change can start from everyone, if each of us should make also a little part, we could make a big difference and make the change. CHANGE THE FUTURE IS POSSIBLE!SO HELP ME TO GROW THE FUTURE WITH BIOLINEBOX!Technical specifics                            A continuous voltage of 24 volts powers Biolinebox, so you just have to connect to electrics, or to photovoltaic panel, wind farms or other energy sources.The energy consumption is measured on hour of work.As the vital cycle of plants can change from 18 to 12 hour of light, in the growth days Biolinebox does not consume energy for about 6 hours, in the maintenance days it does not consume for about 12 hours.Moreover, every layer is independent and can be individually managed, so it is possible to have a mixed energy consumption (growth layers and maintenance layers) having a medium consumption for about 14 hours.The software and the electronic system have been developed and adjusted to manage all the vital parameters of the plants.Therefore, in the future I am further going to develop this system to manage larger spaces such as large greenhouses and other situation that need to adjust and control the parame-ters.Biolinebox can be equipped with a water tank or can be connected to the water supply. The water tank can control the pH but does not filter, and it has the capacity to make the box works up to about three months. The water from pipes is filtered and stored in the water tank where the pH is adjusted for the best efficiency. Every layer has the micro fertilization setted for each crop. The cultivation of sprouts requires only water. The automatic system ensures the water oxygenation to avoid stagnation and other related problems.Technical specifics of supports and seedsIn the small model you can raise the upper layer to increase the cultivation height up to 80-90 cm (31-35 inches) to grow plants such as tomatoes, hemp and ornamental plants. Support wires are included.For higher plants (over 1 meter/3,3 feet) and climbing plants I am going to design a medium and a large model with one layer, support wires and growth capacity up to 2 meters/6,6 feet. These models will be produced only after the production of the prototypes already described.Different supports for different plants allow growing plants from seed or from already ger-minated plants. The supports contain selected seeds ready to grow: biodegradable pods, recycled natural fiber cloths, biocompatible substrates depending on the type of plant and the desired size.Every plant needs the right space and support to born, grow and live.                                  Different soils have different texture and features.Biolinebox recreates the different natural conditions for an optimal growth of the plants.The biological cloth allows cultivation without support, so it is recommended for tender and crisp sprouts and plants such as alfalfa, cat grass and little salads, to enjoy them in the first phase of growth (home use) or to germinate and transfer them in pot or garden (vivarium and farm use).In the video you can see the supports for salads. The provided supports are vacuum and just have to be placed on the top of the cultivation box. Different models of top are provided with the box. When you harvest the crop, you just have to dispose the support as compostable waste and replace it with the next one. The basket supports can be reused.You can grow different plants in the same cultivation box only if Biolinebox can match different recipes having the same growth plan.TECHNICAL SPECIFICS OF SUPPORTS FOR SEEDS AND SUPPORTS FOR GERMINATED PLANTS:TECHNICAL SPECIFICS OF THE CLOTHS: BIOCOMPATIBLE CLOTHS:BASKET SUPPORTS:2 different basket supports for plants with different growthEXAMPLES OF SEEDING AND GROWING:Where the fund goes if I don't reach the goalIf I do not reach the funding goal, every amount will help to realize a part of the project:-    with € 5,000 the company starts-    with €10,000 the prototype production starts-    with € 20,000 the prototype construction and engineering go onIf I overcome the funding goal, so I reach more than € 200,000, here below some possibilities:-    with € 10,000 more: development of 5-8 new plants study-    with € 20,000 more: the large prototype (200x100x200 cm) production starts -    with € 30,000 more: the large prototype construction and engineering go onWith € 1,000,000 I can produce Biolinebox by my own.Other ways you can help: make some noise and share the project on socials!If you do not have the possibilities to fund the Biolinebox project, you can help me sharing the project on socials as much as possible.Talking about BIOLINEBOX with as many people as possible can really make the difference for me! Among your contacts, there can be people who will really support my project.Please share BIOLINEBOX funding campaign by every tool you have!Thank you for your help and support!

story:
Who we are:

  • We are high school sweet hearts who have longed to be modest, self-sufficient organic growers who provide others with an amazing food experience in a holistic and sustainable way. We're the people who's garden has gotten bigger and bigger, finally taking over our yard and needing leased land to contain itself.
  • Shane has been farming commercially from a very young age: picture an 8 year old driving a tractor. He grew up bottle feeding calves and bailing hay on his family's 80 acre farm. Shane has a BA in Music & Theology and is in the final semester of his Masters of Divinity (although his current calling seems to be caring for different type of [feathered] flock). 
  • Emma has been following organic principles and has been interested in sustainability for the past 15 years. Also raised on a homestead in rural Northern Michigan, she's been getting her hands dirty in organic gardening, dabbling in self sufficiency, and long distance horse/foot racing. She was the hippy chick who the conservative farm kid fell for.

What We Need:

In today's world, huge mono-cropped farms are the norm, starting a small organic farm is rare but still costly:

  • $2,500: A Massey Ferguson 255 loader tractor for moving heavy loads of compost and heavy field work that a walk behind rototiller can't do by itself. 
  • $1,800: A BCS walk behind rototiller for vegetable bed preparation. 
  • $2,500: A greenhouse that's already built and ready to be put into full operation. The greenhouse is 20'x100'. 
  • $1,500: A small, 2-wheel drive Mazda pick-up truck for field work and trips to market. Cost includes small trailer for weeks when we're bursting with produce! 
  • $1,400: The tools necessary for planting, weeding, and harvesting. (Jang Seeder & seed plates - $599, clippers - $30, pruners - $30, lettuce knives - $30, stirrup hoe - $40, wheel hoe & attachments - $429, broad fork - $129)
  • $7,500: A cooler for crop storage after harvest. No need to throw out that old, insulated shipping container, we're going to repurpose it for cold storage. (Container: $5,000. Cooling unit: $2,500).
  • $550: Bins for harvest, storage, and market. (Large bins: $13x15=$195; Medium bins: $12x20=$240; Small bins: $10x10=$100)
  • $1,000: Seeds for starting our 2018 crops. 
  • $2,000: Soil care. Compost: $1,500; worm castings: $250; Lime, calcium, glacial rock dust: $250. 
  • $647: Pastured poultry expansion. The PoultryNet® Plus 12/48/3 Starter Kit from PremierOne Fencing $530, an additional 50 feet of netting $117. 
  • $1,000: Profitable Urban Farming training e-course by Curtis Stone at Green City Acres.
  • $750: Quick Cut Greens Harvester.
  • $150: Vinyl farmer's market booth banner.

We are excited to share some awesome 'thank yous' for the donations that you make. We're giving back with T-shirts, veggies through a Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) program, an egg CSA, and farm tours. Please read about all the options over on the right hand side of your screen. 

If we don't reach our fundraising goal, we will use any funds raised for the highest priority items listed above: Seeds, greenhouse, walk behind tractor, and down the line. We will work hard at being resourceful with any financial gifts given.

The Impact

We feel strongly that everyone in our community should have access to the most nutritious foods around. Our goal is to make our vegetables accessible, affordable, and deliciously organic. Your contribution, no matter the size, is helping us expand and achieve our goal. Even a $5 contribution (less than a latte from Starbucks) makes a difference.

We have successfully grown our garden in size every year, adding on more land as we go. This has allowed us to start small and get good at specific crops before branching out. Our method of farming has positive impacts on the environment around us. We make sure to give back to the soil in compost and green manures what it gives to us in vegetables. 

Risks & Challenges

While we're excited to farm, we're also very aware that there could be potentially devastating obstacles ahead of us, and here's what those things could be.

  • The work load: While our work is noble, it's not exactly for the faint of heart. We believe that our upbringing and our work ethic suites us well for the task ahead. We're a young growing family, but have huge hearts and passion for this work.  In addition, if our Indiegogo campaign goes above and beyond, your contributions will allow us to explore the possibility of hiring a field hand to help us with the simple tasks of weeding or harvesting potatoes, beets, and so much more. While the costs aren't included in our campaign, we would need roughly $15,000 over our goal in order to seriously consider an employee. Donate now and guarantee success!
  • Crop failure: Another reality of farming is crop failure.  Maybe it wasn't warm enough, maybe it was too rainy, maybe a plague of locusts was cast down. There are a significant number of contributing factors to crop failures, but through careful planning (currently taking place), we hope to curb and prevent as many of the potential crop failures we could encounter. Additionally, crop diversity and rotations helps prevent utter failure. Our seed list is comprised of over 50 varieties so that sustainability is possible. 
  • Injury: The very reason we live and work in the Yarrow Ecovillage is that there's a swelling community of helpers, neighbours, and friends who long to see each other succeed. Farming is not only hard work, it can be dangerous work because of machinery and heavy lifting. In the event of an injury, we have confidence that our community would rally around us and help our farm push forward towards growth and success.
  • Study: "Information is power." While it's true that information can only get you so far, we strongly support the philosophy that we must learn from those who have gone before us. We are deeply indebted to the farmers who have come before us, as they've instilled within us a deep wealth of knowledge and information from mentoring us over the past 3 years. But, we will continue our studies along the way to best equip ourselves to deal with obstacles and challenges associated with farming and running a business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some folks just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Follow us on Instagram or Facebook.
  • Please, please, please share our link on your Facebook page, your Instagram account, or any other form of social media you use. 
  • If you can't jump on board financially, help us by letting others know what we're about. 
  • Tell your grandma!

We thank you!

Seriously, we can't believe we get the opportunity to raise funds for our farm. By looking through and giving to our campaign, you will help us get our foot into the barn. Farming is hard work but so gratifying, we can't wait to begin! Thank you for partnering with us!
