story:
About OLIVERO - It's All Okay!

Hi, my name is Oliver Wong. I am from the historical state of Malacca in Malaysia. I was trained as a horticulturist and loves nature, thanks to my Biology teacher during middle school.

Since young, I have always loves to do things with my hand. My passion for Do-It-Yourself, DIY deepened when I bought my house and decided to do the house renovation myself.

Since 2016, I decided to make my passion my life. I invested in a lot of tools and machinery to built many of my house furniture's and started everything from the ground up.

Finally, I decided that a chopping board would be the perfect first product to bear my name.

The success of OLIVERO will be a testament for my passion in creating a product that is  unique, tough and reliable.

OLIVERO is here for the long run....

 

MY LITTLE BIT FOR MOTHER NATURE

At OLIVERO, all my boards are made of reclaimed wood. It takes more times and dedication to make reclaimed wood a working piece. But, it is all worth it because NO MORE NEW TREES BEING FELLED! Something that I feel very strongly about.

 

NORMAL JOINT VS OLIVERO JOINT

When building a wooden chopping board, the timber will need to be glued using wood glue. At OLIVERO, I only use food safe wood glue, approved by US FDA for indirect food contact.

NORMAL JOINT

When joining pieces of wood together, the below normal joint is used by everyone in making chopping board worldwide. 

This normal joint is easy to cut and make. The strength of this joint is dependent on the adhesion of the glue alone.

Normal joint has more tendency to warp, twist and ultimately, failure of the joint.

 

OLIVERO JOINT

My signature OLIVERO joint is harder to cut and make. It takes more time and accuracy to make this joint.

However, it is stronger because it not only dependent on the glue alone, it also rely on the strength of the wood.

Therefore, OLIVERO joint will have less tendency to warp and twist. This makes for a permanent success of the joint.

By making my chopping board using my signature OLIVERO joint, I believe it is the ultimate chopping board!

 

THE BOARDS

For 2018, I have decided to make OLIVERO chopping board in 2 different series, limited in production and individually recorded.

All boards will feature my signature OLIVERO joint!

More details below....

 

PIONEER SERIES

This board will be made from Balau (Shorea spp.) timber.

According to Malaysia Timber Council, this wood is categorized as Heavy Hardwood with a density of 850-1,155 kg/m3 air dry. It's strength properties falls into Strength Group A or SG1.

This board would be an end grain chopping board with a dimension of 300mm × 450mm × 40mm. This design will never be replicated in my future chopping board. Weight ranges about 5-6 kilograms.

For 2018, only 500 pieces will be made worldwide. Each board comes with a brass plate denoting the series and serial number.

On top of that, each board will be individually photographed and recorded. This data would be crucial should the owner of the board would like to authenticate their board originality.

All PIONEER SERIES board would also comes with a certificate of authenticity, care instructions manual & a surprise gift.

 

COLLECTOR'S SERIES

This board will be made from Chengal (Neobalanocarpus heimii) timber. This wood is well known in the tropics as the most durable, strongest and most expensive in the market.

According to Malaysia Timber Council, this wood is categorized as Heavy Hardwood with a density of 915-980 kg/m3 air dry. It's strength properties falls into Strength Group A or SG1.

This board would be an end grain chopping board with a dimension of 450mm × 450mm × 75mm. This design will never be replicated in my future chopping board.Weight ranges about 10-12 kilograms.

For 2018, only 100 pieces will be made worldwide. Each board comes with a brass plate denoting the series and serial number.

On top of that, each board will be individually photographed and recorded. This data would be crucial should the owner of the board would like to authenticate their board originality.

All COLLECTOR'S SERIES board would also comes with a certificate of authenticity, care instructions manual & a surprise gift.

 

LIVING PRODUCTS

OLIVERO chopping board is alive! 

The photos above are prototypes of my boards. Like many living products, there will be variations in the end grain patterns, colour, texture and weight in the final product. These are due to different aging of the wood, the environment it has been exposed and etc.

For me these variations are best examples of Mother Nature at work. These variations tells the story of the timber in a special and beautiful way.

Having said these, I fully guarantees that the wood used will be of the timber species mentioned. I will not take short cuts, undercut, or off cuts....Only clear cut timber species certified by the Malaysia Timber Industry Board (MTIB).

Samples of the Timber Verification Service certificate by the Malaysia Timber Industry Board issued to me

 

PRODUCTION

Unlike many campaigns that outsource their production to factories, my chopping board will be personally handmade by myself! EVERY SINGLE PIECE!

I do not outsource any of my work except for the brass plate which I get from a trusted supplier.

By doing this, I can ensure the quality of my work is of the highest.

Hence, the limited run of my products.

Of course, my beloved wife, my family and my friends are always by my side to support me in any way necessary.

When my campaign goes live, I will start with the production immediately with my available wood stocks. More wood stocks will be purchased at the end of my campaign. 

This is necessary as I will need all the time available to ensure my dateline delivery by December 2018. 

However, as with any product, unforeseen delays can happen. I promise to keep my backers updated throughout the process and will let you know if I foresee any updates to the delivery timeline. Stay tuned to my social media and video streaming updates.

 

SAFETY IS MY FIRST PRIORITY

Both the PIONEER SERIES and COLLECTOR'S SERIES are made using FDA approved for indirect food contact glue.

They are also finished in mineral oil that has HALAL certification, KOSHER certification and NSF certification, on top of being certified for direct food contact, 3H.

Note: More details on the brand of the products used can be obtained by directly contacting me. I cannot mention it here due to copyright issues.

 

PERKS & SHIPPING

When you backed me up, I will be able to use the funds to expand my current workplace.

I will also be able to further enhanced my website for better customer experience. This is an area which I really need help as I am not so tech-savvy.

There will be more products by OLIVERO in the future!

For this Indiegogo campaign, I am offering 50% discount on all my chopping boards, both the PIONEER SERIES and the COLLECTOR'S SERIES.

Early Backers (those who registered their email address in the pre-launch page) will get an additional 18% discount on top of the Indiegogo 50% discount. So, total discount is 68% for Early Backers. Current Backers is entitled for a 50% discount, only at Indiegogo!

As my chopping boards are very heavy, it will incur very high delivery charges to ship worldwide. Thus, I am very sorry that I cannot afford to give free shipping worldwide at this discounted price.

However, I am willing to absorb some of these delivery charges and offer a very attractive shipping rates when you get more than 1 unit of my chopping boards. I believe the shipping rates quoted will be acceptable considering that it will come from tropical Malaysia.

All items will be shipped by air by a reputable courier company, with tracking number provided. 

Do support me and check out the perks!

 

SUMMARY

When you own a piece of an OLIVERO chopping board, you are getting the:

  • first handcrafted, serialized, tropical heavy hardwood chopping board in the world!
  • first edition of OLIVERO chopping board featuring the OLIVERO signature joint!
  • first chopping board made with durability and safety in mind!
  • saving the environment by not encouraging the felling of more trees!
  • saves money because there is no need to buy another chopping board anymore!
  • ultimate chopping board that will truly outlast you!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you share my passion and dedication but can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help me spread the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools

Last but not least, I am so confident you’ll love my chopping boards as much as I do. However, if you have any questions or issues, please message me directly so that I can adress it right. I am looking forward for my backers to chop till you drop!

Thank you....

"Mother Nature is the artist, I am only the designer...." OLIVER WONG
story_txt:
About OLIVERO - It's All Okay!
Hi, my name is Oliver Wong. I am from the historical state of Malacca in Malaysia. I was trained as a horticulturist and loves nature, thanks to my Biology teacher during middle school.
Since young, I have always loves to do things with my hand. My passion for Do-It-Yourself, DIY deepened when I bought my house and decided to do the house renovation myself.
Since 2016, I decided to make my passion my life. I invested in a lot of tools and machinery to built many of my house furniture's and started everything from the ground up.
Finally, I decided that a chopping board would be the perfect first product to bear my name.
The success of OLIVERO will be a testament for my passion in creating a product that is  unique, tough and reliable.
OLIVERO is here for the long run....
 
MY LITTLE BIT FOR MOTHER NATURE


At OLIVERO, all my boards are made of reclaimed wood. It takes more times and dedication to make reclaimed wood a working piece. But, it is all worth it because NO MORE NEW TREES BEING FELLED! Something that I feel very strongly about.
 
NORMAL JOINT VS OLIVERO JOINT
When building a wooden chopping board, the timber will need to be glued using wood glue. At OLIVERO, I only use food safe wood glue, approved by US FDA for indirect food contact.
NORMAL JOINT
When joining pieces of wood together, the below normal joint is used by everyone in making chopping board worldwide. 

This normal joint is easy to cut and make. The strength of this joint is dependent on the adhesion of the glue alone.
Normal joint has more tendency to warp, twist and ultimately, failure of the joint.
 
OLIVERO JOINT
My signature OLIVERO joint is harder to cut and make. It takes more time and accuracy to make this joint.
However, it is stronger because it not only dependent on the glue alone, it also rely on the strength of the wood.
Therefore, OLIVERO joint will have less tendency to warp and twist. This makes for a permanent success of the joint.
By making my chopping board using my signature OLIVERO joint, I believe it is the ultimate chopping board!

 
THE BOARDS
For 2018, I have decided to make OLIVERO chopping board in 2 different series, limited in production and individually recorded.
All boards will feature my signature OLIVERO joint!
More details below....
 

PIONEER SERIES



This board will be made from Balau (Shorea spp.) timber.
According to Malaysia Timber Council, this wood is categorized as Heavy Hardwood with a density of 850-1,155 kg/m3 air dry. It's strength properties falls into Strength Group A or SG1.
This board would be an end grain chopping board with a dimension of 300mm × 450mm × 40mm. This design will never be replicated in my future chopping board. Weight ranges about 5-6 kilograms.
For 2018, only 500 pieces will be made worldwide. Each board comes with a brass plate denoting the series and serial number.
On top of that, each board will be individually photographed and recorded. This data would be crucial should the owner of the board would like to authenticate their board originality.
All PIONEER SERIES board would also comes with a certificate of authenticity, care instructions manual & a surprise gift.

 
COLLECTOR'S SERIES



This board will be made from Chengal (Neobalanocarpus heimii) timber. This wood is well known in the tropics as the most durable, strongest and most expensive in the market.
According to Malaysia Timber Council, this wood is categorized as Heavy Hardwood with a density of 915-980 kg/m3 air dry. It's strength properties falls into Strength Group A or SG1.
This board would be an end grain chopping board with a dimension of 450mm × 450mm × 75mm. This design will never be replicated in my future chopping board.Weight ranges about 10-12 kilograms.
For 2018, only 100 pieces will be made worldwide. Each board comes with a brass plate denoting the series and serial number.
On top of that, each board will be individually photographed and recorded. This data would be crucial should the owner of the board would like to authenticate their board originality.
All COLLECTOR'S SERIES board would also comes with a certificate of authenticity, care instructions manual & a surprise gift.

 
LIVING PRODUCTS

OLIVERO chopping board is alive! 
The photos above are prototypes of my boards. Like many living products, there will be variations in the end grain patterns, colour, texture and weight in the final product. These are due to different aging of the wood, the environment it has been exposed and etc.
For me these variations are best examples of Mother Nature at work. These variations tells the story of the timber in a special and beautiful way.
Having said these, I fully guarantees that the wood used will be of the timber species mentioned. I will not take short cuts, undercut, or off cuts....Only clear cut timber species certified by the Malaysia Timber Industry Board (MTIB).


Samples of the Timber Verification Service certificate by the Malaysia Timber Industry Board issued to me
 
PRODUCTION
Unlike many campaigns that outsource their production to factories, my chopping board will be personally handmade by myself! EVERY SINGLE PIECE!
I do not outsource any of my work except for the brass plate which I get from a trusted supplier.
By doing this, I can ensure the quality of my work is of the highest.
Hence, the limited run of my products.
Of course, my beloved wife, my family and my friends are always by my side to support me in any way necessary.
When my campaign goes live, I will start with the production immediately with my available wood stocks. More wood stocks will be purchased at the end of my campaign. 
This is necessary as I will need all the time available to ensure my dateline delivery by December 2018. 
However, as with any product, unforeseen delays can happen. I promise to keep my backers updated throughout the process and will let you know if I foresee any updates to the delivery timeline. Stay tuned to my social media and video streaming updates.

I will also be able to further enhanced my website for better customer experience. This is an area which I really need help as I am not so tech-savvy.

saving the environment by not encouraging the felling of more trees!

story:
About US

Tenth Ward Distilling Company is a woman-owned micro distillery, located in the heart of downtown Frederick, Maryland.

Specializing in whiskey, brandy, seasonal liqueurs and absinthe, we pride ourselves on challenging traditions and by forging unconventional and off the cuff spirits.

Our Founder also know as the Boss Lady, has a background in environmental sustainability (learn more here!) and a ton of work experience in marketing and customer service. She started Tenth Ward from everything she had in her pocket and is working her butt off to pursue the growth of her small business.

This campaign is so so so important to us because it will allow us to achieve our very awesome and very achievable goals in this expansion which are to:

  1. educate our consumers more about craft spirits through the development of our soon to be super weird and unconventional cocktail program and 
  2. fill more barrels! As investing in a product that needs to season and age can be the hardest thing for a distillery, especially when customers love our spirits so much that we can't keep up with demand!

Wanna know more about how investment works?? Wellll... support to the cocktail lab and barrel program creates a snowball effect in our growth and sales. Which means that more $$ gives us the ability to offer more booze, in different forms, at a higher price and to meet a larger demand of thirsty customers.  That provides our business with the cash flow necessary to keep re-investing in more kick ass staff, fancier equipment and the ever so lovely local economy of Frederick, MD. 

Funding Tenth Ward's expansion campaign also directly supports local agriculture (go farms!), our community efforts and the growth of our industry (yay more craft booze!). 

What Do We Need??

Tenth Ward is seeking $85,000 toward our master piece which will fund the following-

  • Construction of a new bar designed for inventing scrumptious cocktail concoctions
  • Expensive equipment to support the cocktail bar like sinks, dishwashers, coolers, a draft line (yeah you heard it, cocktails on draft!)
  • Build out of a GIANT barrel room, at least giant in comparison to our current 1600 sq foot space
  • Infrastructure to support our giant barrel room such as trench drains, water filtration, mop sinks
  • More equipment to manage larger processes and heavy things such as fork lifts, pumps, etc. 
  • And the best part- RAW MATERIALS! Grain, barrels, cider, yeast and so much more. 

What Do YOU Get?

We don't want you to do this for charity! We want to thank you for your support with really cool things like branded swag. Take a gander at the funding options-

  1. ​$25 - Cocktail Voucher: $25 will get ya $30 worth of cocktails when our new cocktail lab opens in Spring of 2019
  2. $50 - Swag Bag: $50 will get ya the hippest branded hoodie, and hat (valued at $60)
  3. $100 - Cocktail Voucher + Swag Bag + Unlimited Tastings:  $100 will get ya all of the above, a set of Tenth Ward rocks glasses and unlimited tasting flights for up to a year.
  4. $500- Barrel Investment: Your very own branded Tenth Ward barrel, with your name on it, the opportunity to join our distiller as he fills your barrel, 5 bottles of our first batch 1 one year released bourbon and invitations to exclusive barrel tastings.

The Impact

Still on the fence? Want to see the projections? Thanks to a super brilliant grad class at Hood College here in Frederick we've got some hard numbers for you. Tenth Ward's expansion will result in 

  • The move to an additional space of 5,500 sq foot (currently operating in only 1600 sq feet)
  • 30,000 pounds of grain purchased in 2019
  • 6 new staff hires
  • Distribution to 8 new Maryland counties with hundreds of new liquor store and restaurant accounts
  • A potential for 40% increase in sales on top of our already trending sales growth
  • 4 year round barrel aged whiskies on the way 

 

Still want to help but strapped for cash?

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and help us MAKE SOME NOISE!
  • Share our campaign on social media 
  • Follow us on social media and ask your friends and family to. Trust us, we post the best Insta photos!
    • @tenthwardco
    • #wardoffordinary
  • Subscribe to our mailing list to get updates on the campaign and other spirited happenings - see what we did there?
  • Bring friends and family into the shop to see our progress
  • Help our media reach with positive google and yelp reviews

Thank you thank you thank you for all of your current and future contributed support. We could not have achieved this current success without our amazing customers, club members, community, colleagues and more. Keep checking in to see the progress...

Thank you thank you thank you for all of your current and future contributed support. We could not have achieved this current success without our amazing customers, club members, community, colleagues and more. Keep checking in to see the progress...

story:
By donating to C.R.E.A.M. Ice Cream Shop, you are allowed a ride on our journey. We decided to create this shop to bring a new type of flavor (pun intended) to the Atlanta Ice Cream world. Fried roll ice cream isn’t just your typical scoop in a cone. Not only are you creating the ice cream right before the customers eyes, your also creating an experience. This is our chance to create something cool and engaging. Something different for young people just like us! We also want to show our followers and our community that, as long as you’re,  passionate all things can succeed. Our dream has always been to be young entrepreneurs and this is our first step! That step starts with you!

 

We originally started this business as a way to make extra money, while testing our entrepreneurial skills. But as time progressed, so has our passion surrounding this project. We realize we have a chance to us this platform to inspire and change within our community. Its not just about the ice cream, its about all the other people who want to believe they can do whatever they believe in! This campaign is for anyone who has ever had a dream!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Earnie and I am a hardworking & caring member of the Dothan Al community.
  • I volunteer my time when I am able in  young professional programs, charity fundraisers, and underprivileged kids. 
  • This campaign is important to me because I enjoy serving the community , putting smiles on the faces of everyone, and providing them with unique food products they can't get locally.
  • If you help fund this start up you will be a part of helping a potential homegrown national brand grow and be in locations you love to visit like the beach.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding will go towards lease payments, lights, upgrades or repairs, business licensing, insurance, CPA fees, staffing, marketing, training, consumable products (food/shaved ice), non consumables (cups, spoons, napkins, cleaning supplies, and etc)
  • Donations will ensure that you all continue to get the unique products that Earnie's Snowballs  offers from someone you know and trust who is involved in your community.
  • If the funding goals are not met they will go towards fees incurred during the business's time of operations. 

The Impact

  • Earnie's Snowballs has a huge impact on bringing a smile to the community , providing a space for charity work (blood drives, mission trip car washes, cancer car washes, high school sports car washes, an assortment of youth program car washed some raising up to $500), and most importantly Earnie's Snowballs provides the best Snowballs/ Shaved ice,Nachos, Boiled peanut, Flaming hot corn, Elotes,  (Grandma's Recipe) Chili dogs, and food truck services for public and private parties/ events. 
  • Contributing to this campaign will also help to put Earnie's Snowballs in a larger building  in the future that allows for  more products, year round services, and place to dine/ host your events. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The major risk factors of the start up have been taken by me. I invested my own personal savings to get the business started. We have earned the respect of the community with three years of experience increasing traffic to the business each year.
  • Due to the harsh winter of 2017 I had to close the shop and had to use what proceeds left from the season to pay employees and keep the bills paid. I even got a job to have a second source of income  to help try and keep bills paid. 
  • The challenge for 2018 is to start the business up and have a few employees that will work the business to keep it going. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially share this post and the business Facebook or Instagram page. Leave a personal comment on why you think Earnie's Snowballs should be funded.
  • If you are a lawyer, CPA, Accountant, Experienced Entrepreneur, Party planner and would like to volunteer your services please do. Any help or advice is welcome.

story:
Thank you so much for checking out our Indiegogo Campaign!

Trash Panda Vegan is the love child of our passion to help establish change on our plates.

The company consists of Chef Krystal Harris and Theron Evans. Together we have over 40 years of combined experience in the food service industry and have both been vegan for a decade. We have worked in the kitchen and the service side of the industry in both hourly and management.  All of our experience and unique backgrounds have provided us a wide range of food influences from Midwest comfort to Thai savory to Southwest spice!

We are in awe of the awareness that veganism has received in the past few years, and the benefits for our planet, our animals, and our bodies are indisputable.

We want to take our delicious food on the road and offer amazing non-animal alternatives, veggies, and grains at music fests, conventions, private parties, weddings, street-side… you name it… we’re getting mobile!

With our food trailer shortly on the way, and the truck in wait, we are seeking the capital we need to have a successful start!  Our goal is $10,000.

Although, that sounds like a lot, we are only asking for 500 people in a country of 327 million to contribute $20… That’s all it takes to helps us reach our dream!!  Look to the right and click SELECT A PERK.

The funds will be going towards our initial product purchases, labor, fees and licensing, marketing, and base operating costs for the first two months. For your wonderful and kind contribution, we will send you a removable vinyl sticker with our cute little Trash Panda.  If you’d like to contribute more, there is an option at check out where for every $10 over $20, we will throw in another sticker to say thank you!!  

In case we do not meet our goal, every penny received goes to our operating costs such as ingreadiant purchases, gas, festival fees, etc.

Every contribution means the world to us and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.  If you can’t contribute, thank you for reading this far, and you can always greatly assist us by sharing our link with friends and communities to MAKE SOME NOISE!

https://igg.me/at/trashpandavegan

There are also Indiegogo share tools to help!

Again, thank you SO VERY MUCH for being here and BE A TRASH PANDA… EAT TRASHY!!!
story_txt:
Thank you so much for checking out our Indiegogo Campaign!
Trash Panda Vegan is the love child of our passion to help establish change on our plates.
The company consists of Chef Krystal Harris and Theron Evans. Together we have over 40 years of combined experience in the food service industry and have both been vegan for a decade. We have worked in the kitchen and the service side of the industry in both hourly and management.  All of our experience and unique backgrounds have provided us a wide range of food influences from Midwest comfort to Thai savory to Southwest spice!
We are in awe of the awareness that veganism has received in the past few years, and the benefits for our planet, our animals, and our bodies are indisputable.
We want to take our delicious food on the road and offer amazing non-animal alternatives, veggies, and grains at music fests, conventions, private parties, weddings, street-side… you name it… we’re getting mobile!
With our food trailer shortly on the way, and the truck in wait, we are seeking the capital we need to have a successful start!  Our goal is $10,000.
Although, that sounds like a lot, we are only asking for 500 people in a country of 327 million to contribute $20… That’s all it takes to helps us reach our dream!!  Look to the right and click SELECT A PERK.
The funds will be going towards our initial product purchases, labor, fees and licensing, marketing, and base operating costs for the first two months. For your wonderful and kind contribution, we will send you a removable vinyl sticker with our cute little Trash Panda.  If you’d like to contribute more, there is an option at check out where for every $10 over $20, we will throw in another sticker to say thank you!!  
In case we do not meet our goal, every penny received goes to our operating costs such as ingreadiant purchases, gas, festival fees, etc.
Every contribution means the world to us and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.  If you can’t contribute, thank you for reading this far, and you can always greatly assist us by sharing our link with friends and communities to MAKE SOME NOISE!
https://igg.me/at/trashpandavegan
There are also Indiegogo share tools to help!
Again, thank you SO VERY MUCH for being here and BE A TRASH PANDA… EAT TRASHY!!!

story:
who we are.

meet craig and alison. we’re designers, innovators, and travelers.

we both love food. we often find ourselves in new cities, and while there are plenty of delivery options available, it’s not always easy to find vegan options in nearby restaurants.

this got us thinking. what if there was a food delivery app specifically for vegan restaurants?

so we decided to do something about it. which brings us to this moment.

get ready to have the best vegan food in your city delivered right to your doorstep. eat.life is (almost) here.

not only are we creating the world’s first vegan food delivery app, we plan to grow this internationally.

we are launching eat.life in london, and our goal is to eventually be available in all the world’s most vegan-friendly cities.

we have all the pieces in place to create this. now we need you to help us make this happen.

what we need.

our goal for this campaign is £150,000. this will get us started, and we are thinking big.

we are designing the app prototype, along with our brand identity and marketing. we aim to offer a complete customer experience, and we have an innovative marketing strategy that will get people hungry for our launch.

eat.life takes you on a journey from the moment you open the app, all the way through to the first bite of your meal. we offer a memorable experience that will have you looking forward to your next order.

we need to complete the design, planning, and build of the prototype. we are creating the customer experience from the ground up. we are doing this full time and we need to cover our expenses until we launch the app.

we need to hire a team to build the app when the prototype is complete.

we have designed wearable items for the eat.life delivery team, along with the awesome clothing and tote bags we have available as part of our campaign. we need to get these printed.

we have designed delivery boxes and napkins, and branded bicycles. when we launch, we need to make an impact. we need to cover these costs for the eat.life delivery team.

we are planning an incredible sensory experience that will be a part of our mind-blowing media launch in london. ticket sales will go towards the venue hire and catering costs, paying the artists involved, and we will provide the best experience possible for those attending.

the budget.

we have done loads of research and calculations. the £150,000 we are aiming for is the minimum amount we need to get us up and running, and to launch as effectively as we can.

this amount will be enough to get us started. then it's up to eat.life to deliver the goods.

in case you're curious, here's a breakdown of what we'll do with the funds we raise.

app prototype. we need to complete the eat.life app design and user experience. we are creating something amazing here. we're not cutting any corners, and we need it to be the best it can be.

app development. we need to hire a team to build the app. we'll also need some time (and a team) to test it after it's built.

marketing + PR. we need to make sure everyone knows about eat.life. this means we'll have to hire someone who can help us reach the people we need to reach.

launch party. we're planning an incredible multi-sensory experience for you all, to ensure eat.life launches with a bang. we need to hire a venue for this and pay the artists who will entertain you for the evening.

team gear. we've designed uniforms for our delivery team. this includes clothing, helmets, branded bicycles and delivery boxes. we've also covered the little details like napkins and packaging for eat.life deliveries. like we said, we plan to make an impact when we go live.

streetwear. see those awesome t-shirts, hoodies, and tote bags in the perks? we need to print up a whole bunch of these to make sure there are enough to go around.

platform fees. indiegogo takes a cut of the money we raise. it's 4% if we reach our goal and 9% if we don't. so we've budgeted around 8% for this, as it could go either way. help us reach our goal so we can spend the funds on your eat.life experience!

if we don’t reach our goal, we will do as much as we can with the funds we receive. we will prioritize what we need to launch the app with maximum impact, and will leave certain features for later if we need to. either way, we will use the money to create the app and launch it as effectively as we possibly can.

any money raised above our goal will go towards making the launch, app experience, and marketing of eat.life even bigger and better. 

what’s in it for you?

if you have ever wished it was easier to order vegan food for delivery, this is your opportunity to help us make it happen.

first up, we are offering eat.life order vouchers. these will be redeemable as soon as the app launches in london.

we have a range of sassy shirts, hoodies, and tote bags available that will make you look good while supporting a worthy cause.

are you an early adopter? if so, we have something especially for you. grab our early access perk and be among the first to live the eat.life experience.

we are planning our launch party in london in april 2020. this will be an exclusive event featuring live music, excellent food, and a few surprises. you know you want to be there. avoid FOMO by buying a ticket.

if you're feeling super generous, we will invite you up on stage at the launch party to thank you personally for your contribution, and we are also offering the opportunity to be credited as an executive producer of the eat.life app.

if you are forward-thinking and see the potential of what eat.life has to offer, this campaign is for you. this is only the beginning, and this project will continue to grow. be a part of the movement now, and be one of the people who helped to launch the world's first vegan food delivery app!

why the world needs eat.life

in case you haven’t noticed, the vegan movement is exploding all over the world at the moment. more and more people are ditching meat and dairy, and looking for ethical, sustainable, and healthy alternatives. new products and restaurants are popping up everywhere. this is not a trend... this is the future.

if you have any doubts, here’s some research to inspire you.

2019 will be the year veganism goes mainstream.  the economist & forbes

UK vegan population will skyrocket by 327% by 2020.  survey analysts at finder.com

the business of providing vegan meals is booming. the economist

in the UK, the number of people identifying as vegans has increased by 350%, compared to a decade ago.  research by the vegan society & vegan life magazine

why trust us?

we get it. you haven’t met us, and we are asking you to send your hard-earned cash to strangers on the internet -- in the hope that we will indeed use it to build the world’s best food delivery app.

although this is our first crowdfunding campaign, this is by no means our first project.

here’s what else we do. check out our other projects and get to know us. hopefully this will set your mind at ease before you send any of your money to this campaign.

craig de gouveia // media + blog

alison engel // styling + blog

the space around us // youtube series

dsgn.cloud // digital innovation hub

paracosmos // where truth and fiction collide

the real matek // #futurenoir

risks + challenges.

starting a new business is always a risk. creating something that doesn’t exist is also a risk. we are both risk-takers, and eat.life is our latest risk.

that being said, we are super confident that we will bring you a vegan food delivery app that is just as good (we’re being modest, we actually want to say even better) than the existing food delivery apps out there.

we have loads of experience creating awesome projects that speak to people. we have an understanding of design principles, user experience, and we are naturally able to bring in the cool factor to ensure our creations appeal to people.

the world needs a vegan food delivery app. we are determined to not only make it happen, but to create the best food delivery app we can imagine.

we invite you to join us on this journey. are you with us?

other ways you can help.

if you want to see this project happen, but can’t contribute financially at the moment, we totally understand. there are other ways you can assist us.

first and foremost, word of mouth will help us more than anything. please share this campaign with your networks, with your friends and family, people who love food, people who love vegan food. in fact, go ahead and share this page with everyone you know.

be a part of our voice. post this campaign all over social media. go ahead and use the indiegogo share tools. it’s that easy!

while you're at it, be sure to follow us on facebook, twitter, youtube, and instagram. 

you can even head over to the eat.life website in the meantime and add your name to our waiting list. you'll be among the first to hear when the app is ready.

and before you know it, you will be opening the eat.life app, placing your order, and enjoying the best vegan food your city has to offer.

that’s the dream, isn’t it?

story:
We thank you for your support, however due to the ever changing economy and the evolving world of COVID we have moved on from opening a brewery to fulfilling a new dream.

The dream of Stained Glass Wine House was conceived by us. A group of Air Force veterans, who as we travelled the globe, realized something was lacking in our community...A customer focused...Upscale, yet not pretentious environment that anyone can go to, devoid of judgement. We are sensitive to how COVID has changed the world, yet understand people must get out and enjoy themselves.

This is where Stained Glass Wine House satisfies that need. Our aim is to be the premier self-serve wine bar in the New Orleans Metro Area. Our business model is tailored towards modern dating, business professionals, as well as tech savy individuals.

Stained Glass Wine House will offer 300+ wines with twenty on tap, along side self-serve high end whiskeys, finally as a testament of loyalty to our community we will have four beers crafted by neighborhood breweries of Louisiana. All of these libations served in a COVID compliant environment, metered and distributed via a completely touchless system.

We hope that you will continue your support for us as we engage in this new endeavor.

And remember.....COVID friendly for now, neighborhood friendly forever!

story:
The purpose of Buna (coffee) Time Cafe is to introduce traditional Ethiopian coffee ceremonies to locals in the bay area. After a year of sharing the experience, we decided to bring this exciting new way of savoring coffee to every person in the world through our online website at buna box.

Buna Time Cafe started in Chicago in October of 2017. The founder, Selot Zewdie worked hard throughout her undergrad to start the cafe by self-funding. Her passion is business and entrepreneurship; while utilizing her expertise along with the delicious methods of preparing traditional coffee from scratch, she boldly introduced buna (coffee) be jebena to the world.

The goal of this campaign is to help restart Buna Time Cafe in Oakland, CA. A majority of inventory which is required for the relaunch is in place; the funding will be used strictly as seed money, and to secure a commercial lease in the Montclair neighborhood of the bay area.

story:
Let’s bury the hatchet on prohibition.

Carrie Nation wielded a hatchet to smash saloons as the figurehead of the Temperance movement that would eventually lead to the 18th amendment and prohibition. With the 21st amendment, we repealed that poor decision in our country’s history. Carrie Nation never lived to see that day, and is buried right here in Belton Missouri. 

With that kind of history in our back yard, many have mixed feelings. Look – we just want to bury the hatchet on this local connection and have a few craft beers to show there are no hard feelings. 

We’re opening Broken Hatchet Brewing in historic downtown Belton and celebrating our community. We’re brewing up classic styles of beer as well as a few thought provoking beers in our Hatchet Series. We’re located downtown in the old library that helped educate the community from 1975-2003. So if you’re hot for teacher, you may enjoy a few beers from our Library Series. It’s also an excuse to mix in a few witty library and education metaphors. 

All reward levels are picked up in the brewery. All beer rewards require proof of age at time of consumption. 

#BrewedInBelton

 

Check it out:

Price Level: $ 10

Name: Shout Me Out 

Description: We’ll shout you out on social media. But we’re doing it Broken Hatchet style! We’ll make a post on our social media channels and cross reference the old library records to share which book(s) you still have overdue. Or we may post to let you know what Carrie Nation would say about you if she were alive today. 

 

Price Level: $ 25

Name: Let’s Bury the Hatchet 

Description: A pint glass with a beer in it. Come in. Have a beer on us. Walk out with a logo’d beer glass. 

 

Price Level: $ 25

Name: Pledge without a reward 

Description: You’re a hell of a friend. We’re keeping you in mind and toasting you every time we drink. Cheers! 

 

Price Level: $50

Name: A Pin+T from Belton

Description: A pint glass to take home, a beer inside that pint glass to enjoy while you’re here, and a one-of-a-kind, launch-only T-shirt. 

 

Price Level: $75

Name: A pint a month

Description: We’re going to make a lot of great beer this year. The only way you’ll know about it is if you let us buy you a pint every month! On your first trip, we’ll send you home with a pint glass and a brewery sticker. 12 months total, 12 beers to enjoy, a lifetime of memories.

 

Price Level: $75

Name: Special grand-opening invitation

Description: Get a ticket to our super-secret pre-opening day trial run! The service industry generally has a special pre-opening service day where they invite good friends in to test out the servers and systems before the grand opening. We’re populating our soft open event with our supporters! We guarantee something goes wrong, and that you have good beer. Your first beer that night is on us, and you’ll get a glass as a party favor. Right now we’re planning on a February / March opening day – we’ll make sure you get the invitation. This level is limited to the first 50 patrons only!

 

Price Level: $100

Name: Founder’s Nation

Description: You’re one of us, and you’ve helped us Bury the Hatchet – bringing great beer to Belton! To show our appreciation, you’re getting 1 logo pint glass, 1 free beer in that glass, a brewery sticker, and (best of all) your name goes on our Founder’s Nation wall.

 

Price Level: $150

Name: Founder’s Nation wall - with swag and beer!

Description: Sometimes being on the Founder’s Nation wall just isn’t enough! You’re getting 1 logo pint glass, 1 free beer in that glass, a brewery sticker, and (best of all) your name goes on our Founder’s Nation wall. To make sure you can view that wall every month and admire your name, you’ll also get one beer free once per month (12 total pints).

 

Price Level: $200

Name: Brew day! 

Description: Join us for brew day and give us a hand with the next batch! We’re not going to make you carry 50lb bags of malt and treat you like a rented pack mule, but we’re also not likely to stop you from that if you volunteer. Help us brew a batch! You’ll walk out with 1 logo pint glass, a special one-of-a-kind-launch-only T-shirt, and a sticker. Plus, we’ll have a couple of pints while we brew. 

 

Price Level: $400

Name: Design, brew, and name a specialty beer!

Description: We’re going to brew up something special for our Library series or our Hatchet series. We’ll work together, and you help us come up with the name. We’ll tell everyone in the joint about you and your beer name. (Obviously, there are regulatory restrictions on your beer name that are beyond our control – but we’ll work together to come up with one that passes the censors.) You’ll walk out with a special launch, t-shirt, logo glass, and a sticker. Of course, for quality assurance purposes only, you’ll help us sample the current beers on tap while you’re here.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Stop in and buy yourself a beer when we’re open!
  • Tell a friend there’s good beer being #BrewedInBelton
  • Give us a 5-star review on Yelp, Google, and Facebook!

 

Looking for more information? Check out our FAQ!

Price Level: $50
Name: A Pin+T from Belton
Description: A pint glass to take home, a beer inside that pint glass to enjoy while you’re here, and a one-of-a-kind, launch-only T-shirt. 
 
Price Level: $75
Name: A pint a month
Description: We’re going to make a lot of great beer this year. The only way you’ll know about it is if you let us buy you a pint every month! On your first trip, we’ll send you home with a pint glass and a brewery sticker. 12 months total, 12 beers to enjoy, a lifetime of memories.
 
Price Level: $75
Name: Special grand-opening invitation
Description: Get a ticket to our super-secret pre-opening day trial run! The service industry generally has a special pre-opening service day where they invite good friends in to test out the servers and systems before the grand opening. We’re populating our soft open event with our supporters! We guarantee something goes wrong, and that you have good beer. Your first beer that night is on us, and you’ll get a glass as a party favor. Right now we’re planning on a February / March opening day – we’ll make sure you get the invitation. This level is limited to the first 50 patrons only!
 
Price Level: $100
Name: Founder’s Nation
Description: You’re one of us, and you’ve helped us Bury the Hatchet – bringing great beer to Belton! To show our appreciation, you’re getting 1 logo pint glass, 1 free beer in that glass, a brewery sticker, and (best of all) your name goes on our Founder’s Nation wall.
 
Price Level: $150
Name: Founder’s Nation wall - with swag and beer!
Description: Sometimes being on the Founder’s Nation wall just isn’t enough! You’re getting 1 logo pint glass, 1 free beer in that glass, a brewery sticker, and (best of all) your name goes on our Founder’s Nation wall. To make sure you can view that wall every month and admire your name, you’ll also get one beer free once per month (12 total pints).
 
Price Level: $200
Name: Brew day! 
Description: Join us for brew day and give us a hand with the next batch! We’re not going to make you carry 50lb bags of malt and treat you like a rented pack mule, but we’re also not likely to stop you from that if you volunteer. Help us brew a batch! You’ll walk out with 1 logo pint glass, a special one-of-a-kind-launch-only T-shirt, and a sticker. Plus, we’ll have a couple of pints while we brew. 
 
Price Level: $400
Name: Design, brew, and name a specialty beer!
Description: We’re going to brew up something special for our Library series or our Hatchet series. We’ll work together, and you help us come up with the name. We’ll tell everyone in the joint about you and your beer name. (Obviously, there are regulatory restrictions on your beer name that are beyond our control – but we’ll work together to come up with one that passes the censors.) You’ll walk out with a special launch, t-shirt, logo glass, and a sticker. Of course, for quality assurance purposes only, you’ll help us sample the current beers on tap while you’re here.  
 
Other Ways You Can Help

Stop in and buy yourself a beer when we’re open!
Tell a friend there’s good beer being #BrewedInBelton
Give us a 5-star review on Yelp, Google, and Facebook!

 
Looking for more information? Check out our FAQ!

story:
Who is Just a Dash?

My name is Stephanie and I started Just a Dash in 2015 with a focus on Cakes and Dessert Tables for Weddings and Special Occasions. Since then we have enjoyed tremendous growth while doubling business each year.

At the beginning of the Covid pandemic, my husband was furloughed from his job and has been since. We knew we needed to pivot with the changing times as almost all of our events on the calendar started canceling or postponing. So we started creating meals and charcuterie boxes. We pivoted our butts off and have grown a very successful new program that we are so excited to take to the next level.

Your help would enable us to transition into a bigger space, allowing us to expand our menus and the scope of what we can do as a business.

Our goals include hosting open kitchen days with baked goods, providing consistent meal pickups and deliveries, increasing the frequency of our Tea Boxes, and maybe even offering on site tea events or special dinners.

 

How you can help-

  • Our fundraising goal will help pay licensing fees, buy equipement, and get the space ready to be used.
  • We have lots of great perks to choose from to help sweeten the deal. See what I did there? 
  • We totally understand that this is a challenging time and if you can't make a contribution please know that we always appreciate you.  Free things you can do are share our posts, photos, or promotions. Word of mouth is some of the best advertising we can get!

story:
We love crystal clear ice, but it's been a hassle to make at home. We wanted something faster, easier, compact, lid-free, expandable, and made primarily in the USA. Something clearly better.
 


Upgrade to invisible!
Regular cubes vs Ice.Made.Clear.™ Collins cubes

Giant 2" Cube. Nearly Invisible.

"Ice done right." - Technical.ly

"Holy Grail of ice cubes." – Alan P., Supporter.

Ordinary freezer ice is cloudy. Our design makes beautiful crystal clear ice from regular tap water, and it's easy. If you know how to make ice, you already know how to use ICE.MADE.CLEAR. It transforms all of your drinks, and we think you will love it.

 

Why ICE.MADE.CLEAR. ?

 

–Drinks Taste Better

Clear ice has less dissolved yucky freezer air. So, clear ice is clean-tasting, allowing the subtleties of high quality spirits to emerge.

 

–Drinks Are Cool, Not Watery

Clear ice melts slower. The absence of air pockets on the outside creates a smooth exterior with less surface area to encourage melting. Drinks stay cool longer and don't get watery.

 

–Drinks Look Stunning

You - and your friends - will be astonished by the glass-like clarity. Ice from ICE.MADE.CLEAR. is nearly invisible in drinks.

 

What is Included?

The ICE.MADE.CLEAR set comes complete with the freezing base and two interchangeable trays for making 2” enormous cubes and 1.25” jumbo cubes (for tall glasses). 

 

What Can You Make?

Huge 2" Crystal-Clear Cubes. Perfect for Premium Liquor.

 

Collins-Sized Cubes for Tall Drinks

 

Beautiful Specialty Cubes For Entertaining

 

Key Features

 

Featured Mentions

 

The History

I was at a bar and It was slow, so I watched the bartender work. His liquors, bitters, fruits and herbs were good. His mixology was top-notch. But his drinks? They looked and tasted amazing. It was the ice, and shortly thereafter, I had a moment of ‘Clarity.’

The next week I sat down with an ice formation physicist – true story. What I learned started an obsession.

 

Our Key Innovation

Our patent-pending pressure equalization system allows I.M.C.™ to make big ice in a small device. It's fast freezing and easy. It is deceptively simple, and that's the point.

We tried common beliefs, DIY solutions, and exotic electronic concepts. We prototyped for three years on the way to an elegant solution.

 

All Backers Receive Two Molds

 

Easy – Requires No Instructions

 

Compact – 5.75" – Two Fit Side-by-Side

 

Needs no lid – Freeze Fast, Monitor Progress, Remove Easily

 

Hear from a supporter

"Being a Domestic Mixologist, I’ve tried ways to improve my drinks, from making my own bitters to infusing simple syrups...But you make a beautiful drink and put it in a glass and then have to put a cloudy ice cube in there...by adding an ultra clear cube, it shows that you care about your cocktail and give it the feel of wow." - Phillip P., Supporter

 

The Science - For Nerds Only

First we looked at how the big commercial units work, with electronics and ultrasonics – not practical at home. Then we looked to nature's directional freezing process – frozen lakes have clear surface ice. This process is elegant but hard to replicate in a device for the home that isn't bulky and slow.

We applied a Design Thinking methodology to make directional freezing more human-friendly. We prototyped for years on the way to a solution.

Our lid-free, two-piece, compact unit is made possible by a controlled temperature gradient and by our big innovation – a patent-pending pressure equalization system designed to deal with the 8% expansion water undergoes as it becomes ice. It is a deceptively simple idea that just works.

Once we had our concept working with hand-built prototypes, we moved into 3D printing and molding silicone. We spent about six months creating and refining functional prototypes until we had the confidence to offer a polished product.

 

Elegant and Practical

Sleek curves and angles unite function with presentation

 

More Shapes!

We will offer regular mold updates to fit your kit and keep you on the cutting edge of ice!

Spheres, Shards, and 3D-Diamonds - What shape would you like to see next?

 

Timeline

Fall 2014 - Spr. 2017
Technology Research, R&D, Prototyping, Evaluation

Jun. 2017
Production prototype completed and tested

Jul. 2017
U.S. Manufacturer visits and quoting process

Dec. 2017 - Jan. 2018
Tooling machined

Feb. 2018 - May 2018
Production of Kickstarter rewards

Jun. 2018 - Jul. 2018
Delivery of first production run rewards

Sep. 2018 - Oct. 2018
Delivery of second production run rewards

 

The Team

Joseph Myers is a professional filmmaker, entrepreneur, and product designer. He is a partner in storyshop films and has directed many large-scale nationally broadcast documentaries. He is a founding partner of Nittany Mountain Distillery. As a product designer, Myers is the principal of movingimage llc. He works with a team, including two internationally recognized artists and designers, an engineer, and a business manager.

Stephanie Ayanian has long experience successfully shepherding $500k-$1m projects from inception, through development & fundraising, production, and distribution. Ayanian is a business management consultant, an educator, a film and television producer, and partner at storyshop films.

Tim Berg and Rebekah Myers are artists, designers and educators. As a studio art collaborative they have participated in multiple solo and group exhibitions in the US, Mexico, Sweden, South Korea, Qatar and Kuwait. Their work is included in numerous private and public collections including The Betty Woodman Collection at the University of Colorado and the Biedermann Museum in Germany. Berg is an Associate Professor of Studio Art at Pitzer College.

 

 

Risks and challenges

Every project has risks. We know this well. As a team of professional filmmakers and artists we have taken on million-dollar, multi-year projects and seen them through to completion. Some of our team were involved in a successful 2015 Kickstarter to raise seed funding for a documentary film. That film raised over $50,000 on Kickstarter and went on to raise over $500,000. The film is finished shooting, having shot in 10 cities. The editing is happening now, and it will see a television release in the spring followed by the delivery of DVD and Blu-Ray rewards to our backers.

To see projects through, we have had to get good at dealing with the unexpected. Our experience is that good pre-planning equips us to deal best with challenges. In manufacturing this is no different. So we are ready.

Our technology is battle tested. We have a functional prototype - not a display model. We have our primary manufacturer lined up – in the USA. This will also allow us to track the manufacturing and quality-control processes.

We dedicate ourselves to seeing this product delivered. If any problems arise along the way, we assure you that communicating with you, as we take on these issues, will be our first priority.

story:
Now Shipping - Buy OnTheRocks Today on the Indiegogo Marketplace!

 

Impress Your Guests With a Simple, Beautiful Drink...OnTheRocks

Quality guests deserve quality cocktails and quality cocktails require quality ice (try saying that five times fast). 

What’s wrong with that regular freezer ice you’ve been using, you ask?

Well, that cloudy crap melts quickly, diluting that masterfully made cocktail before your guest even takes their first sip. 

It also has a bit of a stink to it. You know, that whatever-is-in-my-freezer-suddenly-is-in-my-cocktail type stink. Even whiskey can’t cover that up.

Clear Ice: Up Your Cocktail Game

Clear ice will up your cocktail and entertaining game. Not only does it look absolutely jaw dropping—

but the same science that makes it look so good makes it far superior.

Clear Ice Melts Slower & Keeps Drinks Chilled Longer

The secret is that clear ice freezes unilaterally in layers. Because of this it’s crystal clear and free of air pockets. Being a consistently solid structure of ice, clear ice has more composure than regular ice. It melts more slowly, diluting cocktails with less water, and keeps the drink chilled longer.

Clear Ice Doesn't Dump Freezer Smell in Your Drinks

And of course, since it doesn’t have air pockets, it’s not going to crack and dump any hideous freezer smells into that drink. And if your freezer is like most of us, that’s probably the best news you’ve heard all week.

Clear Ice: As Easy as 1,2,3 with OnTheRocks

Trying to DIY clear ice is time-consuming, labor-intensive and unfruitful. 

OnTheRocks, however, easily makes clear ice. All you need is water, a freezer, OnTheRocks and those dashingly good looks of yours.

Meet OnTheRocks

  1. Trays (cube or sphere)
  2. Water Reservoir
  3. Insulation

Here’s a step by step process to achieve Gatbsy worthy creations.

Step 1:

Select a tray. When you purchase OnTheRocks, you will receive the following molds; sphere, cube and block. Pick one or the other or both (leave out for blocks).

Step 2:

Add the tray to the water reservoir, fill with water, add to the insulation foam, place OnTheRocks into the freezer.

Step 3:

Wait patiently (roughly 24 hours), remove the ice from the tray and blow your guests’ minds. It’s that easy.

How OnTheRocks Works

Icicles one of the many wonders of nature—the real mad scientist here. They are crystal clear and there’s a reason for that.

When they are formed, the water freezes in layers. This creates a clear form that is free from air bubbles that become trapped when ice is made in a freezer. When professionals make clear ice for sculptures, they use specially designed freezers with pumps that constantly circulate the water to mimic these conditions.

OnTheRocks recreates this process in your freezer. It’s specially designed to allow the water to circulate naturally without any moving parts. This keeps things simple and cost effective so that anyone can enjoy clear ice. There are no moving parts. No hubs, no gears, no toggles, no chisels and no problems. 

Product Specs

The product is smaller than a gallon of ice cream, so it fits easily into your freezer. 

Stretch Goals

Thanks to our awesome community of backers, we've reached our initial goal of $25,000! We aren't stopping there though.

We've Reached $50,000!

The "Assortment of Diamonds" clear ice tray is available as an option for our backers. 

This tray will have an assortment of 6 unique diamond types such as the Princess cut, Opal cut and more. 

If We Reach $100,000

The tribe has spoken. If we reach $100,000, we will make the clear ice shot glass tray available. This one-of-a-kind ice tray will be able to make 6, 1.5 ounce shot glasses like the one pictured above.

Mouth-Watering Perks

Pick your poison. By supporting us, you get access to some outrageously good prices. Once you've made your choice, venture to the right-hand sidebar of this page and click the Perk your heart desires.

Act quickly though, these deals are melting quickly (unlike our clear ice, which melts slowly). 

*For items marked, you can pick the cube or sphere tray or a mix and match combination of the two.

Your Spirit Guides

The OnTheRocks team:

Matt Verlinich, the Old Fashioned

Matt is the founder, brain and engineer behind OnTheRocks. In his past life, he worked for a large corporation, but decided that wasn't where he found fulfillment. He ventured into the maker space, serving a tenure at TechShop Pittsburgh as General Manager. 

After helping countless others achieve and make their dreams, he decided to chase down his own.

Much like the Old Fashioned cocktail, Matt is a calculated, classic recipe. When you have an Old Fashioned in hand, you're nearly guaranteed to have a deeply philosophical conversation questioning the meaning of everything—just like when you have Matt on hand. His analytical, curious mind asked the question, "Why can't everyone have clear ice?" The rest, as they say, is history.

Joseph W. Brown, Bourbon on the Rocks

Joe is the creative behind every drool-worthy OnTheRocks photo and video. Joe has been a freelance photographer for the past decade, capturing the likes of neon benders, mechanics, paleontologists, chefs and astronauts with his lens. 

Like the easy to make, deliciously easy to drink nature of bourbon on the rocks, Joe is a man who is easy to be around. Unlike most photographers who interrupt the natural flow of anything with their lenses, Joe makes you feel comfortable and knows how to bring out your true self (like bourbon tends to do).

Ben Butler, Gin and Tonic

Ben is the OnTheRocks storyteller managing the brand and messaging. He worked for motorsports complexes, national nonprofits, digital agencies and software companies before launching his own communications agency. 

The Gin and Tonic is a timeless classic known by everyone who drinks cocktails. Ben's job is just that—to make OnTheRocks a classic known by everyone who drinks cocktails.

The Journey to Get to OnTheRocks

Dozens of Concepts—100’s of Experiments

It all started with a question, as most great journeys do. Matt Verlinich—the maker of OntheRocks—was sitting in front of his TV one night when he saw an alcohol commercial that piqued his interest. The ice being used in the drinks was clear and appealing. It made the alcohol look even more appetizing. So, being the go-getter that he is, Matt asked himself, “How can I make clear ice at home?”

His initial goal was to recreate the perfection he had seen on TV. After doing extensive research and experimenting with different materials like discarded pieces of plastic and insulation, Matt realized that he could democratize the process and make it easier for others to use as well.

As the experiments began to pan out, he found that by combining the DIY solutions with enterprise-level solutions, he could create an affordable, no-moving-part solution. This would give him the opportunity to manufacture his creation to share with others, so that they could do it themselves and then pass on their excitement for clear ice to others. There were, however, some challenges along the way.

Matt created several prototypes. He moved from using containers and recycling existing parts to customizing his own solution that would be the best size and form factor for a customer. Using CAD and his experience from Tech Shop, Matt continued to experiment. His goal was to design a product that would be cost efficient, versatile and useful. This left him with a lot of small changes that needed to be made.

The tray and water reservoir were a trial. How robust or complicated did it need to be? Plus, manufacturability was the biggest thing. How could he design the perfect clear ice product to be as cost effective as possible?

The idea was to save the consumer as much money as possible. Matt’s designs went through dozens of iterations and designs as well as hundreds of experiments.

He enlisted the help of his friends in the Maker Community of Pittsburgh along the way receiving invaluable support and insight.

We Need Your Help

Bringing a product like this to market isn’t easy. We have some startup costs to overcome before we can democratize clear ice for everyone.

Here’s the list of our manufacturing costs:

  • Expanded foam mold
  • Plastic injection mold
  • 2 liquid silicone rubber injection molds
  • Insulation foam material/production cost
  • Water reservoir material/production cost
  • Cube Ice tray material/production cost
  • Sphere Ice tray material/production cost
  • Fulfillment Shipping

If you're looking to up your cocktail game, and take your next gathering to the next level, we'd love your support. Act now to take advantage of our once-on-a-lifetime early bird rates and perks.

Love,

The tribe has spoken. If we reach $100,000, we will make the clear ice shot glass tray available. This one-of-a-kind ice tray will be able to make 6, 1.5 ounce shot glasses like the one pictured above.
Mouth-Watering Perks
Pick your poison. By supporting us, you get access to some outrageously good prices. Once you've made your choice, venture to the right-hand sidebar of this page and click the Perk your heart desires.
Act quickly though, these deals are melting quickly (unlike our clear ice, which melts slowly). 

*For items marked, you can pick the cube or sphere tray or a mix and match combination of the two.
Your Spirit Guides
The OnTheRocks team:

Matt Verlinich, the Old Fashioned
Matt is the founder, brain and engineer behind OnTheRocks. In his past life, he worked for a large corporation, but decided that wasn't where he found fulfillment. He ventured into the maker space, serving a tenure at TechShop Pittsburgh as General Manager. 
After helping countless others achieve and make their dreams, he decided to chase down his own.
Much like the Old Fashioned cocktail, Matt is a calculated, classic recipe. When you have an Old Fashioned in hand, you're nearly guaranteed to have a deeply philosophical conversation questioning the meaning of everything—just like when you have Matt on hand. His analytical, curious mind asked the question, "Why can't everyone have clear ice?" The rest, as they say, is history.

Joseph W. Brown, Bourbon on the Rocks
Joe is the creative behind every drool-worthy OnTheRocks photo and video. Joe has been a freelance photographer for the past decade, capturing the likes of neon benders, mechanics, paleontologists, chefs and astronauts with his lens. Like the easy to make, deliciously easy to drink nature of bourbon on the rocks, Joe is a man who is easy to be around. Unlike most photographers who interrupt the natural flow of anything with their lenses, Joe makes you feel comfortable and knows how to bring out your true self (like bourbon tends to do).

Ben Butler, Gin and Tonic
Ben is the OnTheRocks storyteller managing the brand and messaging. He worked for motorsports complexes, national nonprofits, digital agencies and software companies before launching his own communications agency. The Gin and Tonic is a timeless classic known by everyone who drinks cocktails. Ben's job is just that—to make OnTheRocks a classic known by everyone who drinks cocktails.
The Journey to Get to OnTheRocks
Dozens of Concepts—100’s of Experiments
It all started with a question, as most great journeys do. Matt Verlinich—the maker of OntheRocks—was sitting in front of his TV one night when he saw an alcohol commercial that piqued his interest. The ice being used in the drinks was clear and appealing. It made the alcohol look even more appetizing. So, being the go-getter that he is, Matt asked himself, “How can I make clear ice at home?”
His initial goal was to recreate the perfection he had seen on TV. After doing extensive research and experimenting with different materials like discarded pieces of plastic and insulation, Matt realized that he could democratize the process and make it easier for others to use as well.
As the experiments began to pan out, he found that by combining the DIY solutions with enterprise-level solutions, he could create an affordable, no-moving-part solution. This would give him the opportunity to manufacture his creation to share with others, so that they could do it themselves and then pass on their excitement for clear ice to others. There were, however, some challenges along the way.
Matt created several prototypes. He moved from using containers and recycling existing parts to customizing his own solution that would be the best size and form factor for a customer. Using CAD and his experience from Tech Shop, Matt continued to experiment. His goal was to design a product that would be cost efficient, versatile and useful. This left him with a lot of small changes that needed to be made.
The tray and water reservoir were a trial. How robust or complicated did it need to be? Plus, manufacturability was the biggest thing. How could he design the perfect clear ice product to be as cost effective as possible?
The idea was to save the consumer as much money as possible. Matt’s designs went through dozens of iterations and designs as well as hundreds of experiments.
He enlisted the help of his friends in the Maker Community of Pittsburgh along the way receiving invaluable support and insight.
We Need Your Help
Bringing a product like this to market isn’t easy. We have some startup costs to overcome before we can democratize clear ice for everyone.
Here’s the list of our manufacturing costs:

Expanded foam mold
Plastic injection mold
2 liquid silicone rubber injection molds
Insulation foam material/production cost
Water reservoir material/production cost
Cube Ice tray material/production cost
Sphere Ice tray material/production cost
Fulfillment Shipping

If you're looking to up your cocktail game, and take your next gathering to the next level, we'd love your support. Act now to take advantage of our once-on-a-lifetime early bird rates and perks.
Love,

story:
Our Story

How did all of this begin?

 

“All it takes is $700 and a passion.” Unknown to me, this quote would fuel our start-up, Honey Moon Chocolates. Carmen Rossi, a successful entrepreneur in Chicago, was speaking to one of my marketing classes about what exactly it takes to start a business.

 

Fast forward a month- It was a hot summer afternoon. Haley and I were on our way to Chicago. Something about traveling somewhere new stirred my emotions- bored with my current summer jobs and all that follows. I looked at Haley and asked, “Would you be willing to start a business with me?” We had no clue as to what our business was going to be- we were just excited to create something new. From where we started, being able to constantly adapt to who we want to be and not who we are has been incredibly important.

 

 

Honey Moon Chocolates

Bean-to-bar chocolate sweetened with raw, local honey.

 

Honey Moon Chocolates was created by Cameron Loyet and Haley Lower with one thought in mind- to create. We began making chocolate as a hobby, but it snowballed into so much more. Our cacao is sourced from Peru, which is known for fruity and floral tasting notes. As we were striving to cut refined sugar from our own diets, we wanted to provide others with an opportunity to have healthier sweets. Honey affords us the opportunity to differentiate ourselves with a product that will create quite a buzz in the current cacao bean to chocolate bar industry.

Our process starts with a cacao bean. Roast, Crack, Winnow, Grind, Temper, and we have chocolate. These steps are the same as ancient cacao producers, and they allow us to shape a revolutionary bean-to-bar chocolate flavor using Organic Peruvian Cacao and local raw honey.

We have been refining our cacao production process since June of 2016, and we continue to learn every day. Chocolate is volatile, temperamental, and requires the utmost care.  

Contributors, regardless of their donation size, will be included on our Founders Wall which will be displayed proudly in our future physical location in St. Louis and proudly on our website.

 

Get To Know Us

Who are these crazy chocolate people??

 

Cameron, born and raised in Highland, IL, plans to graduate from Illinois Wesleyan University in December of 2017 and continue growing Honey Moon Chocolates. He is one of four siblings. His fondest memories of Honey Moon’s endless cacao adventure is, and continues to be, extremely late nights perfecting the batch at hand with Haley. His favorite step of the refining process is roasting due to the amazing aroma the beans release.

Haley is a Normal, IL native- yes, very normal. She graduated from Illinois Wesleyan University in December of 2016 with a degree in Biology and will be attending Saint Louis University School of Medicine this Fall. Haley is passionate about both making and eating chocolate. She loves being able to provide a chocolate that nobody can feel guilty about eating. Her favorite step in the chocolate making process is tempering, while listening to Jack Johnson and Taylor Swift.

 

We have been dating for a little more than two years now, and most recently have become engaged. Our adventure together has gotten sweeter through our passion for cacao. We will be tying the knot next June and look forward to our own Honey Moon!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Being a contributor means so much more...

 

We will provide chocolate products to the Bloomington-Normal area as well as the metropolitan area of St. Louis. We plan to open a physical location in St. Louis serving chocolate and coffee products using local honey as our sole sweetener (renovations planned for January of 2018 - TBA). Of the $25,000 we are asking for, most will go into startup costs such as kitchen rent, licensing and permits, equipment, ingredients and supplies for operations in Bloomington, IL. A detailed budget can be found below. All contributions will help us to develop our business.

Our unique perks give our contributors prime opportunities to support Honey Moon, try some of our chocolate, or even help us develop a new flavor!

 

We hope to create a loyal following that will stay with us as we continue to grow.

 

The Impact

Creating a healthier future.

 

Although we are fairly new to the cacao industry, we have found that patience is the key to being successful. Whether it is developing a roasting profile for a new origin of chocolate or redesigning our logo. By frequently taking a step back, we ensure that our next step keeps our values and goals in focus.

Our main objective when we began making chocolate was to eliminate refined sugars. Natural sweeteners provide minerals and enzymes not found in refined sugar  and can also easily be traced to their source. The raw clover honey we use gives our chocolate an enhanced floral tasting note that is unparalleled to any sugar used today in craft chocolate.

When developing our chocolate, it was important to us to ensure that our product would be sustainable, both for the environment and our suppliers. Our cacao is organic and fairly traded in order to support cacao growers. All of our packaging- from our natural soy wax paper to our labels made from plant material and wood cellulose- is minimally processed, biodegradable, and compostable.

 

Developing trust with our contributors, customers, and suppliers is the foundation of Honey Moon Chocolates

 

The Pollinator Partnership

Protect their lives. Preserve Ours.

 

The Pollinator Partnership’s mission is to promote the health of pollinators, critical to food and ecosystems, through conservation, education, and research. Signature initiatives include the NAPPC (North American Pollinator Protection Campaign), National Pollinator Week, and the Ecoregional Planting Guides.  

With each purchase of our chocolate bars (upon opening), we have pledged 20% of profits to the Pollinator Partnership. These donations can be redeemed by going to our site (hmchocolates.com/bees).  Note: donations/contributions with the Pollinator Partnership do not imply endorsement of our chocolate.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Hurdles we can’t jump without your help.

 

There are many barriers to entering the bean-to-bar chocolate industry. Licensing our product and finding a full-time kitchen to operate out of has been our greatest challenge as a business. Renting a kitchen also requires a hefty general liability and property insurance plan, both of which are costly.

There are also challenges on the individual batch level. We take as much time as we can to develop a bar that is perfectly hand-crafted. For example, our signature 70% dark chocolate bar undergoes 48 hours of processing, grinding and tempering to reach its full potential. When putting this much time and effort into one batch, a lot can go wrong. Being a degree too high or a few too low can throw our whole batch out of temper and force us to start the process over. Our funding goal will allow us to purchase precise equipment to aid in proper quality control of all our chocolate bars.

 

Overcoming numerous risks and challenges to-date has been the most rewarding part of establishing a bean-to-bar chocolate company, other than an unlimited supply of samples!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are passionate about our chocolate journey, we hope you are too!

 

If you’d like to help us achieve our goals, but can’t swing a contribution, please:

 

Talk about our campaign with your friends, family, and coworkers- everybody loves chocolate ;)

Give us a shoutout on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram

Let us know if you have a great idea, or would like to share some encouraging words!

 

Sometimes, you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!
