story:
Hello! I’m David, creator of Bird by Bird. What is Bird by Bird?  A fowl breeding operation?  A bird-watching club?  A unique area of measurement?  Nope.

Bird by Bird is an Indian/Pakistani-themed street food experience that rolls on the streets of New Orleans via a mobile, red “Box of Fire” Tandoor oven that churns out tandoori chicken, curry lamb, rice, yogurt, channa, naan bread, and many creations that were borne from years of home-cooking in my dear friend’s family kitchen.  For a little more detail, please see the video above!

My operation up until now has consisted of my Box of Fire, kitchen implements I’ve scrounged together, help from my friends, a consistent spot outside of Sidney’s Saloon on St. Bernard Avenue on the weekends, and many wonderful patrons who’ve eaten a plate!

I have recently been presented with a brick-and-mortar opportunity with a fully built-out kitchen, space to put the tandoor oven, and the ability for Bird by Bird to deliver more of its delicious plates to those who desire a good, home-cooked meal with flavors from across the globe.  

This campaign will fund the rent and costs of building out the store-front so that Bird by Bird can not only serve home-cooked Indian/Pakistani flavors to a greater audience more frequently, but also provide a space for other pop-up food operations to experiment from time to time.  

That’s right:  This campaign isn’t just about this one type of food and myself, but about allowing others to test their gastronomic mettle. I’m not just about food - I love the space that is created when a bunch of people cook and eat together, which is one of the principles which inspired me to start wheeling the Box of Fire out into the streets.

As a culinary-school-trained student and native of multicultural Washington DC, I have a love of global flavors; as a traveler with lots of experience wandering Asia and South America, I love the vibrant immediacy of street food. I want to bring all of the above to my adopted hometown of New Orleans, a place that has always nurtured the mixing and development of culture through food.  

Bird by Bird - as seen in Gambit, New Orleans & Me, and Eater NOLA - is a simple idea: Be nice. Make good food. Tell your story. Share with your community.  Do everything with passion. Do those things, and the rest will follow.

Links: 

The Gambit

www.bestofneworleans.com/gambit/pop-up-culture/Content?oid=2870499

www.bestofneworleans.com/gambit/pop-goes-the-sizzle/Content?oid=2870484

Eater New Orleans

http://nola.eater.com/2016/1/26/10830684/best-new-orleans-pop-ups-restaurants

New Orleans and Me

http://www.neworleans.me/journal/detail/1070/A-Bird-of-a-Delicious-Feather

What I Need & What You Get

Bird by Bird is looking for assistance to help fund our growing enterprise. We’re in the market to rent kitchen space, purchase equipment and ingredients, and doing this with an eye towards expanding the diversity and quality of our operation. Here are some places where crowdfunded resources may be spent:

Rental kitchen/counter top space/ brick and mortar: This will allow me to move my prep kitchen out of my home…which will put a smile on my face… which will allow me to make you a better plate of food.  This will also allow folks to sit and enjoy their food, as well as have access to nearby activities in the Treme, Marigny, French Quarter, and Seventh Ward.

Commercial refrigerator: Right now I’m storing meat in my fridge at home, and when that thing busts, everyone has a bad day.  

A professional quality tandoor oven: In order to make this food faster and cook bread in the oven quickly and consistently, my beautiful big red tandoor will need to be replaced. She is the first oven I ever built. She is a tremendous work horse, but it’s time to upgrade.

A commercial mixer:  BECAUSE NAAN.

Other Ways You Can Help

Keep coming out and eating! Get the word out, tell everyone you know, and please, let me know what you think!

story:
Short Summary of How & Why We Got Started

When Nikki and Neil met 3 years ago they came to realize they had some big dreams, Neil wanted to open a Brewery and Nikki wanted to figure out a way to help give back to her community of Upland that she has been apart of for 15 years. We put our heads together and came up with a plan to combine both our passions. After many sleepless nights of figuring out a name and mission that would represent both our passions, we came up with RESCUE BREWING COMPANY. The word Rescue for us represents all the  FIRST RESPONDERS that run toward an event rather than away and put their lives on the line for a complete stranger or animal and they deserve to be recognized. 

Soon after our project started, a long time friend of Neil's, Dave , found great interest in what we were doing.  Besides having a great passion for craft beer, he loved our mission behind it and wanted to partner with us.  A few months later, he packed up his things and moved to California from Colorado.

Location was also very important to us.  We didn't want to be just another brewery in an industrial complex.  We wanted to be in the middle of the community it served.   Historic Downtown Upland was exactly what we were looking for.  It had the quaint small town feel and that was the atmosphere we have been working so hard to provide... a home away from home.  The opportunity to open our brewery in Upland was very important to us.  Upland has been home to Nikki for 15 years.  3 of her 4 children still go to Upland schools.

Over the past 3 year, since the decision was made to open a brewery, Neil was busy studying the industry and fine tuning the craft while brewing countless batches of beer.  Meanwhile Nikki started coming up with other ideas for the brewery that could incorporate her passion. Her first idea was to make dog biscuits from the spent grains left over after each batch of beer Neil made. These are healthy snacks for dogs and she decided that all the proceeds from the sale of these biscuits will go to the UPLAND ANIMAL SHELTER. She along with many residents were very upset the shelter's funding was cut and this was a way the community can help. Once she started thinking of helping the animal shelter she thought of other animal rescues and all the fire fighters and law enforcement, the many volunteers at Steven Hope for Children, Foothill Family Shelter and many more. All these people who dedicate their time, money and resources to help others and never receive the recognition they deserve. Its Nikki and Neil's mission to do just that!

 

What We Need & How You Can Help.... Plus All The Great Perks!

In order to be successful and open soon we need your HELP! We want our taproom to be a nice, respectable location that you will feel comfortable bringing your family, friends, dogs  or even holding your special event at.  Our location is just a little under 5,000 sq. ft and can accommodate up to 200 people. Although we don't serve food we are partnering with a few of the local restaurants on 2nd Ave. to deliver food to our location, as well as allowing you to bring in your own food. We will have weekly & monthly events (trivia, bingo, painting parties), tv’s (for sporting events), music (live and jukebox), and games (board games, arcade games) for adults and kids. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is MONEY! In order to accomplish this task and be able to handle the volume of people from not only the day to day foot traffic but the events (lemon festival, irish festival, car show, Cinco de Mayo, Farmers Market, etc) that happen throughout the year in downtown Upland. In order to keep up with such a demand we need to purchase several more  FERMENTATION TANKS,  a KEG WASHER, and more SEATING.  So far we have funded the construction and most of the equipment but we have run out of funds. Please help us so we can help make this downtown area great again! Please check out the perks we are offering,  you won't be disappointed!

 

The Impact

Our mission will impact everyone in our community and will give  recognition to our FIRST RESPONDERS by giving a portion of our proceeds from our beer sales, merchandise sales and fundraising events. We want them to know we appreciate and recognize that they put their lives on the line each and every day for us. You may wonder how we will be recognizing our FIRST RESPONDERS and the answer is...we will be giving a portion of our proceeds to each of the departments to be used for equipment their department may need, to help the family of a fallen hero, to help an animal rescue save an animals life or to rescue some from a kill shelter, or even to give some hope to a family in need. So the  bottom line is the more money we make, the more money we can give back! Not only will we be recognizing our FIRST RESPONDERS but we will be helping bring attention and life back to our Historic Downtown Upland. Our goal is to create a place that is kid friendly, pet friendly and pretty much a home away from home! So please come join us on this journey.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to help financially but one way you can help is by passing this along to all your friends, family, and colleagues. The other way is to come in and visit us once our doors are open. Getting the word out to everyone and your help is greatly appreciated, THANK YOU in advance!
story_txt:
Short Summary of How & Why We Got Started
When Nikki and Neil met 3 years ago they came to realize they had some big dreams, Neil wanted to open a Brewery and Nikki wanted to figure out a way to help give back to her community of Upland that she has been apart of for 15 years. We put our heads together and came up with a plan to combine both our passions. After many sleepless nights of figuring out a name and mission that would represent both our passions, we came up with RESCUE BREWING COMPANY. The word Rescue for us represents all the  FIRST RESPONDERS that run toward an event rather than away and put their lives on the line for a complete stranger or animal and they deserve to be recognized. 
Soon after our project started, a long time friend of Neil's, Dave , found great interest in what we were doing.  Besides having a great passion for craft beer, he loved our mission behind it and wanted to partner with us.  A few months later, he packed up his things and moved to California from Colorado.
Location was also very important to us.  We didn't want to be just another brewery in an industrial complex.  We wanted to be in the middle of the community it served.   Historic Downtown Upland was exactly what we were looking for.  It had the quaint small town feel and that was the atmosphere we have been working so hard to provide... a home away from home.  The opportunity to open our brewery in Upland was very important to us.  Upland has been home to Nikki for 15 years.  3 of her 4 children still go to Upland schools.
Over the past 3 year, since the decision was made to open a brewery, Neil was busy studying the industry and fine tuning the craft while brewing countless batches of beer.  Meanwhile Nikki started coming up with other ideas for the brewery that could incorporate her passion. Her first idea was to make dog biscuits from the spent grains left over after each batch of beer Neil made. These are healthy snacks for dogs and she decided that all the proceeds from the sale of these biscuits will go to the UPLAND ANIMAL SHELTER. She along with many residents were very upset the shelter's funding was cut and this was a way the community can help. Once she started thinking of helping the animal shelter she thought of other animal rescues and all the fire fighters and law enforcement, the many volunteers at Steven Hope for Children, Foothill Family Shelter and many more. All these people who dedicate their time, money and resources to help others and never receive the recognition they deserve. Its Nikki and Neil's mission to do just that!
 

What We Need & How You Can Help.... Plus All The Great Perks!
In order to be successful and open soon we need your HELP! We want our taproom to be a nice, respectable location that you will feel comfortable bringing your family, friends, dogs  or even holding your special event at.  Our location is just a little under 5,000 sq. ft and can accommodate up to 200 people. Although we don't serve food we are partnering with a few of the local restaurants on 2nd Ave. to deliver food to our location, as well as allowing you to bring in your own food. We will have weekly & monthly events (trivia, bingo, painting parties), tv’s (for sporting events), music (live and jukebox), and games (board games, arcade games) for adults and kids. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is MONEY! In order to accomplish this task and be able to handle the volume of people from not only the day to day foot traffic but the events (lemon festival, irish festival, car show, Cinco de Mayo, Farmers Market, etc) that happen throughout the year in downtown Upland. In order to keep up with such a demand we need to purchase several more  FERMENTATION TANKS,  a KEG WASHER, and more SEATING.  So far we have funded the construction and most of the equipment but we have run out of funds. Please help us so we can help make this downtown area great again! Please check out the perks we are offering,  you won't be disappointed!
 
The Impact
Our mission will impact everyone in our community and will give  recognition to our FIRST RESPONDERS by giving a portion of our proceeds from our beer sales, merchandise sales and fundraising events. We want them to know we appreciate and recognize that they put their lives on the line each and every day for us. You may wonder how we will be recognizing our FIRST RESPONDERS and the answer is...we will be giving a portion of our proceeds to each of the departments to be used for equipment their department may need, to help the family of a fallen hero, to help an animal rescue save an animals life or to rescue some from a kill shelter, or even to give some hope to a family in need. So the  bottom line is the more money we make, the more money we can give back! Not only will we be recognizing our FIRST RESPONDERS but we will be helping bring attention and life back to our Historic Downtown Upland. Our goal is to create a place that is kid friendly, pet friendly and pretty much a home away from home! So please come join us on this journey.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to help financially but one way you can help is by passing this along to all your friends, family, and colleagues. The other way is to come in and visit us once our doors are open. Getting the word out to everyone and your help is greatly appreciated, THANK YOU in advance!

story:
WHY GOAT WHEY?

Health Benefits - Our 100% Grass-fed goat whey protein is non-denatured; meaning the
vital nutrients remain in tact and more readily available to our body all while boasting
the highest form of BCAA’s and biological value found in any natural food source on
the planet! Goat whey helps to promote better muscle growth and recovery, is easily
digestible, more tolerated by those with lactose intolerances, and matches the human
body better than cow dairy. Goat whey protein is non-homogenized - meaning it is FREE
from a free radical called “Xathine Oxidase” that is found in cow’s milk.

Sustainable Farming Industry - Simply put, goats require less space. They have the ability
to forage on marginal rangeland and they are an excellent provider of milk. A single goat
can produce 2-3 times of milk compared to a cow! Goats also create a necessary and
natural fertilizer for our crops.

 

MEDIA COVERAGE

“The global protein bar market is growing at a fast rate, due to the increasing demand among consumers for portable convenience foods, which is enhancing the protein bar market, specially in areas focused on allergen-friendly, non-gmo, low-glycemic, functional, and natural/organic categories." (Mordor Intellegence)

“Overall, about 75% of world’s pop. has become lactose intolerant." (PCRM: Physicians Committee for Respinsible Medicine)

“In 2014, the nation’s goat dairy herd grew 2 percent from the previous year, and producers reported a 15 percent increase in sales, which are continuing to rise." (The Associated Press and USDA reports)


 

WHO WE ARE

Being a very on-the-go person while trying to stay fit and eat right is difficult as it is, but even more so when you can’t have just the normal stuff, such as cow dairy. The frustration set in to break out of the herd and I got to work creating a protein bar that was unlike any other. It was important to me to use functional foods and to find a suitable dairy protein source in order to not sacrifice the vital BCAA’s that our bodies need for proper muscle growth…goat whey met
those needs and so much more.

We align with your values, and aim to un-frustrate the world by offering protein bars that are wholesome over hidden – rewinding food back to its core; that is, where food starts as food and ends as food…with NONE of the bad!

  Corrine Konell, Owner of barNONE Protein

 

WHAT WE NEED

Goal: $20,000
We’ve got the team, and the recipes all set to go, but we need a crowd funding campaign push to help us launch two new bar flavors and hire distribution to get into stores in the US and Canada.


TIMELINE

 

STRETCH GOALS

As a stretch goal... if we receive enough funding, we will launch a line of goat whey protein powders in both vanilla and chocolate. As a backer of our products, you will receive a sample bag of our protein powders, either in Chocolate or Vanilla.


 

OVERVIEW & THANK YOU

barNONE Protein extends a HUGE THANK YOU to each of our backers who is as excited as we are to ‘un-frustrate’ the world with super clean goat whey protein bars!


RISKS & CHALLENGES

barNONE Protein has already broken the barrier by launching the very first goat whey protein bar to hit the market today with our very first flavor of Peanut Butter Chocolate Chunk. The initial ‘leg-work’ is done, and with our current relationship we already have with our co-packer we are confident that our new bar flavor production will transcend smoothly and seamlessly.

While we are not immune to the fact that challenges could arise, we do realize that circumstances beyond our control could potentially delay new bar flavor production. For this reason, we have padded our fulfillment timeline a bit to allow for any possible delays. 

If our goal is not met, we will be formulating each of the bar flavors by hand in a certified test kitchen in order to meet order fulfillment. We will then use the funds we do receive to continue to help us reach our goal of creating and launching marketable new bar flavors very soon!

story:
Our Story

Toddy Shop by Hemant Kishore will be a contemporary remake of classic Toddy Shops located in Kerala, India (also known as the land of spices and Chef Hemant’s hometown). Known as bars for the common man, Toddy Shops are places for friends to join together and enjoy good spicy bar food and toddy, the signature fermented coconut drink.

Our goal is to create the United States’ first ever Toddy Shop in the heart of Las Vegas. Toddy Shop will be for everyone to come together and enjoy an innovative cocktail and craft beer program meant to pair with the spices and flavors of our South Indian cuisine. This Toddy Shop will be community oriented and inviting for all people whether it’s after work, for dinner, brunch or celebrations. Bringing a little South India to Las Vegas, we will give customers what is called the “Toddy Shop Experience” by serving food and drink just like they would in Kerala. We will keep guests in the know with the Toddy Shop Secret Menu, where our guests will receive text messages of limited edition menu items, and we will focus on sourcing sustainably and locally when possible.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to open the first Toddy Shop in the United States, we need a minimum of $40,000. We already have a space picked out; unfortunately, a lot of works needs to be done before we can open our doors. $40,000 will help with the initial build out of Toddy Shop, sourcing equipment and bringing Chef Hemant Kishore’s vision to life.

The Impact

Las Vegas is a relatively new city and its residents are still trying to find and build community and culture. Traditional Indian Toddy Shops are rooted in community. They are the local watering holes for the people to come together and enjoy the simplicity of delicious food and drinks together. Toddy Shop will aim to be exactly that – a place where everyone wants to be, a place inclusive of all people and a place founded on centuries of community and culture. By opening the first Toddy Shop in the United States, we are preserving the recipes and traditions of Chef Hemant’s culture and are excited to continue bringing those to new audiences and continuing to build community in a city we love.  

Beyond community though, Chef Hemant Kishore is very passionate about work being done in and around mental health, and for that reason, we are partnering with the Las Vegas chapter of NAMI – the National Alliance on Mental Illness. We will be donating a portion of our campaign to the organization dedicated to building better lives for the millions of Americans affected by mental illness.

Risks & Challenges

Las Vegas is a growing market and currently has a burgeoning off-Strip culinary community; however, opening any new business is risky. And while Indian Food is a growing trend, we are still educating people about an untapped foreign cuisine.

Other Ways You Can Help

It’s not all about the money! If you can’t financially donate but still want to help, please consider sharing our campaign on every social media outlet you have and telling anyone and everyone about Toddy Shop. We are also accepting donations in the form of any dishware, serving ware and utensils. Additionally, if you have an affinity for DIY, donations in the form of helping us paint, clean, lay tile, etc. will be accepted with open arms!

story:
HELLO JUICE & SMOOTHIE BAR

We are Jordan and Kayla Bauer, creator and owners of Hello. 

The idea of Hello started while on our honeymoon in Hawaii. We were sitting in a juice bar enjoying some smoothie bowls and thought "St. Louis needs this". 
As a natural and holistic health enthusiast, I, Kayla, had dreamt of opening some type of juice bar previously but never let it be more than a dream. Jordan was quickly on board with the idea and as the go-getter that he is, started working on what it would look like to make this dream become a reality.

Almost a year later we are in the final stages of opening our juice and smoothie bar! 
This is where you come in. Our plans are to start simple but we plan to grow our bar to have much more than just juice and smoothies. 

Right now we are in the build-out process, designing and finding equipment. Your financial help will help us create a beautiful space and functioning kitchen to lay the groundwork for our opening day. 

We have put together some really fun rewards and can't wait for you to check them out!

THE IMPACT

We believe in the power of plants and that nourishing your body is the most loving thing you can do for yourself and others. Studies have proven the incredible benefits that fruits and vegetables have on your overall well-being and we want to help you achieve your best health yet!

Not only do we want to serve the greatest food on earth but we want to help inform our customers, surrounding communities, schools, business offices, etc. about HOW eating and drinking the right food can change your life. 

HOW ELSE CAN I HELP?

 

 

Tell all your friends about us!

Be a loyal customer!

Post about us on social media!

SEE YOU THIS SUMMER!

story:
OUR MISSION:

To be the most rebellious cocktail brand on the market by relentlessly pursuing the best ingredients to combine travel and celebration. We reward those who wander, by creating the most accessible cocktail on the planet.

OUR STORY:

My name is Chandra Swenson,

As a craft bartender for the past twelve years, I've composed thousands of different cocktail combinations. I created Drifter Cocktails to give my fellow beverage connoisseurs a chance to enjoy a great drink wherever their sense of adventure takes them.

Your support would set motion the nearly two years of preparing I've done to launch my product. Having completely funded this business with my own hard earned tips as a bartender, I now need the help of passionate imbibers everywhere to get me the rest of the way. 

WHERE WE PLAN TO SELL DRIFTER:

We plan to sell Drifter Cocktails to online retailers, airlines, boutique hotels, golf courses, movie theaters and concert halls.  We want you to be able to enjoy these tasty boozy cocktails in places that do not have the best access to all the ingredients to make a enjoyable cocktail. 

Here's how your contribution will help:

$4,750 will go to Citrus Distillers (Riviera Beach, FL) for private label manufacturing and distribution.

The scope of their service includes:

Formula and Label submission to Federal Trade Bureau. I must have a COLA (Certificate of Label Approval) to get started. Mixing and bottling my product according to federal guidelines and setting up my distribution in the states of NY, NJ ,FL and CA. As well as ABC (Alcohol Beverage Control) compliance review and submissions.

This will fulfill every aspect of my federal and state guidelines, leaving me ready to launch the first batch of cocktails, The Old Fashioned, Sazerac, Negroni, and Manhattan.

$5000 to have my lawyer review all of my contracts for potential liability, this flat rate has been negotiated to cover every contract I need leading up to the launch of our initial four cocktails.

$25,000 to purchase the totes and barrels of Whiskey, Bitters, Rye, Absinthe, Gin, Bourbon, Sweet and Dry Vermouth.

$6,000  for 3,000, 100ml, black ceramic flasks with a leather strap, cork and shipping included.

$3,000 for graphic design of marketing and presentation materials for retail stores, hotels and airlines.

$11,250 devoted to fulfilling campaign promises

$10,000 will be held as working capital and runway to ensure we have the capacity to begin bringing this idea to local shops. 

 

What I've already done to prepare:

I have already secured a bottle manufacturer and have ordered my first 1,500 custom ceramic flasks, due to arrive in early May.

I have sourced and negotiated contracts with the companies that will provide: the custom bottle corks, and the alcohol, bitters and syrups to make each of my first four cocktail releases. The Old Fashioned, Negroni, Sazerac and Manhattan. Finally, I have setup my bonded storage facility and hired a freight company to manage my outgoing orders of the finished product. The intensely detailed structure I've created will leave me ready to pursue contracts with the many interested hotel, airline, and resort contacts I've gathered over the course of my preparation.

Perks:

We can't wait for you to see what cool stuff we've cooked up as a thank you for your contribution. We've created some really awesome perks like "bail out a Drifter" where your contributions help get our characters out of a bind, and a charity gets half. Or you can even become a "High Roller" and have a special drifter character made in your likeness, complete with your own custom drink.

If we don't reach our intended goal, the money can still be used to launch a single cocktail. We will start with the Old Fashioned.

BAIL A DRIFTER OUT OF JAIL & CHOOSE THEIR COMMUNITY SERVICE!

These guys are constantly where they don't belong and that sometimes lands them in trouble. Help get our Drifters out of jail, 50% of your contribution will go directly to a charity of your choice. Each Drifter represents their own cause, so choose carefully....or choose them all if you can't decide.

BECOME A LIVING LEGEND AND MAKE YOURSELF INTO A DRIFTER

ROI DRIFTER MASK:

DRIFTER COTTON T-SHIRT

BLACK OR WHITE 11OZ CERAMIC FLASK: please note these do not have any alcoholic beverage in side

DRIFTER COCKTAILS STICKERS:

IRON BRANDED WOOD COASTERS:

THE GRAND EVENT: INSIDE OAKLAND HISTORIC TRAIN STATION

​

 

Risks and Rewards:

We know the value of a first impression, it can carry your brand tremendously. So we've taken great care in researching our recipes and investing in time honored classics. We've prepared this company to weather any foreseeable storm with years of experience at the helm of past industry innovators. Starting a company is terrifying, but ultimately one of the most incredible experiences possible. With that knowledge first-hand, we'll continue to strive for the best cocktail you'll ever sneak into a Tom Waits concert.

If you can't contribute, but still want to see these hit the shelves, please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell anyone that may come to mind when you read our story.

Cheers,

Drifter Cocktails

With that knowledge first-hand, we'll continue to strive for the best cocktail you'll ever sneak into a Tom Waits concert.If you can't contribute, but still want to see these hit the shelves, please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell anyone that may come to mind when you read our story.Cheers,Drifter Cocktails

story:
Die Kurzfassung 

  • Du bekommst von uns Schokopralinen ohne Zucker
  • Für Diabetiker, Naschkatzen, Sportler, Kinder & Gesundheitsbewusste
  • Wir eröffnen das Café „Zuckerfrey“ in Berlin und anderen Städten
  • Gesundheit + Schokolade = Gesunde Sünden zum gut fühlen
  • Alles ist vegan, gluten- und zuckerfrei, bei 100% Geschmack
  • Du bekommst unsere Schokolade ganz bequem europaweit bis zu dir nach Hause geliefert
  • Die Inhaltsstoffe sind klinisch getestet & erzeugen einen genau so schokoladigen und dabei noch cremigeren und hochwertigeren Geschmack als normale Schokolade
  • Das Café wird das Pilotprojekt für eine gesunde Gastronomiekette in Deutschland
  • Unsere Mission: Gemeinsam machen wir Ernährung leicht und gesund

 

Das Team 

Pero Vrdoljak (50, Emsdetten)

  • Gelernter Hotelfachmann
  • 30 Jahre Gastronomie-Erfahrung
  • Autor, Speaker, Vollblutgastronom

Björn Kurtenbach (27, Berlin)

  • Leidenschaftlicher Vollblutkoch und Küchennerd
  • 10Jahre Gastronomieerfahrung
  • Workaholic, Biohacker

Manuel Gonzalez (27, Berlin, Los Angeles)

  • Medienmanagement B.A.
  • Mehrfach erfolgreicher Gründer
  • Bekannter Marketing Experte (100.000+ Follower online) 
  • Autor, Speaker, TV-Persönlichkeit

 

Die Geschichte hinter Zuckerfrey

Du bekommst von uns Kuchen, Pralinen und alle anderen erdenklichen Süßigkeiten aus 100% gesunden Zutaten, die sinnlich schmecken, dich verwöhnen und dabei nicht nur nicht ungesund sind, sondern sogar deine Fettverbrennung und Denkleistung fördern:

 

Kommt dir diese Liste bekannt vor?

  • Erhöhte Fettverbrennung
  • Gewichtsverlust und besseres Aussehen
  • Reine Haut
  • Längeres Leben, weniger Krankheiten
  • Mentaler Fokus und gute Laune  

Das sind nur ein paar der Vorteile einer gesunden Ernährung. Kein Zweifel: Jeder weiß mittlerweile wie wichtig eine gesunde Ernährung für unser Wohlbefinden (und unser Aussehen) ist.

 

Aber warum machen wir es dann nicht?

Naja, ganz ehrlich: Es macht einfach keinen Spaß auf Sünden wie Schokolade, Kuchen und Co. zu verzichten. 

Aber was wäre wenn es Schokolade oder sogar Torten gäbe die vegan, gluten-, laktose- und zuckerfrei wären, dich abnehmen lassen und trotzdem besser schmecken als ihr kalorienüberladenes Gegenstück? Ganz einfach: Es wäre ein Traum!

Und genau dieser Traum ist wahr geworden.

 

Warum gab es das bisher noch nicht?

Die Antworten sind eigentlich ganz simpel, also lass mich dir eine kurze Geschichte erzählen:  

Hi, ich bin Manuel Gonzalez. Und wenn du mein Foto oben gesehen hast, dann wird dir eine Sache auffallen: Ich bin dick. Und das schon eine ganze Weile. Und ehrlich gesagt? Das nervt mich. Es nervt mich aber nicht genug, um auf meine Lieblingssüßigkeiten zu verzichten...

Da ich aber trotzdem gesund leben will, machte ich mich vor 3 Monaten auf die Suche nach einer Lösung. Und diese Reise brachte mich schließlich zu Björn (der Typ aus dem Video), mit dem ich seit einer ganzen Weile befreundet bin.  

Und es gibt (mindestens) 2 Dinge die Björn faszinierend machen:

  1. Er hat über 10 Jahre Gastronomie Erfahrung und kocht regelmäßig mit Sterneköchen die du aus dem Fernsehen kennst
     
  2. Er ist ein „Biohacking-Nerd“. Diese selbsternannten Versuchskaninchen experimentieren mit Dingen wie extremer Kälte, Hitze, Vitaminen, Mineralstoffen, etc. um ihren mentalen Fokus zu steigern, mehr Energie zu haben oder eben auch mehr Fett zu verbrennen.

 

Ich wusste, dass es mehr als „ich will abnehmen“ brauchen würde um Björn von meiner Idee zu überzeugen. Denn wenn er nicht grade mit Fernsehköchen zusammenarbeitet, kocht er bei den europaweit besten Caterern oder auf Kreuzfahrtschiffen…

Also überlegte ich mir etwas Anderes um ihn zu überzeugen. Warum gibt es eigentlich noch keine gesunde Fastfood Kette?

Ich meine Mc Donald's und Co. sind an jeder Ecke... Warum geht das nicht in gesund?

Das war die Vision die uns zusammenbrachte. Und das Bild einer gesunden Gastronomiekette treibt uns nach wie vor an.

Für uns ist das eine Sache für die es sich wirklich zu arbeiten und zu kämpfen lohnt. Etwas, das uns jeden Morgen aufstehen und strahlen lässt, denn wir sehen wie wertvoll das für Diabetiker, Übergewichtige (also auch mich) und auch alte oder kranke Menschen ist - oder solche, die einfach täglichen Genuss haben und trotzdem noch mehr Leistung zeigen wollen.

Björn war also mit an Bord. Und so feilten wir (naja, vor allem Björn) monatelang an den Rezepturen für unser erstes Pilotprojekt:

 

Das Café Zuckerfrey in Berlin.

Wir testeten dutzende Versionen von Pralinen über Torten bis hin zu einem Brotaufstrich der verdächtig nach N*tella schmeckte... bis wir die Rezepte fanden die uns wirklich überzeugten.

Und über diese Experimentierphase wurde mir eines glasklar: Die Frage „Warum macht das noch niemand?“ hat eine ganz einfache Antwort: Es ist verdammt schwierig.

Das größte Problem ist es einen gesunden Ersatz für Zucker zu finden. Denn die klassischen Süßstoffe sind auch nicht viel gesünder (wenn überhaupt) als Raffineriezucker.

Und selbst gesündere Süßstoffe wie Stevia haben einen riesigen Nachteil: Sie schmecken nicht wirklich nach Zucker, sondern haben einen „bleiartigen“ Nachgeschmack.

Die Gleichung ist simpel: Kein gesunder Süßstoff = Keine leckeren und gesunden Süßigkeiten.

Genau da kam Björn ins Spiel. Nach mehreren Monaten fand er eine Rezeptur die nicht nur wie Zucker schmeckt, sondern auch zaubert: Der Zuckerersatz in der Schokolade hat eine klinisch nachgewiesene kariostatische und antikariogene Wirkung! 

Auf deutsch: Unser Zuckerersatz schmeckt nicht nur wie Zucker, sondern du könntest ihn sogar abends nach dem Zähneputzen essen und dein Zahnarzt würde dir sogar noch eine High-Five dafür geben, weil er Karies vorbeugt und deine Fettverbrennung anregt!

Das ist unsere Geheimwaffe. Von da an war alles andere leichter. Björn entwickelte die Rezepte für unsere Schokolade, die Torten und allerlei süße Wunder, wie zum Beispiel eine gesunde Schokocreme für die er die Zutaten extra aus Skandinavien(!) einfliegen ließ.

Ja du hast richtig gehört: Wir machen deinem N*tella-Glas einen gesunden, noch cremigeren Bruder.

Natürlich willst du jetzt wissen was genau in der Schokolade drin ist, daher hier die Wunderwaffe beim Namen: Xylit. Klingt neuartig - und ist es auch! Es gibt bereits ein paar Produkte mit Xylit auf dem Markt und die werden tatsächlich sehr gut angenommen, da sie mehr als ebenbürtig sind und das komplett ohne zusätzlichen Zucker!

 

Hier kommst du ins Spiel:

Wir haben die Rezepte… aber um das Café und damit die Produktionsstätte in Berlin zu eröffnen, benötigen wir deine Hilfe. Denn wenn wir all die Küchenutensilien, Maschinen und andere Notwendigkeiten kaufen wollen, dann reicht unser Geld leider nicht mal, wenn wir die Zahnfüllungen unserer Omas verkaufen… Dazu kommen Themen wie Mitarbeiter, Website, Werbung schalten und natürlich Patente, Anwälte und Steuerberater.

Aber mit deiner Hilfe können wir es schaffen. Das heißt es gibt dann nicht nur ein Café in Berlin, sondern du kannst die gesunden Schokopralinen, Brotaufstriche und sogar die Tafelschokolade zu fairen Preisen im Internet bei uns und sogar auf gängigen Webseiten wie Amazon, Ebay und Co. bestellen. Wie klingt das für dich? Mal eben für den Netflix-Abend eine Packung gesunde Süßigkeiten bestellen... Davon habe ich früher immer geträumt!

 


Wofür brauchen wir deine Hilfe (und was hast du davon)?

  • Wir benötigen Geld für die sogenannte "Ablösesumme" für das Café: Etwa 20.000€ gehen in die Einrichtung: Küchengeräte wie Kühlschrank, Ofen, Theke und essenzielle Einrichtungsgegenstände wie Stühle, Tische, Teller, etc.
  • Weitere 10.000€ werden für den Wareneinsatz gebraucht: Die Zutaten für die Pralinen, Schokolade und Torten müssen im Großhandel eingekauft werden. 
  • Der dritte große Posten sind Mitarbeiter. Das charmante Team hinter dem Tresen, benötigt fast 7.000€ pro Monat. Drei Monate gesichertes Gehalt bedeuten 21.000€.
  • Der vierte Posten ist „Influencer Marketing“. Wir möchten mit Agenturen zusammenarbeiten die uns mit Influencern (Menschen mit vielen Social Media Followern) bekannt machen, damit sie für uns werben können. Ich (Manuel) kenne bereits YouTuber mit hundertausenden Fans persönlich, aber wir wollen die Marke noch viel größer aufbauen und brauchen noch mehr Reichweite. Hier sind 10.000€ Budget geplant.
  • Darüber hinaus werden wir Geld für Anwälte, Markeneintragungen, Patente und andere verhältnismäßig kleinere Investitionen benötigen, wie beispielsweise Reisenkosten. Hier planen wir ebenfalls mit 10.000€ Budget.

Im schlimmsten Fall: Wenn wir das Funding-Ziel nicht erreichen sollten, werden wir zuerst Abstriche bei den Agenturen, dann bei der Einrichtung und zuletzt bei den Mitarbeitern machen. Und wir werden alles tun um unseren Traum dennoch so zu realisieren wie geplant. Zum Beispiel haben wir bereits außerhalb von Indiegogo Investoren gefunden die uns vertrauen und ca. 20.000€ zur Verfügung stellen, weil sie an das Projekt glauben und den Markt dafür sehen.

Wir konnten in den letzten Wochen bereits einige starke Partner gewinnen und haben als Vertriebspartner unter anderem den internationalen Liefer-Riesen Deliveroo als Interessenten gewonnen, der unsere Lebensmittel gern in den größten deutschen Städten vertreiben möchte.

 

Was das für dich bedeutet

  • Langfristig revolutionieren wir gemeinsam die konventionelle gesunde Ernährung
  • Wir lösen Probleme wie Übergewicht, unreine Haut und Stimmungsschwankungen
  • Du bekommst vor allen anderen die Schokolade um sie zu genießen und deinen Freunden und Familie zu zeigen
  • Wir bauen über die Jahre eine GESUNDE Marke (Systemgastronomie: Gesunde franchise Restaurants & Cafés in jeder Stadt in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz)
  • Erst Deutschland-, dann Europa-, dann Weltweit
  • Du kannst ein Teil der Reise sein und die Welt zu einem besseren Ort machen
  • Natürlich sind wir auch interessiert an einzelnen Investoren, du kannst also auch gern Kontakt zu uns aufnehmen

 

 

Werde Teil der Süßigkeiten-und Ernährungsrevolution. Gemeinsam verhelfen wir Menschen nicht nur zu einer besseren Figur, sondern zu einem längeren und gesünderen Leben. Such dir einfach unten aus wie du uns unterstützen möchtest:

story:
Estamos listos para dar toda nuestra energía y nuestro amor para abrir La Dulce Boutique, QUIERES SER PARTE de este proyecto?

Por cada donación regalamos una dulce recompensa!

Muchas gracias por tu ayuda, te estaremos siempre agradecido y te pondremos en la lista de nuestros benefactores, tanto en Pastelería que en la página de Facebook de "La Dulce Boutique", GRACIAS !!!

Los fondos serán utilizados para:

- alquiler locale

- muebles locale

- equipo de laboratorio

- gastos burocráticos

- materias primas

- vajillas biodegradables

 

Recibirás actualizaciones regulares sobre cada paso que vamos a hacer!

Si no se llega a la cifra necesaria, seguirá adelante con el proyecto, no podemos darnos el lujo de perder esta oportunidad y confiamos en tu ayuda!

Si no tienes manera de contribuir económicamente, comparta nuestra recaudación de fondos, muchas gracias por la ayuda que puedes dar !!!

story:
Crooked Feeder Brewing who we are and why we are here!

Nestled near the foothills of the Long Range Mountains, in the heart of the farming and logging community of Cormack, Crooked Feeder Brewing is establishing itself in the breadbasket of Western Newfoundland and Labrador. Cormack is a vibrant community that was settled by veterans just after the end of WWII, where weaponry was traded for farm tools.  

The brewery is located on the former family saw-mill of co-owner Robert Sutton. The mill was the family business for 25 years, before the downtrend in the lumber market forced it to cease operations. Newfoundlanders and Labradorians are known for being entrenched in tradition, but also notoriously hearty in the face of adversity. It is with this spirit that Crooked Feeder Brewing wants to contribute to the history of the region and breathe new life into the property.

Our focus is to create an uncomplicated and enjoyable craft beer of the highest quality; whether you’re a casual beer dilettante who enjoys a traditional blend or a craft beer aficionado who appreciates a hop infused finish, Crooked Feeder has a brew to excite your palate . Our goal is to not only reinvent simple and full flavoured craft-brewed beer, but to become an integral part of the local farming community.

To that end, and by brewing quality beers with high quality and locally sourced ingredients, we aim to develop a competitive edge in the Western Newfoundland microbrewery market.  As well, our brewing process byproducts are not wastes to dispose of, but resources with a beneficial reuse. Kettle trub will be composted to support our experimental hop field (or to give to a local hop producer) and, since the brewery is adjacent to a small cattle farm, the spent grains will be donated to the local farmer for feed.

The overarching goal is to create a sense of community, through craft brewing education, innovation, activities/festivals and community ownership.

We produce high quality craft beers that will be well received throughout the Province. Our first and foremost priority is to maintain the highest standards of quality in our beers.

Why are we running this campaign and what do you get for your hard earned dollars?

Plain and simple: we need to raise startup capital for a three-barrel brewery, and we need your help to do it. A three-barrel brewery would allow Crooked Feeder Brewing to begin small scale production of approximately 64 kegs per month that will service local restaurants, bars, and the local growler market. With the growth of a few employees, however, this small system is robust enough to produce upwards of 200 kegs per month. A small system will also allow us the opportunity to produce a wide variety of "small batch" beers. This array of beers will provide consumers with an ever changing variety of tasty brews.  

But hey, we don’t expect you to just give us money (unless you really want to), instead we are offering great perks at values ranging from $5 to $1000. Perk options range from bumper stickers to memberships to great brew day event packages. We have priced everything so that our perks give the backer full value for their money, as if we were already selling retail. Just check out the amount of swag and beverage vouchers included in the membership!

Our goal is $25,000 and these funds will secure financing for a shiny, brand new, fullscale,  three barrel stainless steel brewing system. If we don’t reach our full goal, there are still plans for simpler, less expensive equipment that will get the job done, but with a lot more effort. Make no mistake, Crooked Feeder will be providing quality craft beers to thirsty people in the area by the year's end!

So why is the success of Crooked Feeder Brewing great for the area?

Newfoundland and Labrador—like the rest of Atlantic Canada--is a culturally diverse province with a growing appetite for finer food and beverages. With the rise of craft beer appreciation in Newfoundland and Labrador, the success of new beer opportunities (specifically Port Rexton Brewing and the Western Newfoundland Brewing Company) proves that our province iseager to try new and better beer. The craft beer culture is improving here, but compared to many other provinces, Newfoundland and Labrador is still lagging behind in the number of locally crafted beers. There is currently an explosion in microbreweries in Newfoundland, and Crooked Feeder Brewing will be integral to establishing Western Newfoundland as a craft beer destination. Additionally, Cormack is a community in need of new and wonderful things to help create employment and tourist opportunities. The brewery and our future taproom will be will be two new opportunities that can breathe life into not only the tourist industry, but the community and region. We have our sights set high and we see no upper limit to the things we can achieve in Western Newfoundland.

So where are we?

We’ve set ourselves a lofty goal: begin producing great craft beers for the region by the end of October. While we initially underestimated the volume of work to achieve that goal, we have already passed the hurdle of environmental assessment and are well on our way with a revised end of year goal. This campaign will help provide initial funding to secure our pilot system which will allow us to fill the orders secured with the perks, put us into full production mode, and begin servicing the larger craft beer community.

So, buy some perks and get on board, become a founding member and together we can knock this project out of the park!

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, we know money can be tight, but you can still support us in a very important way. Share this campaign with any and all off of your friends and acquaintances; tell them you believe in our project and to buy one of our awesome perks! Every dollar we raise will help move this project forward in Western Newfoundland. You can share straight from here on Indigogo! So please SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!

If you need clarification on any of the perks, feel free to contact us through our Facebook page and we will be happy to help!
story_txt: Crooked Feeder Brewing who we are and why we are here!Nestled near the foothills of the Long Range Mountains, in the heart of the farming and logging community of Cormack, Crooked Feeder Brewing is establishing itself in the breadbasket of Western Newfoundland and Labrador. Cormack is a vibrant community that was settled by veterans just after the end of WWII, where weaponry was traded for farm tools.  The brewery is located on the former family saw-mill of co-owner Robert Sutton. The mill was the family business for 25 years, before the downtrend in the lumber market forced it to cease operations. Newfoundlanders and Labradorians are known for being entrenched in tradition, but also notoriously hearty in the face of adversity. It is with this spirit that Crooked Feeder Brewing wants to contribute to the history of the region and breathe new life into the property.Our focus is to create an uncomplicated and enjoyable craft beer of the highest quality; whether you’re a casual beer dilettante who enjoys a traditional blend or a craft beer aficionado who appreciates a hop infused finish, Crooked Feeder has a brew to excite your palate . story:
What is So Simple?

"Everything must be made as simple as possible, but not simpler."           - Albert Einstein

So Simple is a passion for little moments and a celebration of local harvests. Recall eating shave ice on hot summer days with friends: sweet syrup coating spoonfuls of snow. Maybe sharing a bite of your cone for a taste of theirs before slurping the last bit of sweet juice at the end. So Simple is making this better with made-from-scratch syrups in unique local flavors like Vanilla Ginger Pear, Black and Blue Berry, Fuzzy Peach, Tart Rhubarb, and our signature, Purple Basil Lemonade.

So Simple Shave Ice will begin as a mobile kiosk to serve shave ice at private functions, parties, and pop-up appearances. We also will attend local street festivals in Portland, OR like Last Thursdays on Alberta and the Oregon Berry Festival. Eventually the dream is to open stationary carts in Portland and Bend and become summer staples for icy treats. 

So Simple Shave Ice represents the social heart and inclusiveness of people in Portland, Oregon. It's said that nothing here is so urgent it can't wait for a bridge. We believe is nothing is so urgent that we can't enjoy a simple treat and make a connection.

Why?

Since I was young starting a business was something I wanted to do. No time beats the present. When I came back to my hometown of Portland I found an opportunity to coordinate events for a rapidly growing ice cream company. I was hooked on making people smile at special occasions and events. A treat can be tasty, but you remember the smile that handed it to you most. Portland is a vibrant city with a hunger for small businesses that go beyond the product to connect with people and the environment. So Simple will do just that.

Over this particularly hot summer I created syrups from an over-abundance of amazing produce from local farms and markets. I let creativity take over with flavors I personally hadn't tasted yet. Though they made excellent sodas and brightened up my waffles, shave ice always came to mind. 

This simple treat can bring everyone together, even friends who often have to miss out on a fun times because of food restrictions like dairy and gluten. 

I can serve this to ALL of my friends and family. 

Not only do I intend to make delicious syrups and serve them with a genuine interest in my customers; I intend to create a company with a positive impact. I want to be a part of Portland's culinary scene, spend time getting to know farmers and others with creative passions, and bring something to the table. Then take it as far as it can go, where no shave ice has gone before.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, I can make this dream a reality. Now here is what your backing is going to cover:

> A shave ice machine. A manual machine would provide mobility (no electricity needed), precise control of the size of the shave and a fun, vintage feel at parties.

>A health permit.

>Materials to build a mobile kiosk. The technical design is inspired by what I’ve worked with in the past with a unique look and feel. While we’re still figuring out where to build, we are not short on talented builders in our network for our awesome and simple design!

>Supplies, ingredients and commissary kitchen time to make awesome syrups for you!

Oh yeah... and to make a ton of awesome perks including all pledges on a "Forever Thanks" page on our website and a “We Did It Thanks To You!” party at the end of the campaign which all backers will be invited to! It would be an honor to do this for you as you make this reaching this goal a reality. Take a look at what else we’re offering next to the video and pledge for your favorite before they’re all gone!

If we don't reach the our goal, the money will first be put to the shave ice machine. This is the most expensive piece starting between $900 and $1500, but will immediately allow us throw some shave ice parties and make better and better syrups. Let's face it, at the end of the day it's about how much fun we've had and what we'll create the next day.

If we surpass the goal we will throw as many R&D parties as possible and invite all backers to taste and enjoy before booking for Summer! Just think...Mulled Sangria, Cranberry Currant, and Mimosa over snow to bring in the new year. The sky is the limit.

Risks & Challenges

One challenge (one we look forward to) is building both a beautiful and functional kiosk ready for any small event that comes our way in Summer 2016. Another challenge will be finding commissary kitchen space before we can actually sell.

I'm confident we can meet these challenges. Portland is abundant in commissary kitchen space. My experience setting up to serve at large, food-centered events gives me the knowledge of how to cater and what is required of a mobile service. 

We have an incredible network of builders and craftsmen friends who have offered their skills to build our kiosk. Along with the support of our community, friends and family I believe we can overcome these challenges to make this dream happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share Share Share! 
Share this campaign! You can follow our Facebook page for updates, take a look at our website, and best of all, tell people about So Simple Shave Ice. 
Know someone throwing a birthday or barbecue next summer in Portland? Recommend they check us out.
Planning the next office party? Consider a perk and look like a boss as everyone enjoys this delicious treat we've made for them. 
Do you have a backyard? Perfect! Schedule your Party Perk and invite people over.
Getting married next summer or know someone who is? Help us reach our goal and we would not only guarantee amazing service to you and your guests but also a custom flavor just for your event! 
We won't let you down.

story:
College Snack Attack is a college care package service that delivers snack filled boxes to college students monthly. Our snack boxes provide a variety of new, traditional and international snacks. College Snack Attack boxes are affordable, easy to order and the perfect way to support and encourage a college student with monthly gift reminders to let them know you are thinking about them. 

College Snack Attack goal is to provide an easy-to-use service. Parents simply go to our website; choose the type of snack box, size and plan; and they’re done! No more wasting time hunting for snacks, boxing, and shipping to your student. We do the hard work so the students will always have great tasting snacks on hand. Subscribe to our service the process takes about 10 minutes and you can cancel at any time!

What do "YOU" do when you send your college student money for snacks and they buy everything but food? 

The Idea for College Snack Attack was born during my son’s first year away at school. I would send him money for snacks, but he would sometimes use the money for other reasons and still be in need of snacks. I needed a way to ensure that the money I was sending was being used as it was intended. How could I eliminate the hassle of searching for several snack items, packing and shipping a package every month? I needed something easy yet creative--more than a one-time chip and cookie option or the repetitive bulk buy of snacks. I wanted something that would arrive regularly but with a surprise element paired with encouraging words from the parents. After speaking with several parents and assessing their feedback, I knew College Snack Attack was the answer to our problems. College Snack Attack provides its subscribers with a curated box each month featuring new, traditional and international snacks. The excitement is in the mystery of what your student will receive next!

 

If you’re looking for the best snacks, we’ve got it!

Each box is packed with a variety of indulging sweet, sour, salty, crunchy and savory snacks delivered to the student’s dorm mailbox each month. Snacks include new, traditional, and a little bit of flavor from around the world.

OUR SNACK BOXES COME IN TWO DIFFERENT SIZES: 

The Original: 20-25 Snacks 

The Deluxe: 35-40 Snacks

WE OFFER 4 STYLES OF SNACK BOXES

 

PLANS 

MONTHLY PLAN- Subscribe month to month (up to 8 Boxes per year)

SEMESTER PLAN- Subscribe by the semester (4 Boxes per semester)

SCHOOL YEAR PLAN- Subscribe by the year (8 Boxes per year)

The fun is in the mystery of what your student will be receiving next. Each month there is something different!

FLAVORS FROM AROUND THE WORLD 

Each box will contain 2-4 International snacks. This is the perfect opportunity to taste the world through these fun and yummy snacks. You will receive information on the featured international snacks in your box.

College Snack Attack is the perfect gift and easy to purchase. College Students love receiving gifts especially the ones that feel like the comfort of home. Each box is thoughtfully curated with snacks handpicked by our ambassadors and conveniently arrives at your student’s dorm. Every month is designed to give your student a different snacking experience.

Receiving a College Snack Attack box can put a smile on your student's face and make a stressful time easier.  

College Snack Attack guarantee freshness with promises to deliver great tasting snacks.

Did we mention shipping is free?

Subscribe to College Snack Attack:

Choose between the Original Box or Deluxe Box

Select Subscription Plan from Monthly, Semester or School Year 

We Pack and Ship Your Box:

 Every month College Snack Attack will ship a snack box to your student's door.

Students Enjoy The Snacks: 

Students will open, explore and enjoy delicious snacks! 

ENCOURAGE THEM!

Send a note of encouragement in your snack box 

Sending a special message to your college student wishing them luck on their finals or to let them know you are thinking about them is a great way to keep them motivated! 

FUNDING GOALS 

As with any start-up, we face a number of challenges in order to meet our goals. We have, however, worked tirelessly to ensure a clear path to the target ahead of us.  

When we reach funding for our base goal, we can start the official launch and production for College Snack Attack. Our goal for funding includes but not limited to:

• Products and Inventory 

• Completion of Website Development 

• Marketing Materials

• Set up operations for fulfillment and distribution

• Purchase Computer Software to manage customer accounts and orders  

 • Shipping cost

As a backer, you will receive exclusive rewards and get some behind-the-scenes of our growth and progress.

GIVING BACK

Fighting Student Hunger

College Snack Attack will be joining the fight against food insecurity on college campuses. Food Insecurity is the lack of reliable access to sufficient quantities of affordable, nutritious food and has increasingly become an issue on college and university campuses across the country, potentially undermining the educational success of thousands of students.

Food insecurity on college campuses has a negative impact on the educational experience. It’s hard to concentrate in class or to focus on your studies when you’re hungry or worrying about financial obstacles. Whether due to nutritional deficits or the stress and distraction of dealing with financial hardship, food insecurity can compromise students’ ability to perform well in their classes. In extreme cases, food insecurity can force students to take time off from school or discontinue their education entirely.

 48% of students experienced food insecurity 

 22% of students experienced extreme food insecurity 

 44% were forced to cut back on the size of a meal or skip a meal entirely due to lack of money

 35% were hungry but didn't eat due to lack of money for food 

 20% skipped eating for an entire day due to lack of money for food

 15% said they lost weight because they couldn't afford to eat   

The more buzz that is generated about College Snack Attack the further we can spread our message about alleviating food insecurity! So please, share this campaign with friends, family, and anyone else you feel would appreciate our mission.

RISKS & CHALLENGES 

Any project has its risks—especially one that requires a large volume of upfront inventory. The biggest challenge we foresee in the process is obtaining enough capital for inventory, supplies, and marketing. We understand that in order for the company to be successful we have to get the word out and build up a community of subscribers. But, we are confident that with our mission and your support, we will overcome this challenge.

We are currently lining up our packaging and shipping logistics and fine tuning our website to make sure the subscription experience is user-friendly and manageable. We have already begun curating items for our first boxes and signing on with new vendors and distributors.

With over 15 years of entrepreneurial experience, we are confident that we will overcome any challenges that may occur. 

Once the funding goal is reached we can move forward with the completion of the project to ensure a timely delivery of our first shipment

Thank you for considering backing this project!

Follow us on Facebook and Instagram and share our story on your timelines.

It’s hard to concentrate in class or to focus on your studies when you’re hungry or worrying about financial obstacles. Whether due to nutritional deficits or the stress and distraction of dealing with financial hardship, food insecurity can compromise students’ ability to perform well in their classes. In extreme cases, food insecurity can force students to take time off from school or discontinue their education entirely. 48% of students experienced food insecurity  22% of students experienced extreme food insecurity  44% were forced to cut back on the size of a meal or skip a meal entirely due to lack of money 35% were hungry but didn't eat due to lack of money for food  20% skipped eating for an entire day due to lack of money for food 15% said they lost weight because they couldn't afford to eat   The more buzz that is generated about College Snack Attack the further we can spread our message about alleviating food insecurity! So please, share this campaign with friends, family, and anyone else you feel would appreciate our mission.RISKS & CHALLENGES Any project has its risks—especially one that requires a large volume of upfront inventory. The biggest challenge we foresee in the process is obtaining enough capital for inventory, supplies, and marketing. We understand that in order for the company to be successful we have to get the word out and build up a community of subscribers. But, we are confident that with our mission and your support, we will overcome this challenge.We are currently lining up our packaging and shipping logistics and fine tuning our website to make sure the subscription experience is user-friendly and manageable. We have already begun curating items for our first boxes and signing on with new vendors and distributors.With over 15 years of entrepreneurial experience, we are confident that we will overcome any challenges that may occur. Once the funding goal is reached we can move forward with the completion of the project to ensure a timely delivery of our first shipmentThank you for considering backing this project!Follow us on Facebook and Instagram and share our story on your timelines.

story:
Our Story

Hey Everyone! We're a trio of mother and twin daughters; Ilse, Juliana, and Jaqueline. We currently own the first Brazilian Food Truck in Los Angeles, The Ta Bom Truck which has been around since 2010. We pride in bringing unique and savory flavors of Brazil to our hometown. We'd love to expand our reach and make it so that everyone can get a little taste of Brazil. With your help, we'll be able to buy the needed equipment and ingredients!! 


What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of how your contributions will help us:
$5,000 Hotmixer and shipping cost
$3,000 Upgrading our website
$2,000 Ingredients and materials needed to fulfill current/future orders
Each of our brigadeiro spreads are handmade with tender love and care. What is brigadeiro? It's a Brazilian delicacy made of milk, cocoa, and butter. We care about the product we represent and you'll love it so much, you'll finish it in one day!! This spread is perfect for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Put it on your toast in the morning, or top your ice cream for dessert at night. Make sure to spread the love and get one for each of your family members!! 

Risks & Challenges

Our company was originally started for our mom when she was laid off in 2009. She tried everything to get another job but wasn't successful. My sister and I put our money together and started the Food Truck. Since then, we've had our ups and downs but have always managed to stick together and stay positive. Back in 2012, we saved $7,000 to buy needed equipment but it was stolen from our house. It was heart breaking but it didn't stop us. We're determined to spread the love and joy through our family's chocolate recipe. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to read about us and our mission. We understand that not everyone can make a monetary contribution but we'd love it if you could spread our message. Tell your family, everyone at work, and your neighbors!! Make sure to share it on facebook, twitter, and instagram :) Spread the love!!

story:
Enrich. Empower. Elevate.

 

Two friends meet up to eat dinner found themselves talking about family, life, and what the future holds. As they’re breaking bread to dig into homemade hummus made by a Filipino sous chef in a Mediterranean eatery, their discussion goes on a tangent into the refugee crisis. A somber topic and discussion, turned into one of their most fulfilling projects of their lives. The Displaced Kitchens.

Displaced Kitchens was created by KOMEEDA to provide an all-inclusive beneficial campaign to shed light on the refugee crisis by giving people access to refugee stories and perspectives, meanwhile humanizing the crisis that is for many U.S. citizens an abstract issue portrayed in the news. Most importantly, the founders seek to support recently resettled refugees through community empowerment and financial assistance.

 

 

Recognized by...

 

This cookbook was inspired by the Displaced Kitchens dining experience, a series of bedouin-style dinners cooked by recently resettled refugees, whom have transformed themselves into "Chefugees". These unique dining experiences are hosted by Komeeda since March 2017. After the Trump administration’s decision to halt admission of refugees from seven nations, Jabber Al-Bihani and his close friend and business partner, Nasser Jab, saw this order as an attack on the most vulnerable people in the world and took part to counteract fear and ignorance with hope and knowledge. Together, they formed Displaced Kitchens in order to shift the refugee narrative over authentic and gratifying dinners.

Chefugee, Lutfi M. sharing his refugee story with the "Kommunity". Photo Credit: Sara Aridi

 

#refugeeswelcome

 

The Displaced Kitchens Cookbook will feature recipes and stories from refugee chefs who have been displaced by political conflict. Far from their native homeland, Chefugees share the enduring recipes that remind them of more peaceful times. Their stories of upheaval and survival provide the substance that makes cooking and eating the life-affirming act that it is that we all share. This cookbook will also illuminates the realities of the regional conflicts that our Chefugees fled from, and will outline the way food sources are affected in each area. In the Displaced Kitchens cookbook, we celebrate the communal nature of cooking and eating, and recognizing the rarely-discussed generative element of conflict: connecting the journey of displacement and cuisines that may have been lost in translation back into conversations —such as Middle-Eastern and Latin American food.

 

 

The book will feature two recipes per Chef from various countries experiencing conflict which includes: Syria, Yemen, Libya, Ukraine, Sudan, Venezuela, Iraq, Burma/Myanmar, the Democratic Republic of Congo, and Afghanistan. Your support of this cookbook will help Enrich, Empower, and Elevate our contributing refugees to establish themselves in their new home, America.

 

 

Your Support

To date, with over forty (50) dinners attended by approximately 1,000 socially curious New York City foodies, our Chefugees have cooked and served authentically curated menus from Syria, Ukraine, Congo, and Yemen. Each and every dinner has left a lasting impression for the soul, and brought our attendees closer to understanding our Chefugee hosts' journey to America. In our current eco-system, we have worked with a diverse Kommunity of refugees and we are ready to make this cookbook the narrative-shifting tool that we will offer to enrich people’s lives, through food and shared human life experiences.

Refugee host Lutfi, cooking up the lamb for his main dish, Makloubeh. Photo Credit: Luc Kordas / Metro NY

 

In order to make this cookbook a physical reality, our $35,000 goal be broken down based on the following...

Beautiful and meaningful creations requires a knowledgeable, experienced, and passionate team and we are aligning ourselves with some of New York City's finest minds to help us make a difference through this cookbook and we need your help!

If we are to surpass our set goal, we have plans to our expand our impact! How?

  • Adding more Chefugee stories and recipes
  • Growing our Chefugee team and supporting more recently resettled refugees
  • Allocating more funds to refugee resettlement organizations
  • Donating Displaced Kitchens cookbooks to non-profit culinary facilities and schools

 

 

We have a commercial kitchen awaiting our project, Chefugees from Syria, Ukraine, Venezuela, Zimbabwe, and other beautiful places affected by conflict, ready to cook along with our passionate team; this book is destined to make the impact we envision it making across the nation! The ultimate ingredient that will bring this book to the tables and kitchens of hundreds, if not thousands of people around the world is YOU. Your support will bring us closer together to Enrich, Empower, and Elevate our Chefugees. It will provide a foundation for us to amplify the voice of the voiceless, who simply want to share their human spirit, give back to the world, feel welcomed by their new community, and most importantly shift the perspective of today’s refugee crisis.

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can help us by sharing this campaign with compassionate friends, family members, and colleagues. The mere act of sharing on social media makes a vast difference. The Indiegogo sharing tools make it easy to spread the word about our promise to refugees. In turn, your worldview, as well as your palette will be enriched with this deeeeeelicious cookbook!

Here are some of the gifts we will be sharing with our supporters! 

 

Your Support Amplified! 

As we work more and more with refugees & asylum seekers, we are identifying the needs that are essential to getting them integrated into their new life here in America. Our “Kommunity” has been a resource in itself, delivering close to immediate results to help our refugee friends with empowering opportunities. However, we are also aware that this is not a readily available resource to many who need it. We are working on identifying a resource and/or align with an organization to train, inform, and provide streamlined and direct access to educational resources which include but are not limited to vocational training, education on western society, and societal integration assistance.

10% of the proceeds from this campaign will go towards an initiative or organization that aligns with our mission. We will announce developments on that initiative in the coming weeks. 

 

The Impact

Our cookbook will be as delicious-looking as the recipes it contains. With your help, we can design an art object that contains vibrant photos of culinary delights alongside portraits of our heroic Chefugees. You will want to display it on your coffee table or shelf when you are not bent over its pages, bringing one of the recipes to life. Through this cookbook our chefs’ stories and the range of spices that flavor them (from the most bitter to the sweetest) will amount to an immersive, thought-provoking (and, hopefully, action-provoking) experience for you and other readers. This is a written project that marks an immensely important moment in global history as it looks towards and promotes solutions and a peaceful, compassionate conclusion to human struggles by celebrating the most fundamental experience we share: cooking and eating. The recipes and testimonies shine a light on the narrative of the regional crises in the countries it highlights and brings people into those stories in the most tangible, sensory, and embodied way.

Quest Love (best known as a member of The Roots and the House Bassist on the Jimmy Fallon show) perfectly described our mission when he wrote about Displaced Dinners on his popular blog, Quest Loves Food after attending a dinner:

 


 

The Team

 

Born and raised in Brooklyn, New York, the son to Yemeni immigrants, Jabber Al-Bihani is the co-founder of Komeeda, a marketplace for foodies, chefs, and restaurants to come together for meaningful and elaborate food experiences. He aims to redefine the culture of food using technology build a “Kommunity” who come together to experience food in a unique social way with a high level of substance. During an emergency family trip to Yemen in May of 2016, he experienced the life of a Yemeni citizen in a war zone for a mere week, and returned home to the United States forever changed and altered. The lack of infrastructure, stability, resources, and—most evidently—the absence of hope, struck him in contrast to the fruitful country he remembered from when he lived there for an entire year as a kid.

Owner of Mazeish, Nasser Jaber moved to New York City from Palestine when he was 17 years old. After completing his degree in Finance & Economics, he began working in the food business, eventually launching Mazeish, a Mediterranean-Latino restaurant on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Nasser has volunteered to help refugees since 2008, mostly working with nonprofits that operate in the refugee camps in Lebanon. He has also written about technological advancements and food.

Adam Yeremian is a filmmaker, producer, and investor whose projects have received awards at major film festivals and have been distributed internationally. ProMedia (a full service production and post production company), is thrilled to be part of this important and influential moment in history. As an American with Armenian roots, Adam has experienced first hand the result of what happens to a culture when other forces attempt to systematically displace a people . He believes in bringing the human element to the forefront of political controversy and that, regardless of one’s political views, any human who wants to live peacefully, productively and neighborly lives should have the right to do so.

 

Thank You For Your Support!

 

What Is Komeeda?

FUN EATING EXPERIENCES!  A "Kommunity" of chefs, restaurants, foodies, influencers, and organizations who come together to experience food differently. We pride ourselves in giving people access to new tastes, new stories, and new relationships through #eatKomeeda  brunches, dinners, tastings, and culinary competitions. Our mission is to empower the culinary world to share their stories and mouthwatering food with foodies near and far!
