story:
GIVING FORWARD

The heart of my company is to make a difference in people’s lives. There is no company without this aspect. As my son Logan says, “It’s not just a cookie company. It’s a love company.” It’s a social enterprise.

People have taken a chance on me and have been there to catch me. In essence, I want to give back and pay it forward- in gratitude- to all of those who have been a contribution to me.

Shortly after coming to Los Angeles I came across the Los Angeles Downtown Women’s Center (DWC) and connected immediately to their mission and what they are creating for women. (Yes, I am Vancouver base launching this in LA). DWC Mission: The mission of the Downtown Women's Center is to provide permanent supportive housing and a safe and healthy community fostering dignity, respect, and personal stability, and to advocate ending homelessness for women.www.downtownwomenscentre.org

We will be partnering with the Downtown Los Angeles Women’s Centre to support their mission by creating employment opportunities and implementing a boxing class at the center. We are developing our vision to provide these women with an opportunity to integrate Nookie’s mission into their lives within the support of community and mentorship.

A few months ago, I started volunteering at the center and had the opportunity to attend their fundraising gala. The more involved I have become with the center, the more blown away with the beauty of the people that run the organization, the women who utilize the center, and with what the DWC is creating for women.

With this company, we have an opportunity to get women off the streets and get their families back. We have an opportunity to take a chance on women who have the possibility to move on and become powerful forces in their communities and in the world.

MY WHY

Saturday mornings growing up I would wake to the smell of my mom’s cookies. The aroma, her laughter, and her heavy feet filled the house. These are some of my fondest memories that are forever etched in my mind. Then there is the lingering image of her in a white/green 80’s thong aerobic outfit that she rocked and wore everywhere – grocery shopping, the bank, walking the dog. Everywhere. Cookies, laughter and the white and green leotard. That’s how I remember her.

Yet this beautiful, warm and fuzzy cookie aroma had another side for me. Complete irritation. She made these cookies every weekend and I couldn’t eat them. Not because I was trying to be heathy. Not because I was on some kind of vegan, gluten-free, paleo, grain-free or keto diet. Quite the opposite. I was a ballet dancer and I needed to maintain my 100-pound (or less) figure. So, I simply didn’t eat. How did I dance for hours on end without food? I pushed myself. And I was cranky. Ultimately I was starved real nutrition, yet I was running on fumes (or something like that…..).  People ask me if I have always had a passion for food. Nope. I couldn’t cook rice if my life depended on it.

Then one day, when I was 16, my parents sat me down and told me my mom was sick. Cancer. Pancreatic Cancer. No cure. Diagnosis: 3 months to live. Great. Well, this shook the world from under my feet and changed my life forever. So, I did what I knew. I shut down emotionally, starved myself and dove into my dance and my art. I spent the next year and a half watching my mother die. To be more explicit; watch a beautiful, fit, healthy, vibrant, wild on the inside redhead morph into this skeletal, lifeless, breathless shell of human being. Then she was gone. Just like that. Forever a void in my life.

 My mom left a journal. A 200-page typed out journey of her illness. She repeatedly declared her illness had a purpose- to change the trajectory of our lives. I would say that was an understatement. The impact of her life, illness and death has had a ripple effect in the world for so many people. After she passed I saw what I was doing to myself. Starving myself like a slow suicide. I saw I had a choice to live- something my mom didn’t have.  

So, I choose to start eating and creating a new healthy lifestyle. Now this was an undertaking to say the least. I still didn’t know how to cook rice and my body was confused because I was asking it to digest food. My tummy didn’t like me for a while but we worked it out over time. Patience was required, yet I was committed to a new life for myself and a life my mom would be proud of.

My now ex-husband was the first person to teach me to cook. I recall the confusion on his face when he went through the cupboards in my kitchen unable to find the salt and pepper. What do I need those for? I quipped.

Over time different people came into my life and introduced me to raw vegan food which had a profound impact on my health and energy. Food slowly evolved into a passion for me; a passion to feed and nourish the body and soul. I saw the powerful effect food had on the body and the choice it gives people for a disease-free body.

I suddenly saw a choice: you could choose health or illness with food. That concept literally blew my mind and I wanted everyone to have access to it. This is the crux for me: I want people to be empowered to make healthy choices and not have to potentially watch someone they love so deeply get sick and die. I want to give people an opportunity to choose a life without disease. And for me, it all comes down to a cookie. Yes, a cookie. My mom’s illness changed the trajectory of my life forever and it is because of her and her journey that I am pursuing my dream. There is this whole “living your life to its fullest” phenomenon that I love to share with people. In her journal she wrote about “living” if she could “do it all over again”. I mean really living and laughing (seriously, that laugh and those leotards) and to enjoy life. She talked of taking risks, saying the shit you want to say, taking care of yourself, expressing yourself, and of just being you. It was these powerful words she left behind that taught me to live differently and to live from the inside-out. It is these words that compel and inspire me to share this freedom with others.

I have a desire to create this company; a cookie company that gives people a choice in their health and well-being, and supports them in creating new rules for living and being a contribution to others.

https://www.instagram.com/melanielynnfox/

https://www.instagram.com/iwantnookie/

WHAT IS A NOOKIE COOKIE?

Nookie is a Raw, Vegan, Organic, Gluten-Free, Grain-Free, Paleo, Sprouted, Dehydrated, non-GMO, sweetened with whole foods and handmade with love, COOKIE.

Ingredients: cashews, almonds, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, coconut, goji berries, cacao nibs, dates, banana, ground vanilla bean, Himalayan salt.

Nookie is the marriage of food, art and sensuality ~ your Raw Beauty. We are breaking the taboos of what a food product should be. We are disrupting conventions as a company and as a way of living. We are uncompromising in who we are and our products.

 

WHY RAW?

The nuts are sprouted 8-10 hours (in water) which increases the nutrients and enzymes of the nuts and releases an aphla toxin that strains digestion inhibiting the body from absorbing the nutrients.

The cookies are then dehydrated rather than baked (10-12 hours). We dehydrate the cookies at no higher than 115 degrees so that it does not chemically alter the enzymes, nutrients and essential fatty acids of the nuts, which baking would do. The sprouting brings out the highest levels of the nutrients for your body to absorb, while dehydrating maintains optimum levels of nourishment.

 We have stripped the traditional cookie of all its fillers, sugars, preservatives and food-altering cooking processes. We have taken no compromises on the finest life-giving ingredients and most mindful preparation. Nookie is a cookie in its finest and most authentic form. Our goal is to have the best, most nutritious and tasty cookie possible. For us, nothing is more valuable than people’s health and well-being. 

 

I am inviting YOU to contribute to giving birth to a great company that makes a difference. I have a fantastic product that people love, the Nookie Cookie, interested retailers and customers. What I am looking for is seed money to cover some start-up expenses (cost of goods, legal fees, licensing, packaging) to move the company forward.

 

Thank you for being instrumental in the building of this social enterprise.

Love, Melanie xo 

NOW GO BUY SOME NOOKIE!!!

Follow us:

https://www.instagram.com/melanielynnfox/

https://www.instagram.com/iwantnookie/
story_txt: GIVING FORWARDThe heart of my company is to make a difference in people’s lives. There is no company without this aspect. As my son Logan says, “It’s not just a cookie company. It’s a love company.” It’s a social enterprise.People have taken a chance on me and have been there to catch me. In essence, I want to give back and pay it forward- in gratitude- to all of those who have been a contribution to me.Shortly after coming to Los Angeles I came across the Los Angeles Downtown Women’s Center (DWC) and connected immediately to their mission and what they are creating for women. (Yes, I am Vancouver base launching this in LA). DWC Mission: The mission of the Downtown Women's Center is to provide permanent supportive housing and a safe and healthy community fostering dignity, respect, and personal stability, and to advocate ending homelessness for women.www.downtownwomenscentre.orgWe will be partnering with the Downtown Los Angeles Women’s Centre to support their mission by creating employment opportunities and implementing a boxing class at the center. We are developing our vision to provide these women with an opportunity to integrate Nookie’s mission into their lives within the support of community and mentorship.A few months ago, I started volunteering at the center and had the opportunity to attend their fundraising gala. The more involved I have become with the center, the more blown away with the beauty of the people that run the organization, the women who utilize the center, and with what the DWC is creating for women.With this company, we have an opportunity to get women off the streets and get their families back. We have an opportunity to take a chance on women who have the possibility to move on and become powerful forces in their communities and in the world.MY WHYSaturday mornings growing up I would wake to the smell of my mom’s cookies. The aroma, her laughter, and her heavy feet filled the house. These are some of my fondest memories that are forever etched in my mind. Then there is the lingering image of her in a white/green 80’s thong aerobic outfit that she rocked and wore everywhere – grocery shopping, the bank, walking the dog. Everywhere. Cookies, laughter and the white and green leotard. That’s how I remember her.Yet this beautiful, warm and fuzzy cookie aroma had another side for me. Complete irritation. She made these cookies every weekend and I couldn’t eat them. Not because I was trying to be heathy. Not because I was on some kind of vegan, gluten-free, paleo, grain-free or keto diet. Quite the opposite. I was a ballet dancer and I needed to maintain my 100-pound (or less) figure. So, I simply didn’t eat. How did I dance for hours on end without food? I pushed myself. And I was cranky. Ultimately I was starved real nutrition, yet I was running on fumes (or something like that…..).  People ask me if I have always had a passion for food. Nope. I couldn’t cook rice if my life depended on it.Then one day, when I was 16, my parents sat me down and told me my mom was sick. Cancer. Pancreatic Cancer. No cure. Diagnosis: 3 months to live. Great. Well, this shook the world from under my feet and changed my life forever. So, I did what I knew. I shut down emotionally, starved myself and dove into my dance and my art. I spent the next year and a half watching my mother die. To be more explicit; watch a beautiful, fit, healthy, vibrant, wild on the inside redhead morph into this skeletal, lifeless, breathless shell of human being. Then she was gone. Just like that. Forever a void in my life. My mom left a journal. A 200-page typed out journey of her illness. She repeatedly declared her illness had a purpose- to change the trajectory of our lives. I would say that was an understatement. The impact of her life, illness and death has had a ripple effect in the world for so many people. After she passed I saw what I was doing to myself. Starving myself like a slow suicide. I saw I had a choice to live- something my mom didn’t have.  So, I choose to start eating and creating a new healthy lifestyle. Now this was an undertaking to say the least. I still didn’t know how to cook rice and my body was confused because I was asking it to digest food. My tummy didn’t like me for a while but we worked it out over time. Patience was required, yet I was committed to a new life for myself and a life my mom would be proud of.My now ex-husband was the first person to teach me to cook. I recall the confusion on his face when he went through the cupboards in my kitchen unable to find the salt and pepper. What do I need those for? I quipped.Over time different people came into my life and introduced me to raw vegan food which had a profound impact on my health and energy. Food slowly evolved into a passion for me; a passion to feed and nourish the body and soul. I saw the powerful effect food had on the body and the choice it gives people for a disease-free body.I suddenly saw a choice: you could choose health or illness with food. That concept literally blew my mind and I wanted everyone to have access to it. This is the crux for me: I want people to be empowered to make healthy choices and not have to potentially watch someone they love so deeply get sick and die. I want to give people an opportunity to choose a life without disease. And for me, it all comes down to a cookie. Yes, a cookie. My mom’s illness changed the trajectory of my life forever and it is because of her and her journey that I am pursuing my dream. There is this whole “living your life to its fullest” phenomenon that I love to share with people. In her journal she wrote about “living” if she could “do it all over again”. I mean really living and laughing (seriously, that laugh and those leotards) and to enjoy life. She talked of taking risks, saying the shit you want to say, taking care of yourself, expressing yourself, and of just being you. It was these powerful words she left behind that taught me to live differently and to live from the inside-out. It is these words that compel and inspire me to share this freedom with others.I have a desire to create this company; a cookie company that gives people a choice in their health and well-being, and supports them in creating new rules for living and being a contribution to others.https://www.instagram.com/melanielynnfox/https://www.instagram.com/iwantnookie/WHAT IS A NOOKIE COOKIE?Nookie is a Raw, Vegan, Organic, Gluten-Free, Grain-Free, Paleo, Sprouted, Dehydrated, non-GMO, sweetened with whole foods and handmade with love, COOKIE.Ingredients: cashews, almonds, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, coconut, goji berries, cacao nibs, dates, banana, ground vanilla bean, Himalayan salt.Nookie is the marriage of food, art and sensuality ~ your Raw Beauty. We are breaking the taboos of what a food product should be. We are disrupting conventions as a company and as a way of living. We are uncompromising in who we are and our products. WHY RAW? The nuts are sprouted 8-10 hours (in water) which increases the nutrients and enzymes of the nuts and releases an aphla toxin that strains digestion inhibiting the body from absorbing the nutrients.The cookies are then dehydrated rather than baked (10-12 hours). We dehydrate the cookies at no higher than 115 degrees so that it does not chemically alter the enzymes, nutrients and essential fatty acids of the nuts, which baking would do. The sprouting brings out the highest levels of the nutrients for your body to absorb, while dehydrating maintains optimum levels of nourishment. We have stripped the traditional cookie of all its fillers, sugars, preservatives and food-altering cooking processes. We have taken no compromises on the finest life-giving ingredients and most mindful preparation. Nookie is a cookie in its finest and most authentic form. Our goal is to have the best, most nutritious and tasty cookie possible. For us, nothing is more valuable than people’s health and well-being.  I am inviting YOU to contribute to giving birth to a great company that makes a difference. I have a fantastic product that people love, the Nookie Cookie, interested retailers and customers. What I am looking for is seed money to cover some start-up expenses (cost of goods, legal fees, licensing, packaging) to move the company forward. Thank you for being instrumental in the building of this social enterprise. Love, Melanie xo NOW GO BUY SOME NOOKIE!!!Follow us:https://www.instagram.com/melanielynnfox/https://www.instagram.com/iwantnookie/

story:
A Heritage of Great Cuisine

My name is Juan DiGiulio, and I am the chef and co-founder of Succotash--Feisty Southern Fusion. Please join me and my wife and partner, Sam, in launching our food truck in Durham, North Carolina!  I've been working in fine restaurants all over the South for 22 years, beginning with my own family's Italian Restaurant in Baton Rouge, La. back in 1987.  It has been my biggest dream to have my own establishment, specializing in unique and exceptional Southern Fusion Cuisine.  That dream is finally becoming a reality!!

Where it all Began

Having been born and raised in Louisiana with its rich culture of great food, libations and celebrations, it should come as no surprise that I also come from families who LIVE to cook and eat! And that’s no exaggeration!  My most vivid childhood memories are of crawfish boils, large family gatherings, and time spent at my family's restaurant, DiGiulio Brothers Italian Cafe in Baton Rouge, LA.  My parents and grandparents are all very passionate cooks and I learned early on through their various approaches to Soul Food, Cajun and Creole, Italian, Southern Barbeque and Southwestern Cuisine.  I also spent 4 years in Mexico, cooking and also studying for my MFA and the food I create today reflects all of these great traditions!

From Dream to Reality

Though I've always wanted to have my own Restaurant, coming up with the capital has not been easy. When my father passed away suddenly almost 4 years ago, I did not expect that loss to open the door to my future.  As a complete surprise to me, my Dad, who had retired to Mexico about 3 years prior, had taken out a modest life insurance policy and I was the beneficiary.  He and I had bounced around the idea of opening a restaurant together for several years so I knew right away that I would spend the money to start my food truck!  After struggling with the banks and insurance company for almost 3 years, I finally got the funds to get started!  And to top it all off, after lawyer's fees and fluctuating exchange rates and taxes, the amount of the settlement was almost exactly the amount I needed to purchase the Food Truck that I had my eyes on!  Written in the stars?  Destiny?  I don't know but I do know that my Dad was looking out for me! 

The Right Time and Place

Durham, NC, one of the most exciting, food-loving towns in the Southeast, is a restaurant owner's dream-town. Durham was recently named by Southern Living magazine as “The South’s Tastiest Town.” And as many fine trucks and restaurants as we have, there are none offering Succotash's unique fusion of Southern flavor. I'm lucky to be here! And, I've been fortunate to have worked in some of Durham’s best restaurants alongside James Beard award-winning chefs at Nana’s, with Chef Scott Howell, and at Vin Rouge, with Chef Matthew Kelly, among other fine Chefs. By delivering fine cuisine "on wheels," we will carry on the local tradition of great food by offering a feisty fusion of the best of the South. Opening a restaurant and having the opportunity to serve people the food that I love is the best way I know to give back to my cherished community.

The Home Stretch: How You Can Help

We've come so far--there's no turning back now! 

We got the food trailer, and just bought the truck to pull the trailer!

  • I have completely refurbished and upgraded the interior 
  • We've purchased all of the cooking equipment
  • We've gotten our point of sale system and computer
  • We've registered our business name, Succotash
  • We've finalized our Menu and are in the process of pricing it for sale
  • Logo design
  • I've joined the Raleigh-Durham Mobile Food Association, whose mission is to promote the mobile food business in the region

We are almost there,  but here's what's left:   

  • Truck wrap—getting the trailer repainted with the logo
  • Truck/trailer inspection and certification
  • Insurance and registration
  • Food storage containers, pots, pans and utensils
  • Commercial-grade meat smoker
  • Food inventory and start-up supplies
  • Commissary rental and fees (where the food is prepared and stored each day)
  • Marketing materials and a special Launch Party to get this truck rolling!

Your Support Makes the Difference!

First, thank you so much for reading and learning about our campaign. Your support is essential to our success. And to that end, we ask that you pledge whatever amount you can by hitting the “Back It” button. Also, for specific levels of contribution, you can receive some great perks, including food coupons, logo tee shirts and mugs, your name permanently tattooed on our truck as a supporter, and a print of Chef Juan’s original artwork!

Challenges

The biggest challenge for food truck vendors is the market. Luckily, we live in an area where new restaurants thrive and food trucks are in demand. There are food truck rodeos several times a year, neighborhoods and breweries that host trucks on a daily basis, food-truck friendly festivals, and a new permanent venue that serves drinks, hosts live performances, and hosts several food trucks seven days a week.

Our membership in the Raleigh Durham Mobile Food Association gives us access to the most popular food truck venues. We are also developing marketing materials to make our presence known. And we are starting to spread the word though Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute monetarily. But there are other ways you can help. You can help spread the word about our campaign using the "Share" tool on this site. Also, please consider posting our link on Facebook and through Twitter or Instagram. The more the word gets out, the sooner we reach our goal and get this restaurant rolling!

Our Sponsors

I want to send a special thank-you to our sponsors, local restaurant and club owners who have offered their time, advice, and support to our project:

  • Joe and Shinae Choi, Bo and Kyuri Kwon of Namu Restaurant
  • Matt Kelly of Mateo Tapas, Vin Rouge and St. James Seafood
  • Scott Howell and Brad Weddington of the Nana's Group 
  • Katrina Litsas of William's Gourmet Kitchen

Appreciation!

Thank you again for your time and attention! There are not enough words to express how much it means to us!

In addition, I'd like to thank my mom, Susan Head, for helping out so much with this campaign, all of her creative support, and just being so supportive generally and motivational in every possible way!  I love you SO MUCH and you have been indispensable in this process!

I want to thank my wife, Sam, without whom none of this would be happening.  I love you so much and cannot count the ways you have helped get this thing going, as well as getting me going every day with a smile on my face knowing that I have a life with you to look forward to!

Thank you to my Dad, Fred DiGiulio, for looking out for me and watching over me.  I know you're out there somewhere and I hope I'm making you proud!

And last but not least, I want to thank the team of creative and talented friends, family, co-workers and colleagues who have helped in immeasurable ways throughout this process:  Oren and Yael Wais of Soom Soom Truck, Joe Choi, his Wife Shinae, Bo Kwon, his wife Kyuri, Eunice Kim and the entire Namu Restaurant Family, creative geniuses Jesse Lis and Zach Wales, Robert Ferguson (N.D.), and all of the Chefs, Managers and Mentors who either knowingly or unknowingly helped me out in so many ways, big and small throughout this life-long  journey of becoming an accomplished chef.  Thank you all for helping me to know that the journey is the destination and that is the most important thing!  Much love to you all!!

story:
Creating Amazing Meals Starts with Amazing Ingredients. 

Did you know that Ohio has the best soybeans in the world for things like soy sauce and tofu? Like grapes for wine, the region has a major function in growing soybeans. The fertile soil and mild climate have created the best and highest protein soybeans in the country. over 50% of all Ohio soybeans are shipped to Japan, Taiwan and Korea for use in their products.

Our soy sauce is unlike regular store-bought brands. Our process starts with small batches, using only the best soybeans and wheat, and combines traditional fermentation processes to extract bold and rich flavors. A high-quality soy sauce should elevate your favorite dish. When tasted the umami, caramel, and salty flavors should linger in a pleasant way. Unlike bigger brands our freshness is key. Our products are made 2 hours from their source. This means no chemicals or extra shelf-stable preservatives. 

We're excited to share a couple of Indiegogo specific perks during this campaign. We are so lucky to not only have 1 but 2 high-quality ceramic brands in Ohio that will make this a unique promotion. We've partnered with Rookwood Pottery and Ohio Stoneware to create one-of-a-kind products to use and create at home.

Our Rookwood soy sauce carafe is designed as the perfect countertop piece. Rookwood has been a staple in the Cincinnati, Over-the-Rhine community since 1880. Its founder, Maria Longworth Storer was a pioneer for women and American pottery.

Ohio Stoneware, based in Zanesville Ohio is every fermenter's staple. From our first pickle brine to a large batch of miso Ohio Stoneware has been developing fermentation vessels since 2005. Its durable coatings and design will last for years. 

About Us

 

Hello, Our names are Sam Pellerito and Kendall Holmes and we are the creators of CinSoy Foods.  In 2019 Sam started this experiment in his basement as a way to slow down, reinvigorate his passion for building things, and explore a food culture he always admired. From the very first bottle of bitter cloudy soy sauce, our path has been filled with the joy of learning, cooking, and sharing with friends and family. 

Kendall joined CinSoy with a wealth of knowledge and a passion for experimentation. Together our goal is to develop unique products using local ingredients and share amazing ways to cook and eat at home. 

DRIVEN BY CURIOSITY 

Our desire to learn about culture through food has taught us a lot about the need for patience. We have come to realize that time cannot be controlled, and meaningful things take patience to create. The deepest flavors, like relationships, can only be achieved when you make time for them. 

ENJOYING WITH FRIENDS 

Creating new dishes made this experience even more fun. Taking insights from family meals and sushi taste testing, helped refine and improve our products while also creating new ones along the way. The effect this experience has on us added to the importance of food and community. 

GIVING BACK 

It's easy to forget how important our impact is on the world around us. CinSoy is dedicated to ensuring our food helps serve a purpose. We donate one school meal to a child in need for every item you purchase. By working with One Feeds Two, we help children without access to fresh meals be more focused on education and class participation. 

 

How Your Support Makes an Impact

All of the funding from this campaign will be used to purchase new machinery and help us build our space which will help support the growth of the business. This support will make a huge impact on our day-to-day.  We are so thankful and look forward to bringing you more amazing ingredients for your pantry!

 

Simple Goal: $20,000

- Industrial pressure cooker: Boiling soybeans takes time. A large batch pressure cooker will allow us to expand the size of each batch while also reducing wasted time.

Man it would be nice to goal $30,000

- Move into a bigger facility: Things like barrels and fermenters take up space and sit for a long time! Your donations would allow us to move into a bigger facility. 

Stretch goal $40,000

- Processing equipment: Items like filtration and packaging machines will reduce wasted time and increase consistency during production. 

 

What YOU Get!

 

Our incentives have been designed to share in our passion through experimentation and cooking new things. ALL perks will include a double school lunch donation from the start. 

For items requiring customization or sizing, we will reach out to get your criteria as the campaign comes to an end. 

A little goes a long way $10:

Give a couple of lunches. This donation will go a long way towards helping us get the little things. 

 

CinSoy Swag $30:

Donate some lunches and get some swag. You can choose from an apron or a shirt!

  • CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
  • Double School Lunch Donation

 

CinSoy Pick Three $50:

Get swag and choose 3 products from our lineup! As always we'll donate double lunches as well. 

  • CinSoy Sample Pack
  • CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
  • Double School Lunch Donation

 

CinSoy Maker Kit $65: Choose from our Make at Home Miso or Soy Sauce Kit (Comes with gallon jar and all the things to make a ferment at home). 

  • CinSoy Maker Kit
  • CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
  • Double School Lunch Donation

 

Custom Ohio Stoneware 2 Gallon Crock + Maker Kit $100: Like our Non-GMO soybeans Ohio Stoneware is a staple for creating fermented foods. Our custom crock will feature a custom CinSoy color and finish along with a lid and weights. Included is our extra-large maker kit for miso and soy sauce. 

  • Custom fermentation crock
  • Make at-home kit (Soy sauce or miso)
  • CinSoy Sample Pack
  • CinSoy Swag
  • Double school lunch donation

(Concept)

CinSoy X Rookwood Soy Sauce Cruet $300:

Made by Rookwood Pottery this Cruet holds 8 ounces of soy sauce. Your donation will include 750ml ounces of our soy sauce or tamari along with your choice of swag and a double school lunch donation. 

  • Custom Soy Sauce Cruet
  • 750ml of Soy Sauce or Tamari
  • CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
  • Double School Lunch Donation

 

 

                                         (This item is a concept and could be different upon completion)

 

CinSoy Fermented Dinner for 2 Including alcohol 400: (Must be 21)

An intimate dinner prepared by Hideki Harada of Kiki Cincinnati. Each course will include fermented ingredients made by CinSoy along with alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. (Must be 21)

  • CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
  • Fermented Foods Dinner
  • Double School Lunch Donation
  • CinSoy Sample Pack

 

Wholesale Starter Set $250 OR $500:

Buy into the CinSoy retail program with a simple package designed to get you started. This kit includes up to $500 of goods in our product line. Choices of CinSoy shirts or CinSoy aprons for your team (Up to 3).

 

CinSoy Fermenting Founders $1,000:

CinSoy Fermenting founders will help build the foundation of CinSoy. Your donation comes with perks but most importantly your donation will be inscribed in our founding fermenting barrel. This barrel will carry the legacy of each batch of soy sauce and build on every batch in the future. 

  • Name inscribed for eternity
  • Custom carafe
  • Pick 3 (Including 1/2 gallon)
  • CinSoy Sample Pack
  • CinSoy Swag
  • Double school lunch donation

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us make noise by sharing with friends and family!
  • Tag us on social media
  • Like and share our posts

Our soy sauce is unlike regular store-bought brands. Our process starts with small batches, using only the best soybeans and wheat, and combines traditional fermentation processes to extract bold and rich flavors. A high-quality soy sauce should elevate your favorite dish. When tasted the umami, caramel, and salty flavors should linger in a pleasant way. Unlike bigger brands our freshness is key. Our products are made 2 hours from their source. This means no chemicals or extra shelf-stable preservatives. 
We're excited to share a couple of Indiegogo specific perks during this campaign. We are so lucky to not only have 1 but 2 high-quality ceramic brands in Ohio that will make this a unique promotion. We've partnered with Rookwood Pottery and Ohio Stoneware to create one-of-a-kind products to use and create at home. 
Our Rookwood soy sauce carafe is designed as the perfect countertop piece. Rookwood has been a staple in the Cincinnati, Over-the-Rhine community since 1880. Its founder, Maria Longworth Storer was a pioneer for women and American pottery. 
Ohio Stoneware, based in Zanesville Ohio is every fermenter's staple. From our first pickle brine to a large batch of miso Ohio Stoneware has been developing fermentation vessels since 2005. Its durable coatings and design will last for years. 

About Us
 
Hello, Our names are Sam Pellerito and Kendall Holmes and we are the creators of CinSoy Foods.  In 2019 Sam started this experiment in his basement as a way to slow down, reinvigorate his passion for building things, and explore a food culture he always admired. From the very first bottle of bitter cloudy soy sauce, our path has been filled with the joy of learning, cooking, and sharing with friends and family. 
Kendall joined CinSoy with a wealth of knowledge and a passion for experimentation. Together our goal is to develop unique products using local ingredients and share amazing ways to cook and eat at home. 
DRIVEN BY CURIOSITY 
Our desire to learn about culture through food has taught us a lot about the need for patience. We have come to realize that time cannot be controlled, and meaningful things take patience to create. The deepest flavors, like relationships, can only be achieved when you make time for them. 
ENJOYING WITH FRIENDS 
Creating new dishes made this experience even more fun. Taking insights from family meals and sushi taste testing, helped refine and improve our products while also creating new ones along the way. The effect this experience has on us added to the importance of food and community. 
GIVING BACK 
It's easy to forget how important our impact is on the world around us. CinSoy is dedicated to ensuring our food helps serve a purpose. We donate one school meal to a child in need for every item you purchase. By working with One Feeds Two, we help children without access to fresh meals be more focused on education and class participation. 
 
How Your Support Makes an Impact
All of the funding from this campaign will be used to purchase new machinery and help us build our space which will help support the growth of the business. This support will make a huge impact on our day-to-day.  We are so thankful and look forward to bringing you more amazing ingredients for your pantry!
 
Simple Goal: $20,000
- Industrial pressure cooker: Boiling soybeans takes time. A large batch pressure cooker will allow us to expand the size of each batch while also reducing wasted time.
Man it would be nice to goal $30,000
- Move into a bigger facility: Things like barrels and fermenters take up space and sit for a long time! Your donations would allow us to move into a bigger facility. 
Stretch goal $40,000
- Processing equipment: Items like filtration and packaging machines will reduce wasted time and increase consistency during production. 
 
What YOU Get!
 
Our incentives have been designed to share in our passion through experimentation and cooking new things. ALL perks will include a double school lunch donation from the start. 
For items requiring customization or sizing, we will reach out to get your criteria as the campaign comes to an end. 
A little goes a long way $10:
Give a couple of lunches. This donation will go a long way towards helping us get the little things. 
 
CinSoy Swag $30:
Donate some lunches and get some swag. You can choose from an apron or a shirt!

CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
Double School Lunch Donation

 
CinSoy Pick Three $50:
Get swag and choose 3 products from our lineup! As always we'll donate double lunches as well. 

CinSoy Sample Pack
CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
Double School Lunch Donation

 
CinSoy Maker Kit $65: Choose from our Make at Home Miso or Soy Sauce Kit (Comes with gallon jar and all the things to make a ferment at home). 

CinSoy Maker Kit
CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
Double School Lunch Donation

 
Custom Ohio Stoneware 2 Gallon Crock + Maker Kit $100: Like our Non-GMO soybeans Ohio Stoneware is a staple for creating fermented foods. Our custom crock will feature a custom CinSoy color and finish along with a lid and weights. Included is our extra-large maker kit for miso and soy sauce. 

Custom fermentation crock
Make at-home kit (Soy sauce or miso)
CinSoy Sample Pack
CinSoy Swag
Double school lunch donation


(Concept)
CinSoy X Rookwood Soy Sauce Cruet $300:
Made by Rookwood Pottery this Cruet holds 8 ounces of soy sauce. Your donation will include 750ml ounces of our soy sauce or tamari along with your choice of swag and a double school lunch donation. 

Custom Soy Sauce Cruet
750ml of Soy Sauce or Tamari
CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
Double School Lunch Donation

 
 

                                         (This item is a concept and could be different upon completion)
 
CinSoy Fermented Dinner for 2 Including alcohol 400: (Must be 21)
An intimate dinner prepared by Hideki Harada of Kiki Cincinnati. Each course will include fermented ingredients made by CinSoy along with alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. (Must be 21)

CinSoy T-shirt or Apron
Fermented Foods Dinner
Double School Lunch Donation
CinSoy Sample Pack

 
Wholesale Starter Set $250 OR $500:
Buy into the CinSoy retail program with a simple package designed to get you started. This kit includes up to $500 of goods in our product line. Choices of CinSoy shirts or CinSoy aprons for your team (Up to 3).
 
CinSoy Fermenting Founders $1,000:
CinSoy Fermenting founders will help build the foundation of CinSoy. Your donation comes with perks but most importantly your donation will be inscribed in our founding fermenting barrel. This barrel will carry the legacy of each batch of soy sauce and build on every batch in the future. 

Name inscribed for eternity
Custom carafe
Pick 3 (Including 1/2 gallon)
CinSoy Sample Pack
CinSoy Swag
Double school lunch donation

 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Help us make noise by sharing with friends and family!
Tag us on social media
Like and share our posts

story:
Lincoln has slowly been growing for a few years without any outsourced funding or grants but we have hit a wall and now need a boost.   We want a liquor license and for that, we need a washroom.  We can make that a reality but we need the funds for this renovation. We are hoping you will donate and in return we have a few perks for that contribution. Its because of people like you we will be able to expand our labor of love.

Washrooms are the most expensive construction. In addition to building one accessible washroom we must also upgrade the existing and construct flooring and ramps for access. Permits, drawings and inspections are also in what we have budgeted for.

We are passionate about Lincoln Street Eatery because we feel it is a unique outdoor dining space in the middle of a downtown core . The unique shipping container kitchen and courtyard has been able to host a variety of different events such as our famous Celebrity Hotdog Nights, small parties and The Lincoln Mall free for any local vendor. We will be able to continue with these in the future with the inclusion of the washroom facilities.

Even the smallest contribution can make a difference. If 999 people donated $16.01 then we meet our goal. We know not everyone has the financial capacity to contribute but even if you just share our campaign it would be a great assist.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Khalfani King. I am a local Foodie inspired by organizing The FXBG Sandwich Invitational , Sandwich Week and Burger Week to create consistent food promotions for the community.This campaign is only the beginning of many big things. My short term goal is to create consistent programs that spotlight food in our region and my long term goal is host national food festivals int he Fredericksburg, Virginia region.
  • Your support will be rewarded with half price passports, gift certificates and products from local restaurants.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $20 donations to raise funds for marketing this event.
  • Early Birds will get gift certificates and goodies. Everyone that donates at least $20 will receive half price passports with all the perks of full price passports.

story:
Who We Are

The Loch Coffee Company was established in 2016 in Center City Midland, Michigan. Our mission is to create a safe, inclusive space for anyone and everyone, while also providing the best damn coffee we can make.

Our first location quickly became a local favorite and was featured in several magazines, including Great Lakes Bay, Driftless, and Barista Magazine.

Our establishment has gained so much attention and praise, our seats are frequently full, and it makes us sad to see guests walk out and try to figure out what to do instead.

Photo credit: Jessica Sturgeon

What We're Working On, and How You Can Help

We're in the process of opening a second, bigger location downtown, but it's going to be very expensive.

We're looking to raise money for our equipment and our facility. The 35k goal only covers half of our expenses, so we will be using our own money along with contributions to cover everything

When you contribute to our project, you're helping us get:

  • Better equipment: espresso machine, grinders, refrigerators, waffle irons, etc.
  • A better facility: plumbing, electrical, floors, bathrooms, etc.
  • A better atmosphere: lighting, decor, speakers, etc.

If we do not meet our goal of $35,000, we will still use contributions for the new shop, we will just have to prioritize certain items; we may have to settle without a piece of equipment for now, and buy it later.

Why We're Excited, and Why You Should Be Excited Too

Our second location will be bigger than our current location, and since it's downtown, we will have the opportunity for:

  • Longer Hours: Our plan is to be open 6am - 9pm Mon - Sat, and 9am - 6pm Sun.
  • More Food, All Day: we have a variety of artisan toast, salads, sandwiches, baked goods, and waffles already planned for the new location. No time restrictions.
  • Faster Food: We have a tons of new recipes and ideas for quick, amazing takeaway options for food in case you're in a hurry.
  • More Tea: We're continuing to use Rishi as our main supplier for tea, but introducing a secondary supplier out of Edinburgh, Scotland; Pekoe Tea, which will only be available downtown.
  • More Beverages: We'll be introducing a variety of artisan smoothies and blended drinks.
  • A Different Atmosphere: still The Loch you know and love, but with its own unique personality. 

Why We're a Little Nervous

When we first opened in 2016, we had a completely bare-bones, cold atmosphere. We spent all of our money on buying the building, repairs, and equipment, while putting the little that we had left into our decor. It left us feeling a little disappointed with our image. Over the course of two years, the shop is finally looking the way it should. This time around, we want to open our doors to a beautiful new cafe on day one.

Again, if we don't make our goal, this will still work, it just means we will have to make sacrifices.

Example:

  • $5,000 - okay espresso machine, okay grinders, no refrigerated display case (which means no takeaway sandwiches or salads, limited baked goods), few refrigerators (higher risk of running out of product), cheap tables and chairs, bare-bones decor. This really wouldn't get us far.
  • $10,000 - okay espresso machine, okay grinders, refrigerated display case, few refrigerators, cheap tables and chairs, okay decor. We can work with this.
  • $20,000 - good espresso machine, great grinders, refrigerated display case, few refrigerators, okay decor. This would get us all of the necessary equipment.
  • $25,000 - great espresso machine, great grinders, refrigerated display case, few refrigerators, nice tables and chairs, better decor. This would get us all of the necessary equipment, and add a bit more to our decor.
  • $35,000 - great espresso machine, great grinders, refrigerated display case, plenty of refrigerators, nice tales and chairs, great decor. This is the ideal amount we would have for our equipment and decor, to create the space that's floating around in our minds.
  • $35,000+ - great espresso machine, great grinders, refrigerated display case, plenty of refrigerators, nice tables and chairs, best decor. Anything over 35k will just make the space look even cooler, and operate more smoothly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the extra funds to throw around, no worries. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share our campaign on social media! This will help us out so much.
  • Tell your friends and family about the new location.
  • Visit us at our current location on Dartmouth Drive.
  • Visit our new location, we can't wait to see you!

Share our campaign on social media! This will help us out so much.

Visit us at our current location on Dartmouth Drive.
Visit our new location, we can't wait to see you!

story:
Coquette

Short Summary

  • Coquette is a small business entirely run and operated by women.  Female empowerment is crucial for society to advance in a civilized way.  Individual servings of homemade strawberry shortcake layered in a Mason jar is served from vintage red triycles to residents and visitors to Montauk, New York.  Coquette merchandise including handkerchiefs, fans, pocket mirrors, clutch purses, fans, sarongs, beach towels, t-shirts and hoodies are also available for purchase.  Enjoying a homemade strawberry shortcake on the beach or after an outdoor concert is the perfect way to sprinkle a little more joy onto your day.  Women are involved in every process of this business from making the strawberry shortcake, selling it from the vintage tricycles to customers, marketing Coquette and sharing in the profits.
  • Financial independence is crucial to attaining a high quality of life.  By starting a small business, I hope to improve the lives of the people we interact with by sharing the delight of a homemade strawberry shortcake served from a woman riding a vintage tricycle.  My hope is that Coquette will be a great success and will allow for many women to get involved and share in the freedom that comes from greater financial independence.
  • Every donation matters!  Please contribute whatever you can because every little bit helps.  This particular business does not require a great deal of capital to get off the ground.  The positive impact of Coquette will be evident in the pleasant experiences of our customers and female business parters alike.  There is no other business like this on Long Island.  It will add to the local flavor and culture of this ocean side community in a delightful way.  Be a part of this positive addition to the Montauk experience and donate today!  Your support is greatly appreciated.  Thank you.
  • Coquette Website: https://coquettemtk.wixsite.com/coquette

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funding Goal: $6,000
  • This seed money will be spent on baking equipment such as an oven, baking pans, mixing bowls, an industrial mixer, Mason jars, ingredients and baking accessories.  It will also go towards the purchase of 5 vintage red tricycles that will be ridden by the Coquette team of women.  Additionally, the full company brand will be developed and introduced.  A website will be constructed and merchandise will be ordered.  Costs associated with obtaining a business license and all necessary permits will also be covered.
  • Coquette merchandise is completely unique.  You will be the center of attention while sporting your Coquette t-shirt, sunbathing on your stylish beach towel or keeping yourself cool with a Coquette fan.
  • Even if the ultimate funding goal of $6,000 is not reached, whatever money is raised will still be applied to the start-up costs described above.  All donations will contribute to purchasing the necessary equipment to launch Coquette.

The Impact

  • Montauk is a quaint town nestled at the end of Long Island that attracts visitors from all over the world.  Many of them flock to the beaches during the Summertime.  There are not currently food vendors that supply any treats while beach goers enjoy the surf and sunshine.  Coquette will provide delicious homemade strawberry shortcake served by a woman riding a vintage tricycle.  Stylish Coquette merchandise will also be sold such as t-shirts, beach towels, sarongs, strawberry measuring spoons, embroidered aprons, fans, clutch purses, pocket mirrors and a fragrance developed especially for Coquette.
  • This is a straightforward business model.  It is a business that will immediately bring joy to the residents and visitors to Montauk alike.  It serves a current need in the community by serving delicious strawberry shortcake to beach goers that have limited food options while spending their day at the ocean side.  It will improve the lives of the women who run it.  Be a part of this impactful new business and make a donation today!  Your contribution is a crucial part of bringing this sparkling new business venture to fruition.

Risks & Challenges

This is a seasonal business.  We are only able to operate the Coquette tricycle food carts on days when it is not raining or snowing.  There are also several months of the year when it will be too cold to operate the Coquette tricycle food carts.  By capitalizing on the current busy Summer Season in Montauk, we hope to have a strong business opening that will sustain us during the quiet Winter months and then be ready for a successful start in the Spring of 2020.

There will be a prolific marketing and PR campaign to ensure that the public knows about Coquette.  There will be special events organized to celebrate the launch of Coquette and to invite further financial support.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share our campaign with your friends and family through email and social media.  Thank you!
  • You can also use Indiegogo share tools to share this exciting campaign with your social circles.
  • Visit Coquette in Montauk and enjoy a delicious strawberry shortcake before taking in the stunning sunset over the ocean.

Your support is greatly appreciated.  Every little bit helps.  Please give what you can afford.  Coquette will positively impact the ocean side community of Montauk, NY by supplying delicious homemade strawberry shortcakes to beach goers, shoppers, tourists and residents served by women riding vintage tricycles, adding to the unique flavor of the town and sprinkling that extra bit of joy onto a Montauk day.  Thank you for helping to launch Coquette.  We look forward to sending you special Coquette merchandise as a gift of appreciation for your generosity.

story:
To All of Our Supporters,

If you haven't checked your mailbox yet, go do it. There should be a nice little package waiting for you. 

That's right, Aura is now OFFICIALLY on the market.

Its about time we wrap up this IndieGoGo campaign. To keep up with us, check out our website at www.aurabeverageco.com. It's still under construction and upgrading every day, but you'll be able to sign up for our newsletter and purchase more Aura!

Post on Instagram how you #DrinkAura and be sure to tag us, @aurabeverageco. Let us know what your favorite flavor is. We're excited to see and share with everyone how you Go For Gold.

Signing off for now,

The Aura Team

story:
- Cocktail Masterclass In a Box - 

  • Go From Complete Beginner to Cocktail Expert -  Cocktail Cards is a perfect guide to teach you how to make professional-quality cocktails. Learn step by step how each cocktail is made and the techniques used by bartenders to create that perfect cocktail every time. 
  • Everything You Need On One Card - Each card will have a list of tools/glassware, ingredients, and step-by-step instructions to make each specific cocktail. No need to search the ends of the internet looking for the right way to make your favorite cocktail. 
  • Access to Instructional Video for Each Cocktail - Sometimes we need visual instruction and we got you covered! Each card will have its own unique QR code that will take you directly to an instructional video by simply pointing your camera phone at the QR code!
  • Learn the history of the cocktail - Relive history as each cocktail has an origin story and gives you a better idea of what flavors and techniques were most popular in that era. 
  • Organized to find your cocktail quickly! - In addition to an index card, the cocktail card set is also color-coded and sorted by alcohol type. Only feeling Vodka tonight? No problem! Look for vodka on the index card or scroll through the color-coded section and find a fun new cocktail with your favorite spirit!


      Front card shows history and image while the back card has step by step instructions.


- Perfect for creating cocktails with friends, a partner, or by yourself - 

 

  • Fun With Friends - Have company over and try various new cocktails. The flashcard format allows everyone to have their own cocktail card and start creating a cocktail masterpiece! No need to wait! 
  • Perfect for Datenight! - Impress your partner by creating their favorite cocktail and show off your history of the cocktail. It might go so well you could even get a second date night! 
  • Learn Your Favorite Cocktails by Yourself - Scared to order anything at the bar you've never had before. Well, now you don't have to spend $15 to test out a new cocktail! As you learn more about the cocktails you enjoy most, you can start to expand your cocktail repertoire and order any drink with confidence!

     



                                           Box designed to look great in any bar setting!



 - Compact, Stylish, and Luxury Product -  

 

  • We put Quality First - Cocktail Cards was designed to elevate any kitchen, home bar, or upscale restaurant with its luxurious design.
  • Its Compact design works in any situation - No matter how big or small your home bar might be these fit perfect in any situation! 
  • Stain Resistant - Each card is layered with protective material to keep it safe from liquids and keeping them lasting longer!
  • Perfect For On The Go - While the cards are larger than your typical flashcard, the box design is compact enough to fit it in any bag or purse. This makes it the perfect companion for a vacation or getaway. Perhaps visiting friends or family. You'll bring the party with you!




                                                            Card sample for the Whiskey Sour


- How to Use the cards - 
 

  • Learning and Mastering the Cocktail - The front of the cards gives you the history and flavor profile of each cocktail. The back of the card will show you everything you need, and all the steps to make your perfect cocktail. It also includes the QR code to the specific video as well! 
  • Flash Card Game - Test yourself with the traditional flashcard set up and learn the ingredients to your favorite cocktails. First, you can test yourself on ingredients, then test yourself on technique. Perfect for the aspiring bartender!
  • Find new cocktails based on what you have available! - Not sure what to do with that bottle of tequila? With cards organized by alcohol, you can easily sort through cards and find an amazing cocktail you never knew existed!



                                                               Recipes sorted by alcohol types



- The easiest and most fun way to learn about cocktails - 

 

  • Better than Learning by ordering at a bar - As a bartender I understand, there's nothing better than having someone do all the work for me! But when you order from a bar you have no idea what ingredients are making your cocktail taste the way it does. Now you know each and every ingredient to learning what makes the best cocktails for you!
  • Better Than a Cocktail Class - With instructional videos and each step needed for your cocktail you have an entire class on your card! Except this is only a fraction of the price AND you can go back and reference each card whenever you want instead of forgetting how to make all the drinks you learned the second you leave the class! 
  • Better Than a Book - Typical cocktail books are incomplete and only offer a limited number of outdated cocktails. Not to mention the shuffling of pages trying to find the cocktail you're looking for. Books are stacked and damaged from getting wet, Cocktail Cards is a massive upgrade to your home bar!

     

                     Clips from the Video: Martinez, one of the oldest cocktails on record



- Access to over 100 instructional videos - 

 

  • Instructional video for Each cocktail - I turned my home bar into a recording studio so I could show you how to make each and every cocktail! 
  • As Easy As Point and Click - Each card has a unique QR Code that links you to the instructional video. All you have to do is use a smartphone or tablet and point the camera app at the QR code. You'll see the link to the video, and simply press the link and you're instantly watching the video!
  • No more guessing on how to use bartending equipment - Watch me use my home bartending kit and everyday kitchen tools to master cocktails! 
  • Bonus Cocktail Recipes and Videos - With your purchase of Cocktail Cards you will get access to special recipes and videos... As if 100 of them wasn't Enough!! 

     

                                                 You can create a cocktail with us!

----  BONUSES And Special Fan Offers!! ----

 

Be Part of our Fan Club Package  ($800 Value) 

  • 2 box Sets - A set of Cocktail Cards for you and another to gift to your friend!
  • 2 Hour Long Private Bartending Lessons - Get 1-on-1 or with a group of your friends bartending class. We will go over how to use all the tools, teach you new cocktails and how to create your own cocktails, and just have fun! You'll be ready to master any cocktail! 
  • Help Create a Cocktail for Youtube - Collaborate with AJ to create a cocktail just for you that will be featured on the Youtube Channel, and you will also get a shout out and credit for the cocktail! 
  • Lifetime Access to the Virtual Classes: We will be launching an online virtual class with regular training videos and live interaction. As a Fan Club member, you will have lifetime access for FREE!

 

 

Purchase the Ultimate Fan Package - Be part of Cocktail Cards!!!

 

  • Create the 100th and Final Cocktail In the set! - Collaborate with AJ and craft your perfect cocktail!! Once we have created your cocktail you will name it, and it will be added to the Cocktail Set as our final and 100th cocktail!! 
  • 2 box Sets - A set of Cocktail Cards for you and another to gift to your friend!
  • 2 Hour Long Private Bartending Lessons - Get 1-on-1 or with a group of your friends bartending class. We will go over how to use all the tools, teach you new cocktails and how to create your own cocktails, and just have fun! You'll be ready to master any cocktail! 
  • Your Cocktail will be featured on youtube: Not only do you get your card in the box set, but your cocktail will be featured on the Youtube channel. You will be invited to guest appear or get a shout out on the channel. 
  • Lifetime Access to the Virtual Classes: We will be launching an online virtual class with regular training videos and live interaction. As a Fan Club member, you will have lifetime access for FREE!
  • My Eternal Gratitude - Getting a business off the ground is no easy task, and you will be a huge factor in helping it become a reality! 

 

Let's Make Cocktail Cards Happen! 

By supporting our Indiegogo you are getting a special discounted price that will only be available during this Indiegogo launch. By making your purchase you are helping to fund our first production run, and helping spread the knowledge of craft cocktails to the world. Time are tough right now, and staying home can be challenging! I just hope that I can help make these tough times a little more enjoyable and a positive light in your life! 

 

Be part of the journey as the Channel grows and Join our Product Launch Group! 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/cocktailcards

 

CHEERS!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Shabz and I was born and raised in London. My parents are from Pakistan and I have always been fascinated by the art, music & culture, especially the FOOD! I have been working in the education department for the last ten years and recently decided to leave my job, leave my home, leave my family and friends to start a new adventure, but was unsure what that adventure was? 

I moved to Berlin with no plan, but reconnected with myself and my skills and decided that this is what I want to do:

Pakistani Brunch Cafe!!!

Brunch is my favourite meal of the day and I enjoy making it for everyone and anyone. Luckily, I have taken after my mother and have discovered that I have inherited her cooking skills and would like to share this with others, but with a western twist.

This is important to me, because the first time in my life I know what I want to do and what I am good at. Sharing my enjoyment of making food for people and hopefully they (you) will enjoy eating it. 

Berlin lacks good quality Indian/Pakistani food and if there is any, its in a restaurant environment. This isn't the environment that I want to create, I would like my customers to be relaxed with a 'Pink Tea' while having a good food at brunch and a chat....food haven :)

This is not only about me starting my own business, it is also to make people realise that Pakistan is a lot more to what the media portrays it to be. We have fantastic food, we have amazing art, we have great music,we have creative and fabulous fashion and we have great people (like me ;) ). 

I want to be a role model for younger (or older - its never too late) Pakistani women in whatever country they are raised in, to be proud of their origin and show that we can pursue our own dreams and not what is stereotyped for us. 

If you believe this a good enough reason...than please support the campaign and contribute!! xxxxxxx

What We Need & What You Get

To start off  with - I need funding for equipment, to start a pop up cafe over the summer and get 'Mama Shabz' name out there. 

The top priority for the funding is for marketing, equipment, kitchen help and to hire venues for the pop up. This is a concept and I need the funds to make this real with YOUR HELP!

Marketing : Market research, business cards, recipe cards, Illustrator, flyers, online advertising, local advertising, etc

Equipment: Knives, chopping boards, kitchen utensils, pots, pans, serving dishes, crockery, cutlery, linen, etc

My end goal is to have a small cafe in Berlin....doing the thing that I love in the city that I love.

story:
Help build a Chocolate Factory!

Since 2005 Chocolate Tree has been creating a movement in Scotland to make luxury chocolate not only delicious and attractive but also affordable, ethical and organic. We currently operate from a small workshop which we have completely outgrown. Thankfully we are a sociable team & love working with each other; an average day in our kitchen is a mixture of laughter and focused concentration from 8 unique individuals. However, we can’t go on working from this small space. 

A new factory means more chocolate!

We have our sights on a brilliant East Lothian location, the former Knowes Farm Shop. It’s a lovely open plan building that will enable us to continue making great chocolate as well as offering weekend workshops and tours.

We are aiming to raise as much as possible to invest in the buildings interior and expensive new equipment. The cost of the project will be closer to £80,000 than £30,000, and we will use additional sources of funding such as loans to make it happen. This is a long term investment into the future of Chocolate Tree and will enable a much loved East Lothian building to continue being used for an artisan food business.

More chocolate means a better world

By contributing to our campaign you are investing in more than just better chocolate. The cacao we buy has a big positive social impact. We pay farmers a premium price, this means they continue to grow cacao, which has a brilliant impact on biodiversity. Cacao is considered a reforestation crop by leading conservationists, this type of agriculture is great for increasing biodiversity on small farms and protecting our endangered environment from deforestation. 

Exclusive perks!

We have excellent exclusive rewards to offer such as 3 bars a month for a year, or 2 day chocolate master course, or an all you can eat reservation at our cafe! If we don't reach our target of £30,000 then all the funds raised will still go towards the new factory.

Other Ways You Can Help

You could really help us by sharing this campaign. We need as much support as possible to make it happen, and we'd really appreciate your help by sharing this campaign with the chocoaholics in your life.

Find out more...

If you haven't heard of Chocolate Tree, take a peek at our website to see what makes us different. Check out our Facebook page, Twitter or Instagram accounts to get the latest news and join our growing following of real chocolate lovers.

 

Chocolate Tree in USA!

Join Valerie Beck from Chocolate Uplift on a short tasting of our chocolate at Alliance Patisserie in Chicago! We sent Valerie a bar of our Madagascar 70% and the original Whisky Nibs. Bean to bar chocolate enthusiasts from all over the world get together for the North West chocolate festival in Seattle every November, we’ll see you there Valerie!

Get in touch... 

Anytime on emailus@choctree.co.uk or once you've backed our campaign, head to the comments and talk to us there!

Ali & Friederike
