story:
Hi there! I’m Tiana Olivo and I have embarked on a journey towards the creation of a kombucha microbrewery, Bruja’s Brew. I plan to expand Bruja’s Brew into wholesale and retail sales. It’s been a great journey so far and it all began during my training at the Austin-based culinary school, The Natural Epicurean Academy of Culinary Arts. This schooling gave me the tools to learn how to brew kombucha and cultivated my kombucha obsession. I originally started making kombucha at home, experimenting with different flavors for months before I began brewing at Apple’s Austin corporate office for their multitude of employees. The kombucha was an instant hit and became widely popular across the campus, selling out almost every week. Seeing this reaction to my brew, I began to dream about having my own trailer with homemade kombucha on tap. From that moment I was focused on making my dream a reality.

From the time I left Apple to kickstart Bruja’s Brew, I created a solid business model and purchased a food trailer to bring innovative and unique kombucha flavors to Austin. Despite having clear goals for Bruja’s Brew in mind, I hit one major roadblock. I have limited financial resources to successfully turn this trailer into a brewery. That’s why I have turned to Indiegogo, and all of you wonderful people, to help me reach my goals. This trailer has the potential to transform kombucha (a commonly bottled and unknown drink) into a celebrated drink that brings people together for their health and happiness. I can’t wait to share the love I have for this drink with all of you.

Your contribution to Bruja’s Brew, no matter the size, will help me spread awareness of the nutritional benefits and the deliciousness of this “magical potion.” Providing kombucha fresh on tap directly from the brewer allows the consumer to learn about the product and it's benefits to good health. What I love most about brewing kombucha is being able to share this knowledge in a healthy, cruelty-free, and unique way. 

It is no secret that every business needs a solid source of funding to produce the necessary materials to begin. Thankfully, Bruja’s Brew requires a relatively low start-up budget. According to my calculations, I’ll need approximately $40,000 to get started. The bulk of this budget (64%) goes towards the food trailer that will be used as a vessel for selling kombucha, healthy shots, and tasty snacks. This 64% includes the cost of the trailer, a generator, taxes, insurance, equipment, paint jobs, rent, and utilities. Other aspects of the budget are included below.

As a thank you for your kind donation, I am offering special perks featuring my original artwork. I have something for everyone’s style and budget, including stickers, hats, t-shirts, totes, koozies, and patches. I also have unique, hand-crafted perks such as bleached t-shirts and embellished denim jackets. These hand-crafted items are limited edition so take advantage while you can! Additionally, when you are in the incredible city of Austin, you can choose to attend a kombucha mixology/cooking class or a private tasting party for two in the heart of downtown Austin. What a better way to invest yourself in Bruja’s Brew than to meet the witch herself!*

Along with merchandise, the trailer will offer a simple yet intriguing menu. There will be roughly six rotating kombucha flavors that may change depending on popularity and season. Also on the menu there will be a variety of healthy shots and snacks. The sample menu below will give you a sneak preview of what's to come but may be subject to change. 

The demand for healthy drink alternatives such as kombucha has risen as people begin to care more and more about their health. Kombucha makes a great alternative to soda because of its fizzy nature, high probiotic count, live enzymes, vitamins and minerals. However, the full range of kombucha's benefits remains relatively unknown. It is of great value to have this product and information about it’s health benefits readily available to people interested in bettering themselves and their families. Looking at a shelf filled with different bottles of kombucha can be overwhelming. You leave the store with a random bottle not really knowing how it can help you or if it is just as unhealthy as a soda. That’s why having a reliable place to go and a brewer to answer questions is so valuable. You will also experience a great atmosphere in an eco-friendly environment. Due to the increasing pollution in our landfills and oceans, all of Bruja’s Brew’s disposables including cups, napkins and straws will be compostable.

It took me a long time to realize that I am not just an artist, I am also an entrepreneur. When I was just 11 years old, a friend and I started a jewelry business where we would make a variety of friendship bracelets, button earrings, and charm necklaces. We would sell to classmates, friends and family and even went so far as to provide an ordering sheet for custom jewelry orders. I eventually developed a unique art form using bleach as a medium for painting t-shirts. That year I created over 80 custom t-shirts and became successful within my community. Later on, I found my passion for jewelry making again (this go around was more than beads and yarn) and started selling elaborate crystal jewelry on Etsy. Creating different forms of art is my biggest passion and being able to share my creations with people is what I do best. I will always be an entrepreneur, an artist, and a creator.

There are many risks and challenges to face when starting this business. It is possible that I won’t reach my goal and have to launch the trailer with what I have. With the cost of living in Austin rising daily, it is possible that there will be rent increases unforeseen in the initial budget. I also have to overcome an emerging market of established kombucha breweries. However, I’m incredibly confident in the product I have produced and I am certain that I can overcome these challenges.

Understandably, not everyone can donate to this business, but fear not because you have access to something just as valuable: your social network. Whether you’re able to donate or not, please take the time to share my page, post a status, call a friend, send a tweet or write out an email. To make it easy, you can use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page to spread the word.

Please know that your support means the world to me and anything you can provide would impact this business immensely. Don't hesitate to contact me with any questions or comments regarding my business, campaign or product. Be sure to follow me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter using the handle: @brujasbrewk to stay updated on my progress towards the first kombucha microbrewery on wheels!

Tiana Olivo

 

 

*Additional Perk Info

All of my merchandise (BBK button, stickers, patched hat, printed tee, koozie, growler, patch, tote) features my original artwork. 

 

Hand-Painted Tee:

This perk comes with a unisex black t-shirt that I hand-painted myself using bleach as a medium. The design features multiple roses surrounding "Bruja's Brew Kombucha" in a large carnival-style font. Check out my Bleachin' page on Facebook to see my previous work with this unique medium.

 

The Whole Shebang:

Please note that each tote bag comes with one t-shirt. When choosing a size for your shirt, select either fitted or unisex. For example: if you want to order a medium sized unisex shirt, then make sure to choose "Size - Fitted: N/A" and "Size - Unisex: M" at checkout. This way you order the correct size in the style of your choice. 

 

In the options labelled "Local Booch Mixology Class" and "Open Room Private Party" each perk comes with two gift bags (The Whole Shebang). 

 

Embellished Denim Jacket:

This perk features a high quality Levi's denim jacket in the size of your choosing. The jacket featured in the pictures is the Ex-Boyfriend Trucker Jacket in Charcoal Fade. This is will be the default style for women unless otherwise specified. All jackets will come with the Witchy Woman Heart Tattoo Patch on the upper right sleeve, the Poisoned Apple Patch above the left breast pocket and the embroidered closeup of the Bruja surrounded by yellow roses on the back of the jacket. The fabric patterns on the back will vary from pictured. 

Elements of the pictured jacket include adorned cuffs, collar, pockets and sequin stars throughout. Because each jacket will be different, these elements will vary in color, style and/or location. 

If you choose this perk, you will have the option of customizing the jacket to your own preferences. We can discuss jacket style, colors, certain embellishments, etc. However, if you choose this perk and do not contact me with any specifications then you will receive the default style in the size of your choosing with embellishments of my choosing. Which will still be pretty awesome.

If you're a dude who wants a jacket than no worries at all! The default style will be the Trucker Jacket in Feign and will not include the Witchy Woman Heart Tattoo patch on the sleeve. The jacket will not have as many embellishments but will still include the embroidered closeup of the Bruja on the back. This option is also open for customization. 

 

Local Booch Mixology Class:

In this class, Tiana will teach you various recipes that include kombucha as an ingredient. You will learn how to make cocktails, salad dressings, smoothies, finger foods all while sampling numerous flavors of kombucha. This class will give you the opportunity to meet the founder of Bruja's Brew in a fun and informative setting.

When choosing this perk, please note that you must live in Austin or will be able to easily travel to Austin to attend the class. You are allowed to bring one guest with you and you both will each receive "The Whole Shebang" gift bag at the end of the class. Refer above for info on correctly ordering the sizes/styles for your t-shirts. More details to follow.

 

Open Room Private Party:

To the special people who donate this large amount, you and a guest will be invited to attend a semi-formal tasting party in downtown Austin. The venue is an outdoor social art installation called Open Room, located in the Seaholm District. 

The party will consist of a kombucha tasting, served as is or as cocktails, alongside champagne, finger foods and dessert. This party will give you the opportunity to meet the founder of Bruja's Brew, as well as other supporters, in the heart of Texas.

When choosing this perk, please note that you must live in Austin or will be able to easily travel to Austin to attend the party. You are allowed to bring one guest with you and you both will each receive "The Whole Shebang" gift bag at the end of the party. Refer above for info on correctly ordering the sizes/styles for your t-shirts. More details to follow. 

 

Perk Inquiries:

Don't hesitate to contact me with any questions regarding these perks before and/or after purchasing. You may also contact me with your denim jacket customizations.

Thank you for your support!

brujasbrew@gmail.com
story_txt: Hi there! I’m Tiana Olivo and I have embarked on a journey towards the creation of a kombucha microbrewery, Bruja’s Brew. I plan to expand Bruja’s Brew into wholesale and retail sales. It’s been a great journey so far and it all began during my training at the Austin-based culinary school, The Natural Epicurean Academy of Culinary Arts. This schooling gave me the tools to learn how to brew kombucha and cultivated my kombucha obsession. I originally started making kombucha at home, experimenting with different flavors for months before I began brewing at Apple’s Austin corporate office for their multitude of employees. The kombucha was an instant hit and became widely popular across the campus, selling out almost every week. Seeing this reaction to my brew, I began to dream about having my own trailer with homemade kombucha on tap. From that moment I was focused on making my dream a reality.From the time I left Apple to kickstart Bruja’s Brew, I created a solid business model and purchased a food trailer to bring innovative and unique kombucha flavors to Austin. Despite having clear goals for Bruja’s Brew in mind, I hit one major roadblock. I have limited financial resources to successfully turn this trailer into a brewery. That’s why I have turned to Indiegogo, and all of you wonderful people, to help me reach my goals. This trailer has the potential to transform kombucha (a commonly bottled and unknown drink) into a celebrated drink that brings people together for their health and happiness. I can’t wait to share the love I have for this drink with all of you.Your contribution to Bruja’s Brew, no matter the size, will help me spread awareness of the nutritional benefits and the deliciousness of this “magical potion.” Providing kombucha fresh on tap directly from the brewer allows the consumer to learn about the product and it's benefits to good health. What I love most about brewing kombucha is being able to share this knowledge in a healthy, cruelty-free, and unique way. It is no secret that every business needs a solid source of funding to produce the necessary materials to begin. Thankfully, Bruja’s Brew requires a relatively low start-up budget. According to my calculations, I’ll need approximately $40,000 to get started. The bulk of this budget (64%) goes towards the food trailer that will be used as a vessel for selling kombucha, healthy shots, and tasty snacks. This 64% includes the cost of the trailer, a generator, taxes, insurance, equipment, paint jobs, rent, and utilities. Other aspects of the budget are included below.As a thank you for your kind donation, I am offering special perks featuring my original artwork. I have something for everyone’s style and budget, including stickers, hats, t-shirts, totes, koozies, and patches. I also have unique, hand-crafted perks such as bleached t-shirts and embellished denim jackets. These hand-crafted items are limited edition so take advantage while you can! Additionally, when you are in the incredible city of Austin, you can choose to attend a kombucha mixology/cooking class or a private tasting party for two in the heart of downtown Austin. What a better way to invest yourself in Bruja’s Brew than to meet the witch herself!*Along with merchandise, the trailer will offer a simple yet intriguing menu. There will be roughly six rotating kombucha flavors that may change depending on popularity and season. Also on the menu there will be a variety of healthy shots and snacks. The sample menu below will give you a sneak preview of what's to come but may be subject to change. The demand for healthy drink alternatives such as kombucha has risen as people begin to care more and more about their health. Kombucha makes a great alternative to soda because of its fizzy nature, high probiotic count, live enzymes, vitamins and minerals. However, the full range of kombucha's benefits remains relatively unknown. It is of great value to have this product and information about it’s health benefits readily available to people interested in bettering themselves and their families. Looking at a shelf filled with different bottles of kombucha can be overwhelming. You leave the store with a random bottle not really knowing how it can help you or if it is just as unhealthy as a soda. That’s why having a reliable place to go and a brewer to answer questions is so valuable. You will also experience a great atmosphere in an eco-friendly environment. Due to the increasing pollution in our landfills and oceans, all of Bruja’s Brew’s disposables including cups, napkins and straws will be compostable.It took me a long time to realize that I am not just an artist, I am also an entrepreneur. When I was just 11 years old, a friend and I started a jewelry business where we would make a variety of friendship bracelets, button earrings, and charm necklaces. We would sell to classmates, friends and family and even went so far as to provide an ordering sheet for custom jewelry orders. I eventually developed a unique art form using bleach as a medium for painting t-shirts. That year I created over 80 custom t-shirts and became successful within my community. Later on, I found my passion for jewelry making again (this go around was more than beads and yarn) and started selling elaborate crystal jewelry on Etsy. Creating different forms of art is my biggest passion and being able to share my creations with people is what I do best. I will always be an entrepreneur, an artist, and a creator.There are many risks and challenges to face when starting this business. It is possible that I won’t reach my goal and have to launch the trailer with what I have. With the cost of living in Austin rising daily, it is possible that there will be rent increases unforeseen in the initial budget. I also have to overcome an emerging market of established kombucha breweries. However, I’m incredibly confident in the product I have produced and I am certain that I can overcome these challenges.Understandably, not everyone can donate to this business, but fear not because you have access to something just as valuable: your social network. Whether you’re able to donate or not, please take the time to share my page, post a status, call a friend, send a tweet or write out an email. To make it easy, you can use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page to spread the word.Please know that your support means the world to me and anything you can provide would impact this business immensely. Don't hesitate to contact me with any questions or comments regarding my business, campaign or product. Be sure to follow me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter using the handle: @brujasbrewk to stay updated on my progress towards the first kombucha microbrewery on wheels!Tiana Olivo  *Additional Perk InfoAll of my merchandise (BBK button, stickers, patched hat, printed tee, koozie, growler, patch, tote) features my original artwork.  Hand-Painted Tee:This perk comes with a unisex black t-shirt that I hand-painted myself using bleach as a medium. The design features multiple roses surrounding "Bruja's Brew Kombucha" in a large carnival-style font. story:
All levels of contributions for this campaign are highly appreciated and all merchandise will be sent out as soon as possible. Thank you in advance for any support and for reading further and learning more about my passion for developing and patenting this game changing product.

Having over twenty years of experience in exercise physiology and a former certified trainer, I have spent a vast amount of personal time looking for quality ingredients that are clinically proven to benefit many aspects of a person’s life. This view became more compelling once I became a volunteer and got involved with special needs athletes and as a volunteer for a hospice organization visiting patients with neurodegenerative diseases. More often than not, I saw many individuals and groups consuming large quantities of refined sugars, processed foods, and other clearly defined unhealthy perishables that do not improve a person’s overall health. This led me spending time and significant research looking for short and long term energy boosting ingredients that can complement a person’s overall health, body, and mind. Therefore, all Cross Energy products will be very nutritious, sugar free, and gluten free. My passion along with certifications, educational degrees and experience in exercise physiology, pharmaceutical and clinical research, finance, and most recently, the completion of a Master’s Degree, truly add to my professional expertise. Lastly, please be sure to view the doctor testimonial of all the clinical research performed.  This information is found in the video that follows the next section of endorsements. 

Endorsements

 

 

Contributions are being sought to assist in minimizing costs for all areas involved in the manufacturing and mass distribution of Cross Energy product.  Further, additional funding is being utilized for the process and addition of other patents submitted for other Cross Energy products. Also, a significant portion of contributions will be utilized for education and brand recognition to specifically target at the same demographics of our competitors that currently carry inferior ingredients. Lastly, Cross Energy will eventually be branding and selling its own apparel.  Some of the introductory apparel is offered and discussed in the perks and contribution section.

story:
The Journey to Real, Sustainable Food

Soooo this is where we're at – we're taking a gamble and putting our names out there and our hearts on the line. We're excited and terrified in equal measure. This is a first campaign for us and we'd love you to join in the fun and join us on our chocolatey mission to prove that real, sustainable food is the way forward.

At the moment our team of chocolate fairies are hand crafting their chocolate creations in a little workshop in rural Warwickshire (it smells amazing!). We love it here and have built fantastic relationships with our suppliers, many of whom are local artisan businesses with fab products just like ourselves. But in order to be serious and share the chocolate love more widely we're looking to kit ourselves out properly for the task at hand – making great tasting, fun chocolates from real and sustainable ingredients and proving that this is a viable way to run a business. 

The funding raised from this campaign will be used alongside our own investment to help us develop and expand our production capacity to enable us to price more competitively for our loyal customers and other businesses. We have a fabulous team of 'chocolate fairies' who are absolutely passionate about bringing real food and chocolate skills to the UK and we'd love to let them unfurl their wings and share their love of chocolate with a wider market which we simply can't do with our current setup.

What we need and what you get

We are looking to raise £20,000 to invest in equipment to support the new machinery that we've purchased for the business. This will enable us to price more competitively so that food made from real ingredients is a more widely available and viable alternative for chocoholics and businesses to purchase. Every penny that we receive through the campaign will be invested in better facilities for chocolate making using real, sustainably sourced ingredients that your grandmother would understand from reading the label.

We're rewarding our backers with options that have never been offered before, aren't available elsewhere and are completely unique to Henley Chocolates. We're excited to fulfil them and to get started in sharing the chocolate love.

The Impact

Once funding is received the funds will be invested in a number of different items to complement the new machinery and support our workshop growth. Your rewards will be completed and fulfilled as soon as possible. We will then be in a position to market our new, bespoke, chocolate products and develop the business in to an artisan chocolate brand that can bring about real change to growers, suppliers, customers and our local community in a very positive way. This campaign has the possibility to change lives for the better.

We built our little chocolate enterprise from scratch on the kitchen table and, now come to realise that our dreams of real, sustainable chocolate having a genuine place in the chocolate market were closer than we could ever have possibly imagined. About five years in to the project Sally (the boss) conceded that maybe it wasn't a hobby after all and perhaps, possibly, it was a 'proper' business that might be able to seriously work as an agent for good in the cocoa industry and beyond.

Risks & Challenges

We know this is a big task and change to an industry established over the last hundred and fifty years can't happen overnight. What we hope, however, is that by proving that real ingredients made in to fabulous food in an environmentally conscious way can be scaled in a commercially viable way without losing the heart of their beliefs.

Our biggest risk is falling flat on our face, not raising adequate funding and looking a little bit silly. It always feels vulnerable to put your neck above the parapet and say that you'd like to see change but we're so sure that this is the way forward we're prepared to put ourselves out there and go for it. 

We've got a business plan to support the changes we'd like to see and we're happy to share it with anyone interested. We think accountability is pretty critical to what we're trying to achieve. We've built this business from the ground up with incredibly limited investment and we're really excited about the possibility of it achieving it's full potential - just like our chocolate fairies spreading their wings to fly.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people aren't in a position to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Obviously donations are very welcome to help us achieve our goals but we'd also love your support in sharing this page on your social media, joining our mailing list to keep up with the project here and spreading the word to friends and family. We'd love to have you on board!

If you've got any questions please shout out - we're happy to answer and share the chocolate love!!

story: NA

What makes us different.

Distilleries and breweries are steadily raising the standard by which to make the consumer experience unique. The ideology behind Local Goat Distillery is no different. Expect an adventurous, yet gentle climate led by owners, Roger and Jessica Wall. Beyond the gin and tonic will be tours and a bar side experience that is refreshingly proper and at the same time, relaxed. The exclusively homemade craft cocktails designed by a master mixologist will complement the upscale bar design intended to resonate with customers as a memorable experience.


Roger’s process inspires the socially spontaneous nature of Local Goat Distillery. Local Goat has partnered with nearby businesses such as Veldhuizen Cheese in Dublin and Bluffdale Vineyards. Roger will use the leftover whey from Veldhuizen as the base for Local Goat vodkas. As milk is a natural sugar, this works well for the distillery’s intentions. With Bluffdale Vineyards, Roger and Jessica have agreed to use the winery’s surplus to make a traditional grappa blend, much like brandy. Processes like these are only the beginning of Local Goat. They look forward to shooting recipes around for sorghum, pecan and even acorn whiskey. As well as using socially responsible practices, they invite local farmers and artisans to sell their wares in a location that is central and provides covered areas, as well as parking.

 

 

Who we are.

Roger and Jessica Wall are equal partners in life, as well as business. They have an 11 month old son, Eli, who runs the show. When they met in the Air Force, Jessica was an Emergency Manager and Roger was in the Fuels Laboratory where he currently holds a supervisor position. After 14 years in the service, the couple intends to manage the distillery well into retirement.


“Grandpa always said “do a job you love”. Well that’s what we’re doing, and we are excited to bring our passion to Granbury.”

 

Why we need help.                      

To lay the financial foundation for our business, the Walls carefully considered what would be needed to bring their dreams to fruition. During construction, they discovered items that cost much more than what was originally estimated.

 

Roger-

“Our distillery will require a giant still that is powered by a source called “3 phase”. When the bid came back 5 times higher for the “3 phase” than expected, it took the wind out of our sails. We need help to finish this place out right. With your help, we can make Local Goat Distillery a legendary gathering place for the community, as well as a refreshing hangout for travelers.”

 

Where your money is going-

$28,000 - to finish the electrical work on our building

$20,000 – to finish renovations such as refinishing the floors, painting all the carports and pipe on the outside of our building

$2,000 – New White American oak barrels for bourbon. These guys are expensive.

Whatever we get extra will go towards operating costs, raw materials, and marketing.

We have already invested over $400,000 in this venture so we are very determined and will open our doors to craft spirit enthusiasts, and people that like to have fun everywhere. 

 

Risks and Challenges

Location, Location, Location. Local Goat Distillery is positioned just north of the town square that occupies approximately 5000 cars a day, and in some cases, more on the weekends. While this is somewhat of a welcomed problem, they are already considering parking needs and the flow of foot and automobile traffic.

 

Other Ways to Help -

We will need help bottling and labeling since we will be doing it by hand. Message us to sign up and have a fun night on us!

Who we are.

Roger and Jessica Wall are equal partners in life, as well as business. They have an 11 month old son, Eli, who runs the show. When they met in the Air Force, Jessica was an Emergency Manager and Roger was in the Fuels Laboratory where he currently holds a supervisor position. After 14 years in the service, the couple intends to manage the distillery well into retirement.
“Grandpa always said “do a job you love”. Well that’s what we’re doing, and we are excited to bring our passion to Granbury.”
 
Why we need help.                      
To lay the financial foundation for our business, the Walls carefully considered what would be needed to bring their dreams to fruition. During construction, they discovered items that cost much more than what was originally estimated. Roger-
“Our distillery will require a giant still that is powered by a source called “3 phase”. When the bid came back 5 times higher for the “3 phase” than expected, it took the wind out of our sails. We need help to finish this place out right. With your help, we can make Local Goat Distillery a legendary gathering place for the community, as well as a refreshing hangout for travelers.”
 
Where your money is going-
$28,000 - to finish the electrical work on our building
$20,000 – to finish renovations such as refinishing the floors, painting all the carports and pipe on the outside of our building
$2,000 – New White American oak barrels for bourbon. These guys are expensive.
Whatever we get extra will go towards operating costs, raw materials, and marketing.
We have already invested over $400,000 in this venture so we are very determined and will open our doors to craft spirit enthusiasts, and people that like to have fun everywhere. 
 
Risks and Challenges
Location, Location, Location. Local Goat Distillery is positioned just north of the town square that occupies approximately 5000 cars a day, and in some cases, more on the weekends. While this is somewhat of a welcomed problem, they are already considering parking needs and the flow of foot and automobile traffic.
 
Other Ways to Help -
We will need help bottling and labeling since we will be doing it by hand. Message us to sign up and have a fun night on us!

story:
About GVBC

A love of craft beer, the outdoors and West Virginia came perfectly together in the creation of Greenbrier Valley Brewing Company in 2014.  If you're reading this chances are you are a lover of one or all of those too.  Welcome to the club.  Our motto "Get out. Explore. Bring beer." fuels our mission of bringing folks like you fantastic beers to take everywhere. 

The last three years have been incredible. We've gone from brewing small batch beers to creating award winning favorites like Devil Anse IPA, Mothman Black IPA and Wild Trail Pale Ale. We started out by kegging our beers, then introduced our very cool cans, and have just put out our fourth flagship: Zona's Revenge Witbier. (Her can design is uhhhh-mazing.) Plus seasonals and small batches of specialty beers.  All along we have pushed ourselves to create new and exciting brews that folks like you will fall in love with. 

We must be doing something right, because we have found we simply cannot keep up with demand.  A pretty good problem to have, true, but folks are left wanting our beers for mountain top picnics, hikes, float trips and everything in between.  This is sad. Our fans are sad.  (And we don't want our fans to be sad.)

So, we need to grow. We need to expand our brew pad with a new 90 barrel fermenter so we can brew more beer so our fans won't be sad.  This happened a bit before our financial timeline allows, which is why we are asking you to help us.  We can hardly make enough beer to keep up with demand in West Virginia, let alone the few places we are in Virginia.  (There's an awful lot of trails, rivers and mountains in the two Virginia's, ya know?) And folks in North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Washington DC, and Ohio want to take us everywhere too. 

 

Why help?

Nestled in a small valley in one of the most gorgeous places on earth, and surrounded by mountains, trails and pristine rivers, GVBC is only one of  26 craft breweries in the state of West Virginia, and the only one in Greenbrier County.  (Full disclosure: there is a distillery and a meadery in the county. Our people like choices.)

We want to grow so that we can become a part of the economic renewal West Virginia so desperately needs.  We want to be that place where the high school Seniors work their last summer.  We want to be the place that those kids come back to as adults and show their friends what they did.  We want to show the world what West Virginia truly is and can be.

Greenbrier County specifically, and West Virginia in general, is in danger of losing its youth to more attractive states that offer better jobs and more opportunities to grow.   Wouldn't it be great if some of them stayed to work in a craft brewery in Greenbrier County?  How very cool would it be if some of them stayed and grew up with us ~ raising adorable kids, buying lovely mountain cabins, bringing their families to work ?  We are already a family business, we'd love to stay that way. 

But we have come to a tipping point.  Produce more and grow into a pretty nice employer for the county and the state, plus make more delicious brews for you and everyone else.  Or. Stay where we are in production, watch our fans go elsewhere because we can't keep up, and eventually have to let our employees go and close.  That would make us really sad.  (And we don't want to be sad.)

 

How can you help?

We need to raise a minimum of $ 27,000.

This will allow us to finance the initial investment to expand our fermenter size, stockpile some grain and hops and maybe get some more kegs.  The fermenter is essential to expansion.  Grain, hops and kegs are too.  Can't make beer without all of them. 

You can donate, even a little bit.  Or you can share our campaign. On Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat or whatever your gig is.  You can email your friends, your mom & dad or your co-workers our link.  Or talk about us. (In glowing terms like "Awesome brewery!")  Or you can play our "Found Devil Anse" game on social media.  You can "Like" us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or Untapp'd.  Or come visit us.  We love visitors. Drink more craft beer. (Hopefully ours, but we like all our family of WV Craft Brewers.)   Or you can send us good thoughts.  Those work too. 

 

All the good feels and then some.

You're going to donate! Yes! Thank you!  What do you get for helping us out? 

Of course there's the good feels you will get for helping us out.  And hugs!  We give good hugs at the brewery.  And "Cheers!"  We give fantastic "Cheers!" at the brewery.  (Some would call us experts at it.) But there's also some very cool perks for donating to our cause. 

Every single person donating to our cause will get their name emblazoned on our "Wall of Fame" in the tap room.  Plus a "Cheers!" on our Facebook page. 

Merch and Swag! We've got decals, koozies, pint glasses, growlers and tees. Oh my. Frisbees and camp cups and more.  Some very cool tap handles of Devil Anse, or Mothman or Sasquatch's foot (Wild Trail Pale Ale)

A few of you will get to be "Brewer for a day" and help brew a small batch with our team and name the brew.  And there's more!  We do live in a state where we can't give away beer, but we can offer some deep discounts.  Very deep.  You could become a card carrying member of our "We took GVBC everywhere!" Club which will get you some nice discounts at the tap room.

 

What happens if we don't raise it all?

In the sad event we don’t raise it all, the money we do raise will be directed to the items of equipment we need. Your contribution will go towards providing us with the tools to produce more brew for more folks in the months and years to come. 

Our promise to you is to do everything in our power, and some things that seem impossible, to raise the funds to grow this brewery into a sustainable, economically & environmentally sound production brewery that your grandchildren will come to appreciate. 

 

You're a brewery.  Aren't you loaded? (Pun intended.)

That's a really good question and we're glad you asked it. 

Surely if we are making all this great beer, we must be making money left, right and center.  But we're not.  Having all the financial power to do the things we need to do would be a fantastic way to do business. The volume of beer we produce is really small compared to other breweries both in state and beyond.  (Seriously.  Tiny.) The actual profit we make doesn't allow us to invest in really big items like fermenters whenever we want.  Or need.  Most of our money  goes towards grain and hops and kegs and cans so we can consistently put out our awesome brews. 

By helping us out you are making a direct impact on a small business in a small state.  We know, because our fans tell us, that we have some pretty special brews, and they need to go everywhere.   We need our fans to lend us a hand, show us you believe in us.

story:
A Kitchen for Everyone 

We fell into a quick friendship over 4 years ago scheming about our local food scene.  Amy was fully entrenched in the local food movement and Susan was working with people to help them live a healthier life.  We first thought about opening a restaurant but soon realized that feeding people was only part of our vision.  We kept coming back to the idea that we wanted to create systemic change in our community and strengthen the ability for everyone, regardless of income, age, health conditions, etc., to be able to eat well.  We started talking to others and listening to what got in the way of healthy eating.  We heard themes: lack of time, energy and inspiration, cost, challenging health conditions, lack of knowledge or skills, and inadequate physical space.  We began dreaming of a place where folks could get the support they needed to figure out each of these obstacles.  A place to grab a meal, take a class, gather with friends, meet new friends, gain inspiration, support others and more. 

It seemed like a lot to take on so we began with just one facet: locally-sourced frozen meals.  For 2 years, we’ve been making 80-100 hand pies or calzones, 20 casseroles and 20 soups every two weeks and delivering to sites in Jericho, Richmond, and Winooski.  We didn't know how people would respond and were amazed when we sold out week after week.  We realized we weren’t alone in our desire to have a quick, easy, healthy, and local meal readily available.  After two years of cooking in Amy's home kitchen, we are ready to expand production while  implementing our full business plan.

Our Plan

By renovating the first floor of the Blue Seal Feeds building we will be creating:

  • A professional kitchen for us to create locally-sourced meals (sold on-site and online) and for other individuals or businesses to rent.  
  • A teaching kitchen for classes, workshops, and hands-on skills building.
  • An event space for gatherings, movie screenings, pop-up dinners, or event rentals.

This space will allow us to bring our dream to life and create a kitchen that is open to the entire community.  We would love to be your go-to place for finding the support you need to eat the best you can. 

Our Team

Amy's experience with school food and farm to school programs, her relationships with local farmers, and her on-the-streets culinary training combined with Susan's health care experience, health coaching, mindfulness training, and entrepreneurial spirit, makes for a unique team.  We strive to be able to listen to the needs of our community and work with you to make your food goals a reality.

Image by Shem Roose

Supporting Local

Every meal we sell incorporates as many ingredients as possible from our local farmers and producers.  We buy most of our vegetables and proteins from Jericho Settlers Farm, Maple Wind Farm, The Farm at VYCC, Lewis Creek Farm, and Adam's Farm. We process huge amounts of vegetables during their peak growing season and store them for use during the winter and spring.  We buy beans from Vermont Bean Crafters, tortillas from All Souls Tortilleria, flour from King Arthur Flour, butter from Cabot, bread from Sweet Simone’s and sweeten all of our dough with maple syrup with Slopeside Syrup.  We believe that buying local helps create a strong local economy.  We also like knowing our farmers and their practices. 

Social Entrepreneurship

We are excited to be a part of a growing type of company that uses business as a force for good and as a means to tackle important social issues.  Rather than structuring ourselves as a non-profit, we have integrated our social mission into the fabric of our company.  At the heart of this mission is our desire to support any member of our community as they navigate towards their best relationship with food.  We will be incorporating a spectrum of services over the next year–from classes and workshops to pre-made meals and inspirational gatherings–and also creating a ‘Feed it Forward’ program that allows those with an ability to pay more to support those who can’t. This model combined with our intentional approach of listening carefully to the needs and wishes of our community has the potential to create powerful change at a local level.

What We Need & What You Get

Moving from Amy's certified home kitchen into the Blue Seal Feeds building is a HUGE step. We've become well-versed in areas we never expected: zoning, permits, Fire Marshall inspections, watts vs. volts vs. amps, equipment purchases, interior renovations, and more. At the same time we still need to purchase a ton of local food during the peak growing season in Vermont.  We are looking for support from our community to be able to do it all.  In return, besides our undying love, we will be sharing with you some tokens of appreciation.  Everyone that donates will get a personal note of thanks as well as a favorite recipe of ours. Donate more and the list grows.  We can't do this without you, so thank you for supporting our dream!

Risks & Challenges

We know it's ambitious to launch so many aspects of our model at once when each one could be a business in its own right. As we have started our renovations we've also met unexpected challenges, including: upgrading an entire electrical system, replacing walls, repairing a ventilation hood system, and more.  There is a lot to figure out but we are confident that we can accomplish what needs to be done to make our dream a reality!  Your support will help us rise up and successfully overcome these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please support us in any way you can!  We understand that not everyone can contribute financially.  If you believe in our campaign, don't be shy about spreading the word.  Each of you has an idea, we are sure of it, and we’d love to hear them all.  Stop by, email, or give a call to let us know how we can best support you.  We want to make your food goals a reality, but to do that, we need YOU to help us make our dream a reality. You are part of what makes our community so great.  We can't wait to welcome you to the table!

Image by Shem Roose

Video by Shem Roose

Image by Shem Roose 
Video by Shem Roose

story:
Short Summary

Please help us take advantage of a rare opportunity for expansion.

Firewheel Coffee is a local, independent coffee shop that has served the Garland, Texas, community for five years, earning rave reviews for our hand-made beverages and outstanding service. We have 4.8 stars on Facebook, 4.5 stars on Yelp, and 4.8 stars on Google Plus (all out of five stars) spanning hundreds of reviews.

Because of our reputation, we have been invited to partner with a developer who wants to build four food courts (called Urban 8) in high-density, high-traffic areas. We would be one of eight vendors in each food court, expanding our business from one to five locations in a time span of about two years.

This build-out schedule for the Urban 8 locations is extremely aggressive. Consequently, our available capital is currently insufficient to take advantage of this opportunity. Additionally, equipment failures (freezers, espresso machine, HVAC) at our Garland shop have set us back as well.

Instead of letting this opportunity pass us by, we're coming to you for help. We're hoping to raise $60,000 to help with build-out and equipment purchase for the new location, and equipment repair for our current location.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $10,000 for equipment upgrade and repair for the current shop, and $50,000 for equipment and signage for the first new Urban 8 shop.
  • Incentives include coffee mugs (of course), and tote bags with exclusive artwork, and even free coffee for life at the highest contribution level. And everyone who contributes will have their names on our wall of appreciation at our first new Urban 8 location.

The Impact

Being invited to participate in the Urban 8 food court expansion is a rare opportunity for an independent shop like ours. We are humbled to to have the invitation, and we intend to make the most of it and show the world that there's a viable alternative to corporate coffee. All we need is some additional capital. And, given the chance, we'd rather share the success that opportunity brings with those who believe in us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute, we completely understand. But if you still want to help, we'd be grateful if you could get the word out by sharing this campaign on social media. 

Thank you.

Brian and Robin

story:
Summary

My name is Evan and I am from the United States. After serving in the military I found a home here in Okinawa unlike anywhere I have ever been including my home. After getting married and making many local friends I realized that so many here had no idea what good cheese or bacon was. I set out on a journey to give my friends and Japanese family a taste of Heaven! I learned cheese-making at a local dairy farm under the guidance of man from England. Then I got to work experimenting with a variety of cured meats like pancetta, capocollo and smoked bacon. After making many new friends and having them try my food I have come to the realization that I must open a restaurant.

 Opening a restaurant as been a dream of mine for a long time and now it seems to be possible. The only issue is our initial funding in order to receive assistance from the local business associations. We have found a location next to a small goat farm with a gutted store ready to be transformed into this dream. I have worked hard my whole life and dedicated myself to serving my country and my supporting my family. Starting this restaurant will not just be the fulfillment of a dream but an example of dedication and hard work to my children and others who know me and have supported me this far. 

My plan is to make this restaurant a place that brings communities together to socialize and bridge the gaps between the local people and the foreigners living here, and I can think of no better way then to sit down together and eat cheese and meat. By helping us you will be assisting us on achieving this goal of sharing and fusion of cultures. The 2020 Tokyo Olympics are right around the corner and I believe this restaurant would be a great place to gather to watch the games!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get started we need roughly $20,000. This will serve to show the bank that we have enough finances on-hand to support them approving a business loan. Once the loan is approved these finances will go towards supporting my family for the first year so I do not need to take a salary.

Some of the perks we will be offering will be dining vouchers, T-shirts, bacon and cheese making classes to hosting parties for small groups!

If we cannot reach our goal the funds will still serve the same purpose however I will have to take a small salary from the restaurant's earnings. 

The Impact

Another positive impact this restaurant will have will be on providing families of US service members a place to come and feel at home. I will have a traditional American breakfast available every Saturday and Sunday starting at 7 AM. I will have other options like an Irish or English breakfast as well.

Risks & Challenges

This risks with this endeavor are high. I am planning on quitting my current job to be a full-time restaurant owner and cook. So if this does not work than it will be a huge financial hurdle for my family. There is the possibility of not having enough customers to generate sufficient income to pay our bills. There is also the chance that we might not get loan approval.

To solve these challenges we plan on using the existing business network we have made with friends and colleges to spread the word, as well use the customers we already have who order bacon from us every month. we believe these options plus the utilization of social media will allow us to succeed. If we are not immediately approved for a business loan then we will continue to work hard at finding more backers, and banks that will eventually support us. It will happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot help us financially then I ask you to share this campaign with as many friends and family members as possible on all your social media accounts and through word of mouth! This will only be possible with your help. I thank you all so much in advance! Also, don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools!

After getting married and making many local friends I realized that so many here had no idea what good cheese or bacon was. I set out on a journey to give my friends and Japanese family a taste of Heaven! I learned cheese-making at a local dairy farm under the guidance of man from England. story:
Bourbon and the Biblical Lands: A Love Story

Bourbon and the State of Israel have been two of the great loves in our lives.  Their presence for us is constant, and we're thrilled at the opportunity to combine those passions into our new product, 'Slingshot', an American-style whiskey. We feel at peace looking at the lush, green Ella Valley, the place where David slew the giant Goliath with nothing more than a slingshot.

 

Introduction

The global demand for whiskeys continues to grow rapidly, making the whiskey market extremely exciting for contributors. The booming global demand has been accompanied by a proliferation of boutique distilleries.

Indeed, global whiskey manufacturers have been scrambling to keep up with the increased taste for liquor around the world.

Bourbon, the distinctly American corn-based whiskey, is also on the rise, in what Fortune Magazine is calling “The billion-dollar bourbon boom”.

 

Trailblazing biblically inspired bourbon in the Holy Land

Based on the success of bourbon around the world, we want to create Israel’s first American-style Whiskey distillery. We hope to trailblaze the Israeli whiskey palate and bring an added level of sophistication to the country's cocktail culture just starting to take off.

It will be crafted using only the finest local crops and ingredients including natural spring water from the Ella Valley.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will be allocated principally toward the acquisition of additional copper stills and fermenting tanks, to aid us in not only increasing production of our flagship product, but to allow us more flexibility in experimenting with additional products in the near future. Approximately 70% of the funds will go toward this effort, while about 30% will be utilized to secure the appropriate cooperage (barrels) we require.

With your help, we expect to begin regular production towards the summer of 2018, and, of course, to begin aging our first batches shortly thereafter, which would allow us to begin bottling by fall 2019. While our initial batches will be produced with grain purchased from various local suppliers, we expect to harvest our own corn in the spring and summer that will follow.

 

Perks

  • Contribute $25 and receive a special “Indiegogo Edition”, 100ml bottle of 'Slingshot' American-style whiskey
  • Contribute $36 for a set of 4 wooden coasters sporting the' Legends Distillery' logo
  • Contribute $50 for 1-year membership status including 10% off any purchases of 'Slingshot' or merchandise from the gift shop
  • Contribute $100 and receive a baseball cap, embroidered with the Legends Distillery logo
  • Contribute $200 and receive a high-quality polo shirt, embroidered with the Legends Distillery logo
  • Contribute $500 and receive your own personalized, numbered, Premium Reserve Series bottle of 'Slingshot'
  • Contribute $5,000 and receive your own barrel (roughly 15 gallons) of the first batch of 'Slingshot', American style Whiskey, emblazoned with your name.
  • Contribute $15,000 and receive a large customized barrel, containing over 200 bottles worth of our premier spirit, emblazoned with your name.

Please note that other denominations of funds can also be pledged.

 

Additional Info

Our proprietary aging process will allow production of a fine, high quality spirit in a small fraction of the time it would normally require.

The success of Legends Distillery will be driven by over 100 years combined experience in bourbon production, a profound understanding of the Israeli and American markets, and strategic partnerships allowing for creative marketing, efficient production and smooth distribution. We are confident that this recipe will win the hearts and palates of all bourbon lovers, resulting in an exciting investment opportunity for you.

 

About the location

Unlike the pre-existing distilleries, Legends Distillery hopes to augment Israel’s tourism industry by offering a product drawn from domestically harvested grains, and inspired by local biblical legend.

Located in the Judean Hills, about 25 miles southwest of Jerusalem, Ella Valley is the site of the Biblical story of David and Goliath, as told in the Book of Samuel. In that battle, David the shepherd boy, years before he became the mighty King David, killed the giant Philistine Goliath with a single stone – from his Slingshot.

The Ella Valley is also filled with vineyards. Ella Valley is home to 20% of Israel’s vineyards.

It is thus our hope that tour groups of all denominations and affiliations will “top off” their visit to the valley with a Legends Distillery tour.

We intend to simultaneously market to Israeli and American customers, while offering our facility and tasting room for corporate and social events, and connecting the distillery and product to the Bible and the land of Israel.

It is our hope and expectation that tourists the world over will visit and enjoy, bring a bottle or two back to their countries of origin, and become brand ambassadors for Legends Distillery.

story:
Krishna Cow Sanctuary

We are a cow sanctuary on the Big Island of Hawaii that evolved from a small backyard dairy, based on the teaching of Srila A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhhupada. We are attempting to change the dairy industry by providing an alternative example; a model that requires no killing, where calves can drink from their mothers, and the males and retired mothers are allowed to live out their lives in peace!

 

As you can imagine, this is a huge committment and basically an endless service. To fund this endeavor, we sell our excess cruelty-free dairy products. However, we are limited to what we can sell online (too expensive and risky to ship most milk products). That is why we are very interested in getting a state-of-the-art freeze dryer from a reputable brand, Harvest Right. This will allow us to freeze dry our dairy products, and especially our whey, enabling worldwide distribution. 

 

WHAT WE NEED!

The freeze dryer we wish to purchase is from Harvest Right and is currently selling for just under $3000 (plus more for shipping)! This will allow us to freeze-dry nearly 1500 gallons of milk a year. We hope to invest the profits in multiple freeze dryers eventually, allowing us to supply cruelty-free milk to the world!

 

Cant Afford to Contribute?

Thats okay! Please help by sharing our campaign and our facebook page, facebook.com/krishnacowsanctuary

Also let your friends know about our online shop! krishna-cow-sanctuary.myshopify.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chris Gugel, and I'm the owner and founder of Maestro Winery. I live in Jacksonville, Fl where I have spent time teaching in the arts and making wine!

Since moving to Jacksonville, I've been astonished at the growth of the craft brewing and distilling scenes, however, the wine scene is another story. There are currently no wineries in Jacksonville. With a population pushing 1 million people, the city of Jacksonville is long overdue for a winery that can join the craft and boutique alcohol production arena in Northeast Florida. 

Maestro Winery differs from a traditional winery in two ways: Maestro Winery is an urban winery concept, and it will incorporate a strong arts presence to provide a complete wine experience to guests.

The urban winery concept is a great way to fully integrate Maestro Winery into the heart of Jacksonville. Jacksonville prides itself on revitalizing many different and unique neighborhoods and districts within the city. Citizens enjoy visiting these unique areas for food, entertainment, recreation, and shopping. Maestro Winery will be nestled in the Riverside and Five Points area, located on the west bank of the St. John's River.

The arts and entertainment scene in Jacksonville is already established and well cultivated by the community. Maestro Winery will compliment and add to the arts scene by offering live entertainment and instruction in the arts. All of this will combine to create a complete and memorable wine experience for guests.

Wines produced at Maestro Winery will range from traditional varieties (such as Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon) to muscadine and country wines. The muscadine wines will use Florida grown muscadine grapes, while the country wines will incorporate unique ingredients such as blueberries, strawberries, honey, citrus, and even rose petals! Many of these wines have already won medal recognition at prominent wine making competitions, including gold medals for muscadine wine, chocolate orange wine, and rose petal wine. Even though the winery will offer a wide variety of wines, we will focus on small batches of each variety in order to create a truly craft and boutique product that offers more than a traditional wine experience to our guests.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to collect $30,000 or more.  The equipment required to produce high quality wines is very costly. The money raised during this campaign will be used to obtain only the best equipment to ensure the highest quality wine production.  Any additional monies generated will be used for necessary renovations and to keep our leases paid during this interim period where we wont be able to produce wine or generate revenue.  

What do contributor's get for showing their support?  We've set up a number of options to choose from to suit any taste or budget.

Our lower cost options include wine enjoying essentials such as wine glasses and corkscrew, all brandishing the Maestro Winery logo. Higher support options throw in free wine club membership and prizes, both of which include selecting one of our premium wines to enjoy. The premium perk allows contributors to be forever memorialized by sponsoring a select variety of wine, which includes your name on that particular vintage of wine!

The Impact

To make Maestro Winery a reality we will need help.  We want to build a winery that our community and you as a contributor can be proud of.  The winery will be engrained into the community and the arts for all to enjoy. We will compliment and enhance the already thriving arts scene and community pride.

Your generosity as a contributor cannot be thanked enough.  Simply put, without you none of this will be possible.

Risks & Challenges

The process of starting a winery can be a lengthy one. Once the space is acquired and the equipment installed, it will take a few months before the first wines will be ready to bottle. Even with this wait time, we will waste no time in reaching out to the community. Arts instruction will be able to start prior to wine being finished, so we can get a jumpstart on our goals.

With such a long todo list ahead of us, I have sought the help and assistance of many qualified individuals. I've been working extensively with individuals who are familiar with the startup process and have implemented multiple startups in the past. I've also been working closely with Florida vineyards and wineries to become better acquainted with the rules, regulations, and trends in the wine industry, especially as it relates to Florida. Florida currently does not boast many commercial wineries, so the industry is willing to assist and anxious to see a growth in Florida wineries!

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing to our campaign isn't within your capabilities, please help us to spread the word about Maestro Winery in the following ways:

  • Follow Maestro Winery on Facebook and Instagram to see the latest updates on our progress an products. Share our pages to help us get the word out!
  • Check out our website for more information and to sign up for our mailing list to receive up to date information and product specials.
  • Don't forget to share our campaign using the IndieGogo share tools!
